  What We Need & What You GetThe Dino Community is ready to start out as a bilingual website with activities, stories, games and songs.
Funding is needed for web design to update the original website created in 1998 (which you can see at the end of this presentation) and artwork to illustrate the stories and activities.  

A few dollars will go to computer and software upgrades.  None of this money will be going toward salaries or remuneration of the officers.
Funding is needed to master the 8 existing songs and complete two more songs, plus production and marketing of the CD.

 We also need money for further development of the game and adding sound effects and music.  The game application already exists.

As a reward for having faith in this project, you will be entitled to a T-shirt, Tote bag, or the opportunity to name a Dino character.  Please see our "Perks List".   As this project grows, there will be many more "ground floor" opportunities offered to initial contributors. We always love to make new friends, too!
 Funds will go to expand on the initial community and characters.  Should we not reach our goal, it will be disappointing, but several other avenues of funding, including an SBA loan are being pursued.
   The Impact This is a concept that parents and grandparents can trust, and have no doubts about it including questionable or morally unacceptable content.   Kids will be glued to the website learning about dinosaurs, following the stories and activities of the characters with new content created every week.
In my current test group of children, ages 6 to 12, it has been DEMANDED of me to continue writing as many stories and songs as fast as I can.  
"WHO is that?"  they want to know. . . "WHERE is Dinoville?"  
"Why didn't Billy Brachiosaurus make the basketball team in 'Hoop Hazards'?"
"What did Dixie-Dawn and the hamsterasauruses get for Christmas in the 'Christmas in Dinoville' story?"
I apologize if my descriptions seem vague or ambiguous, but I have already had several experiences with other people trying to take this project.   Having a fun dino-based bilingual project will revolutionize activities and bring more positive thinking to children.    Risks & Challenges  At age 24, I was CEO of a multi-million dollar business in New York.  Since then, I have created an award-winning arts program in Connecticut and produced Island-wide Music Festivals in the Bahamas.  I have great support with intelligent, experienced colleagues whom I have known for over 15 years and know I can trust and rely upon.  
      Personally, I have about $50,000 invested in this already, along with years of work.  My current "greatest challenge" is to get funding to finish the song album and produce it for marketing (2 more songs are needed about $8,000); have another generation of art rendered for the new website, album cover, story illustration, etc. (approx. $5,000); and then there is getting appropriate applications written for the dino game, so it can be online and cell. phone friendly.  We would like to get a short animation created for the website, too.
      We are a good group.  Trustworthy and hardworking individuals who believe in promoting better and fun content for children.  There is no doubt in my mind that we can overcome any obstacle.    Other Ways You Can Help We are taking resumes from artists and web designers, and are looking for a toy manufacturer.  Please spread the word and make some noise about The Dino Community.
Forward our Campaign to everyone in your address book! 

https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/the-dino-community/ 
AND

www.facebook.com/thedinocommunity
 Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!   You just cannot go wrong with this!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
How the 5th Annual Black365 Knowledge Bowl Came to Be...

Growing up I thought that African Americans were destined to be one, or all of the following: athletes, drug dealers, gang members or entertainers. 

At the age of 14 I underwent heart surgery, which ended my dreams of ever becoming a basketball star. With more time on my hands because I was not longer practicing, I began to pick up books on Black history. For the first time I saw myself reflected on the pages of world history. I discovered that Black people were more than just athletes, drug dealers, gang members and entertainers - but architects, engineers, astronauts and more.

Inspired by this information, I became my high school's first-ever African American valedictorian, was accepted to eight universities and received approximately $50,000 in scholarships!

The Black365 Knowledge Bowl was created with the intention of being the SPARK that sparks the mind of tomorrow's great leaders! During the Black365 Knowledge Bowl teams of young people challenge one another, and themselves, as they answer 101 questions in world history. This is a jeopardy-style quiz competition, that is fast paced and rewarding for both the young people and the audience...with a positive lasting impact for everyone involved.

Check out the Black365 Knowledge Bowl Los Angeles Time Article by clicking here.

What We Need

Every participant walks away with scholarship money and prizes:

  1. First place: $250 (for all four team members) = $1,000
  2. Second place: $150 (for all four team members) = $600
  3. Third place: $75 (for all four team members) = $300
  4. Fourth place: $25 (for all four team members) = 100

The above scholarship amounts also come with:

  1. Trophies
  2. Medals
  3. Certificates of Participation
  4. Books to continue their studies
  5. Inspirational posters and other works of art

There you have it, $2,750 in the hands of the deserving college-bound high school students.

What You Get

For your contributions you will receive the satisfaction of knowing you assisted in the ascension of a young person’s life academically and socially! 

Also, depending on the level of support, you will have your name, or your organization’s name recognized in the official program booklet. 

You will receive a photograph of the 2015 Participants and an autographed Black365 Calendar, which is the basis for the Black365 Knowledge Bowl.

You can attend the 5th Annual Black365 Knowledge Bowl and promote your business with banners, decorations, give-a-ways, goodie bags... and more. An event program will be mailed to you.

Premiere recognition in press releases and publicity material

The Impact

  • Contributing to the 5th Annual Knowledge Bowl lets young people know there are people who exist in the world that care about them and their future
  • From the four previous Knowledge Bowls, 56 participants are now in college and credit their Knowledge Bowl experience for having a significant impact on their lives.
  • The average G.P.A. of a Knowledge Bowl participant is 3.25

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about the 2015 Black365 Knowledge Bowl!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us grow!
  • Follow us on Social Media (Instagram, FaceBook and Twitter) 
See you there:

March 14, 2015 2:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.

44339 Beech Ave. Lancaster, CA 93534

This event is FREE


Jamaal Brown

Black365 Knowledge Bowl Organizer

story:
My name is Thobela Duma, and I am 21 years old. I was born and still live in Khayelitsha, Cape Town. When I was 17 years old, photography became my biggest passion. Photography allows me to share my personal as well as my community's stories. It is my dream to complete film studies so that I can take this career more seriously and continue sharing stories. 

I am launching this campaign to fund my first year of Bachelor of Arts in film studies at SAE South African Institute. I need R70 000 ($7000) that I use it to pay my school fess excluding my Textbook and my stationary  cost about $1000. I will need about a sum of $8000.I did all the Calculation and got the school fees plan on how to pay. I will be staying at home and using public transport to travel to school. I want to study Filming because it will allow me to share some of the stories that happening in khayelitsha and never heard of them and Stories that are not easily easily told about my community.I hope to share the skills that i will learn to aspiring young photographers and film makers in Khayelitsha township. 

When I'm done with my degree it will help to shape also other filmmakers that will be filming after me. The degree will give me more insight of how are things are done as a film maker. If you are investing in my education you are not wasting your money because my motivation of wanting to do filming is to give to my community by teaching the youth of how is important to follow what you love and not do what your parents want you to do. I just want to do my best to also motivate the next generation of Khayelitsha to do filming and art.

I was raised and still live with my single 67 year old mother, 6 siblings, and 3 nephews. My eldest sister is the only family member generating an income and supporting us. For this reason, I am seeking financial support to complete my film studies.  

When I was 17 years old I joined an organisation called Ilizwi Photo Club. Here, we enable youths in under-resourced communities to creatively express themselves and raise social awareness through photography. Through Ilizwi I have attended youth conferences in Johannesburg, exhibited my works in exhibitions and appeared on the TV show Hectic Nine-9. I will also be part of a television series being released this year called +27 Social Innovators of South Africa (http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3684364/).You can check my photos on my Facebook page(https://www.facebook.com/DumaPhotographer).I also work with an organisation called  Re.Think Leadership - promoting dialogue across boundaries existing in contemporary South African society and encouraging youth leadership. I was also part of Artistic Eyes here in Cape Town, wish was being runned by Jess Cross.It is my passion to inspire young people in my community to create change that they want to see. I hope to create films that can do the same. 

I hope to create documentaries that show all the different dimensions of Khayelitsha Township. It is not just a place ridden with crime and social issues where people need to be 'saved' like the media mostly displays it as. Khayelitsha is home to many - it is filled with colourful, interesting and beautiful stories too.

With your support I will be able to apply my ideas into film and continue telling stories that spark change. I will also be able to teach people through films that i will be making how is khayelitsha beautiful from inside and out. You will be not wasting your time and money to invest to Thobela Duma. I thank you in advance for supporting me and for me to follow my dream and be heard.

story:
CoroBot Spark – the Simple, Powerful and affordable Robot

CoroWare Robotics Solutions, is a company with a rich history in supporting and developing robotic solutions and hardware for academic and scientific research. Our team has developed the CoroBot Spark – a $400 robotics kit powerful enough to tackle nearly any problem you can throw at it.  We are seeking your support so we can retain the low price point when we start manufacturing. 



Why is it cool (What makes this so important/special)?

There are hundreds of robots currently available on the market. The CoroBot Spark is different.  It has open source software and hardware that can be easily modified.  The other platforms are either inexpensive and not powerful or really expensive closed systems.  The CoroBot Spark is simple, powerful and affordable.

-  We have combined the widely popular Raspberry Pi platform with our custom Pi Hat – this allowed us to combine all the required circuitry to: drive motors, process video, read sensor data, and so much more!

-  No glue or special tools required. CoroBot Spark can be assembled in less than 30 minutes – using the included screwdriver!


-  It has a built in LiPO battery with battery recharging circuitry. In addition to using a complete CPU in the system,  it can be 100% free standing, not requiring any additional computers to program. 

-  4x discrete motor drivers, and 3x high power PSoC chips to handle all the sensors and low end hardware control you can throw at it. 

-  The kit can easily be modified and/or built within an afternoon. The entire kit, excluding the Pi Hat, is designed to be made at a local makerspace using 3D printing and laser cutting. 

-  The software is powered by Python and all open source.


The Power of learning to code: Our goal to make robotics education available and affordable for anyone.

The purpose of this project is to build a community. We believe that students of today need the skills to obtain the engineering jobs of tomorrow. Learning to program and build are the most powerful skills anyone can learn.

The CoroBot Spark was built to be used in schools. This is why, from the ground up, the CoroBot Spark was designed to have support for Python – one of the most popular & easy languages to learn to code.


Everything from basic control to the cross platform GUI is written in Python and is provided for free through the popular version control software Git on our public repository on GitHub. This allows and even encourages people to look at the code, modify it, and share what they have done with it to the world.

By design CoroBot Spark chassis and accessories were designed to be reproduced on a laser cutter and 3D printers, tools that are typically available at local Makerspaces, Techshops, and even some schools. Don't have access to these tools? We will still provide the entire kit to be purchased.

How can you help?

Even if you aren't interested in getting a CoroBot Spark kit for yourself but believe in our vision of providing better educational tools to students, by contributing even the smallest donation of $5, $10, or $10,000 will go a LONG way towards helping those who need our help the most. By contributing to this campaign, you are standing with us in helping students of the future get the tools they need to tackle the problems of tomorrow.

By contributing in whatever fashion you can, it will help us in develop not only the hardware related with this project but also the free and open software, educational materials, and even help support future outreach events & projects. Not only will your support help us getting this project off the ground and into the real world, but it will also let us know that we are on the right path and there are others who believe in our vision.

Powered by Python 

Not only will the CoroBot Spark be powered by Python but each Debian image will come preloaded with powerful tools like Anaconda, SciPy, iPython Notebook, and many other great tools. These are software packages designed to be powerful enough to manipulate any data set of nearly any size and quickly, making the CoroBot Spark a valuable tool for teaching subjects like Mathematics, Computer Science, and about AI. If you ever have issues with the software on the CoroBot Spark, this same software image will be available online through the CoroBot Spark GitHub account which makes reseting the units back to "factory" settings a breeze.

Kit Contents:

Unlike all of the robotics platforms out there that you see today that use the Raspberry Pi or Arduino as the primary platform, the CoroBot Spark provides everything you need to build a powerful robot straight out of the box. At the very core of the Spark is the CoroBot Pi Hat, a fully engineered Pi Hat that combines motor drivers, powerful microcontrollers, servo drivers, and so much more into a single board that doesn't require ANY breadboarding, jumper wires, and NO FRUSTRATION. It's all designed to be plug and play. 


Driving the powerful CoroBot Pi Hat is the latest and greatest offering from the Raspberry Pi Foundation, the Raspberry Pi 2. This powerful single board computer is capable of running both Linux AND Windows 10. Powered by a Quad Core ARM chip and 1GB of RAM, makes this little CPU an ideal application for any robotics project. 

Included with each full kit are 4 small yet powerful metal geared motors, front facing ultrasonic sensors, pan/tilt mechanism for the Pi Camera, and IR distance sensors.

Hardware specifics:

The CoroBot Spark is primarily powered by the Raspberry Pi 2 which handles much of the higher level computing for tasks like machine vision and path planning algorithms. Supporting the Raspberry Pi, is our custom developed Pi Hat which uses a combination of the PSoC 5LP and PSoC 4 (4200 Series). The beauty of the PSoC from Cypress is that it features the power of digitally reprogrammable logic. This means that you can customize which pins do what on the fly. This is very similar to how an FPGA works, but with the simplicity and power of a microcontroller. 


For sensors, the CoroBot Spark comes fully equipped with two front facing ultrasonic sensors, a front facing IR sensor, the Raspberry Pi Camera mounted on a pan/tilt mechanism, and then a rear facing ultrasonic sensor. All of which plugs directly into the Pi Hat, leaving almost all of the Raspberry Pi GPIO and additional Pi Hat pins available to be expanded upon. 

Driving the Spark are four independent DC motors with high power gear boxes. This allows high control of each wheel as well as the potential to replace the wheels with omni-directional wheels. 

Any robot would be incomplete without special consideration to it’s power source or batteries. On the CoroBot Spark, there is a single 7.4v 2200mAh LiPO battery that can be recharged onboard simply by connecting the supplied power adapter. No more fussing with AA's or special chargers, it's all built in!


Risks and challenges

As professionals, planning for the unforeseen is what we do best. By leveraging the professional experience of the CoroWare Robotics Solutions group, we are confident after successful funding of the CoroBot Spark project will only have three main risks:

1) Large scale production: We have already built numerous prototypes that have been tested by engineers along the way but things can change once they have been scaled up. This is why we have partnered with specialists who specialize in automated PCB manufacturing and large production laser cutting services. Luckily by being physically near these companies, we can resolve issues quickly when they arise.

2) Fulfillment: By being in the business of developing robotic platforms for business and academic research, we don't ship things until they have been fully tested and know that they will work straight out of the box. This is why we have built into our fabrication processes, testing procedures to ensure that each kit delivered is like the next, perfect.

3) Software Support: The last major risk is software support. This is why the entire project has been focused on developing a robot based upon Python, one of the fastest growing programming languages that is both easy to use and extremely powerful! Secondly, by combining a full time engineering staff with an open source project that will be openly available via GitHub, problems, if there are any, will be resolved quickly and effectively.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute you can still help us ultimatelyIf reach our goal!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about the CoroBot Spark
  • You can spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo site
  • Contact us if you know of a high school or robotics club that we could talk to
  • Let us know if you would like us to do an event at a hackerspace

each kit delivered is like the next, perfect.
3)
Software Support: The last major risk is software support. This is why the
entire project has been focused on developing a robot based upon Python, one of
the fastest growing programming languages that is both easy to use and
extremely powerful! Secondly, by combining a full time engineering staff with
an open source project that will be openly available via GitHub, problems, if
there are any, will be resolved quickly and effectively.
Other Ways You Can Help Even if you cannot contribute you can still help us ultimatelyIf reach our goal!  Please get the word out and make some noise about the CoroBot Spark
You can spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo site Contact us if you know of a high school or robotics club that we could talk to
Let us know if you would like us to do an event at a hackerspace

story:
New England Percussion Ensemble's (NEPE) main program "Language of the Ancients" has been presented in New England since 1992 - thousands of presentations to well over half a million eager children.  Following EVERY SINGLE PERFORMANCE kids, teachers, school administrators and parents tell us what a superb and educationally valid experience it was, and how much it was enjoyed by all.  Their enthusiasm, their consistently glowing comments and genuine applause again and again strongly reinforces my passionate conviction that "Language of the Ancients" MUST BE MADE AVAILABLE beyond our very small, four state (MA, CT, NH & RI) "live" performance area.  It must also be preserved indefinitely because the educational value of the program will far outlast my ability to participate in it.  It needs to be preserved for the future.

 
The altruistic goal of the ensemble has always been to enrich, to invigorate, 
to tweak imaginations and stimulate curiosity and creativity 
in as many youngsters as possible. 
Please help in the achievement of this goal.
 

The time is NOW for this highly acclaimed and nationally unique program to be made available to the rest of the nation's 50,000,000 school children.

                                                                  (statistic source: www.publiscshoolreview.com)


Quick Insert:  The following comment was posted on my website on March 4th as a result of our March 1st presentation:

     "BRAVO  to the New England Percussion Ensemble for the terrific family concert you presented in Greenwich.  What a superb combination of fascinating information and fabulous music you provided.  The rapt attention and wide smiles throughout the audience said it all - you had parents and children alike enthralled.  Wonderful!"  -  Shelly Cryer, producer, Greenwich Arts Council's Curiosity Concerts program series.
  

             This is very representative of comments we frequently receive... 

 

     A brief classroom photo op from our performance on February 13, 2015

 

First -

I must express my gratitude to the ensemble members for their enthusiastic support of this project.  Bill Manley, Ed Sorrentino and Abe Finch have hundreds of performances to their experience.  They are top-notch musicians and educators in every way.  Live presentations see us as a trio, but for this project the four of us will participate.


Next -

A very positive and forward thinking group of education professionals has granted permission to have the project take place at their school, Lonsdale Elementary School in Lincoln, RI.   To carry out their vision I have offered our two performances at no cost to the school, and have also promised that when the project is completed the families of each child in the school, and each school in the community will receive a copy of the final edited DVD, flashdrive or digital download. 

The word "yes" is probably the most powerful word in any language because it enables wonderful things to happen, and I thank you for yours.

The video recording will be a five-camera production also including professional audio, lighting and staging personnel.  Digital image and sound acquisition will be state of the art.


Best Information Resource -

My website, www.newenglandpercussion.com, contains an abundance of information which thoroughly describes who we are and what we're all about - complete with lots of photos, program descriptions, testimonials, bio information  and a list of past performance locations as long as your arm! 

Please visit this website...


The Really Important Stuff - 

What I Want to Accomplish and Extended Goals -

The immediate need for the "ask" amount of $28,365 is to cover the cost of the video event - all of the large and small expenses which are an essential part of the first phase of the project - set preparation, equipment rentals, insurance, crew and performer costs, editing, perk fulfillment, etc.

To complete the second phase to make "Language of the Ancients" available to schools will ultimately cost a total of $35,000 - $40,000, the cost of both phases together - the additional funds needed for graphic arts development and printing, duplication, promotion, administrative expenses, postage, etc.  The need for a Phase 2 will depend entirely upon the level of success of Phase 1. 

This total amount will complete the video project, but will only provide the means for reaching 1,000 of the nearly 100,000 public schools in the USA.  Reaching the other 99,000 will require substantial resources.                    

                                                                  (statistic source: www.publicschoolreview.com)

It is my hope that contributions for this first phase campaign will exceed the "ask" amount sufficiently to enable completion of this second phase as well - and beyond.


"Language of the Ancients" is that very special program which music teachers are constantly searching for to enhance their students' classroom experiences.  We frequently receive the post-performance comment from these same teachers (administrators & parents as well) that our presentation is one of the best, if not THE BEST their children have ever experienced.  This leads to the natural conclusion that "Language of the Ancients" is worthy of financial support at a greater level than I alone can provide.  To take it to the next level it needs outside assistance - it needs your assistance, and that of your own social networks!

Please keep your contributions coming even when the amount for this initial phase achieves its goal.  What a HUGE help that'll be in my continuing to reach so many kids who are in need of quality arts programs to enrich their lives and tweak their brains!


The Perks (a creative mix...)  

For the most part the perk selections are designed to unleash the inner percussionist in everyone, that natural instinct to create a heartbeat, a thump, a thud on something you can touch.  Choose according to your means and desires...

You can also opt out of the perk to receive the full amount of your contribution as a tax deduction (Fractured Atlas is awesome!)

And to anticipate a question - many will ask why I don't include a copy of the final edited program as a perk.  The answer is simply that I cannot promise something which I will not have in hand until the needed funds are raised, and both phases of the project are completed.  What I will gladly promise though is that everyone who contributes at a level of $75 or more will receive a final copy as a gift, an expression of my gratitude, when the full cost of both phases is achieved and the project completed.  This will be with my compliments and will not alter the tax deductible status of your contribution.




The Impact -

When you visit www.newenglandpercussion.com please do take a look at our long list of past performance locations.  Noticeably absent are schools in larger, more urban locations - schools which simply do not have the resources to bring in live enrichment programs which are frequently seen in more affluent communities.  Children in these urban schools are no less deserving!  They hunger for enrichment experiences and thrive on those which pique curiosity and artistic imagination.  THIS is what we're all about!!! 
 


Additional Thoughts From Those Who've Seen Us -

Post-performance comments are abundantly scattered throughout my website, but here are three which I feel strongly reinforce my passion to achieve this wonderful goal.


"You have touched their hearts and they learned. 

Your program should be required in every school curriculum." 

Dr. Andrew S. Carrano, Principal, Dunn's Corners School, Westerly, RI


"What a dynamite and professional ensemble you are. Your program, 'Language of the Ancients,' is absolutely inspired. 

Your teaching is the best..." 

Patricia Michael, Principal / Sally Anyan, Music Educator, Barlow Mountain School, Ridgefield, CT


"To have children enthusiastic when learning is a gift -

and for that gift - thank you."

Maryellen Dumais, Parents Organization, Collicot Elementary School, Milton, MA

   

 

Hopefully I have succeeded in gaining your enthusiasm for the project.  But if you simply cannot make a monetary contribution you can still make a tremendous contribution of your good will and your energy by spreading the word through your own social networks (family, friends & business contacts), and asking them to continue passing it on, and on, and on....  My sincere gratitude for that type of support.


This is a win/win/win project at its very best!

Help to make it happen! 


BE AN ACTIVE ADVOCATE! 


A Parting Observation - 

     OK, OK - I've been told I'm just a tad stiff in the video head shots, and after seeing it in the studio I totally agree.  Hey, I've never been front of a teleprompter before...  But as you can easily see by the rest of the video clips my place is definitely in front of a bunch of bubbly kids!
    And that's all I have to say about that, (ba dump bump, crash! - only percussionists will really understand...)

story:
Sneak Preview Open Day

Monday March 30th
Tickets on sale now

Campaign Updates

  1. 11/03/2015 - What's in a name?
  2. 16/03/2015 - Attention Flight Sim Enthusiasts...
  3. 19/03/2015 - Announcing "The VR Den"
  4. 20/03/2015 - Thanks to our sponsors...



We make Virtual Experiences

Infinity Amusements started its life manufacturing Virtual Pinball machines, but as we're all geeks here, it wasn't long before we started incorporating our love of virtual reality into the overall business. So far we have built and run the following VR experiences for expos and events:

  • Backlot Theatre preshow Horror Experience
  • GO Festival 2014 - VR Experience
  • Samsung Island VR Bike Ride Experience
  • Bupa Challenge "Santos Tour Down Under" Experience
  • GO Festival 2015 - Gaming Zone

People had so much fun at these events, we wanted to make these sorts of virtual experiences available to everyone, everyday. We also realized there was a massive talent pool of developers in Melbourne with the skills and the desire to create the "next big thing" but lacked access to the latest hardware solutions.

What if we had space filled with the latest in virtual reality and augmented reality hardware and software?  A hardware library for enthusiasts to explore and for developers to test their ideas. A co-working space dedicated to the development of this brand new consumer medium.

We began this IndieGoGo with this idea, the passion and the hope we could find like minded people to make such a project reality. Then we met the guys at Revolver Creative and "The VR Den" was born...



A home for cutting edge technology...

Sometimes getting access to the latest hardware can be the biggest challenge, especially in Australia. We have built many relationships in the emerging Virtual Reality space, so by having this physical location we will be able to offer manufacturers a space to showcase their latest hardware and for enthusiasts to test drive equipment otherwise not available locally.


Why now?

Virtual Reality has been "coming" for years with the Oculus Rift Kickstarter marking the true beginning of the consumer VR revolution. We've been developing in the space for about 18 months now and have amassed the following gear:

  • 3 x Oculus Rift DK2 Virtual Reality headsets
  • 1 x Samsung Gear VR
  • 2 x Gaming Grade PC's
  • Next Level Racing motion simulator with swappable Logitech G25 racing controls or the Thrustmaster A-10 Warthog HOTAS.
  • Static simulator with Thrustmaster HOTAS-X or Saitek Yoke/Pedal flight controls. Suitable for flight experiences and non-interactive experiences (ie rollercoasters, ghost trains)
  • A boat load of software
  • Microsoft Kinect V1 with various cloud-point scanning programs
  • Leap Motion tracking sensor
  • 6 x 1080p action cams for 3D or 360 video recording

We can only work on so many projects at once, so we thought why not make all of this gear available to both the general public and fellow developers.

When the team at SimPit NZ heard about what we were planning they made us a very special offer. Would you like to experience a HD virtual environment, with full 180 degree field of view without a HMD? The Icarus Avenger makes that a reality...

And we will have the only one of it's kind in Australia. If you're a fan of flight simulators and you're not excited yet - better check that pulse.


The VR Den will be an extension to the resources at Revolver Creative (RC) - a dedicated space for the exploration and development of virtual reality technology and solutions. We're on track to open to the public shortly after Easter (April 2015).


What's next?

Over the next 6 months we have the following equipment on its way:
  • Virtuix Omni VR treadmill
  • Sixense STEM full body tracking
  • More cloud-point recording software and hardware solutions
  • A few super special secrets. We'd tell you, but we'd have to kill you.


Why an open campaign?

We have already invested in enough equipment to establish The VR Den and run our trial, so we've split the campaign into two stages:

  • Step One: A Place to Play - Secure our space at Revolver Creative and make Chapel St, Melbourne the capital of virtual reality.
  • Step Two: Additional Equipment: There is nothing like competing against your mates. All funds raised beyond this point will go towards additional HMDs, treadmills, motion-simulators, etc so we can offer 2, 3 or 4 player experiences and test environments.


What are our funding goals?

  • $4600 - Secure our space at Revolver Creative for a further six months
  • $5600 - Add a third gaming grade PC for running a third DK2
  • $6600 -  Add a second Virtuix Omni VR treadmill
  • $10,000 - Add a secomd Next Level Motion Platform


We'll never forget where we started...

For years Sana was a serious console collector. His private collection includes almost every console and a selection of games, starting with the original Nintendo Entertainment System and Sega Master System all the way up to the previous generation (Xbox 360, PS3, Wii). We feel it would be greedy to keep these to ourselves so we'll set them all up to for a bit of retro-fun - included with your access.


Risks & Challenges

Thanks to the generosity of the team at Revolver Creative we have been given the opportunity to test drive this concept in one of Melbourne's hippest suburbs. But rent on Chapel St doesn't come cheap so your help will allow us secure this space long term and bring the world's best technology to the world's best city!

From straight up entertainment with rollercoasters, racing and flying simulators, to the latest cloud-point and 360 recording solutions - this will be a space for anybody with an interest in virtual or augmented reality.


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help us out.

  • Tell everybody you know! Share us via Social Media to get the word out.
  • IndieGoGo has it's own Share tools. Check them out and help spread the word.

It's 2015. We might not have flying cars and hover-boards, but we did get immersive virtual reality. Help us bring this technology to the masses!

story:
Game Trailer:


What we need:

As of now, FindYourTrip is only available as a BETA on Android Tables, and by 1st of April BETA will also be available on IPAD. Our goal is to release the game on all platforms, and to design more countries inside the game and a better storyline and educative contents for the kids. To do so, we need $80,000.

Why do we need this money?

We have designed a serious game with real content. We are working on the game to improve it every day with the help of our players. We need your help to "spread the word" and develop FindYourTrip on several platforms so that every students can learn, travel, ad.


Your help, Our will 

"Our will for FindYourTrip is to make every children learn while discovering new cities and having a funny moment playing on the game. In their growing process and because the world becomes globalised. It is truly important that future kids have an open mind and already know how life works in another place than theirs."


Beyond the money - Help us to write an incredible journey

Whether you donate or not, you can still help to make FindYourTrip's history. Education is a matter of everyone, our children will become the adults of tomorrow. Let's help them to become citizen of the world, and smart as they should be! :)

Ways you can help:

· Share, speak about the project: video, sample mail

· Spread the word about the #FindYourTrip on Facebook and Twitter

· Ideas’ box: Some improvements or new ideas about the game?
Let’s share it: contact@findyourtrip-thegame.com

· If you are a professor? Join our team and make every kids learning while discovering new cultures.

Stretch goals

lf we manage to go over our expectations, we already planed to EXTEND FindYourTrip with new countries and cities. Let's extend this amazing journey, let's make your children discover new cultures by practicing!

  • $80 000: Minimum goal - Code FindYourTrip as a full game on Android, Windows and IOS smartphones.
    BONUS: Release of SINGAPORE area with Mathematic field improved

  • $120 000: Release ALL ASIA area!! + TRANSLATIONS Phase - 1
    MULTI-LANGUAGES: Translation of the game content in 5 languages (French, Chinese, Spanish, German, and Arab) 

  • $125 000: Upgrade of user's experience - New characters, customisable character creation!                   
    Creation of the first worldwide Educational YouTube Channel using Clipster solution. The most interactive and best looking YouTube Channel.

  • $150 000: Release EUROPE area !! Phase - 2

  • $190 000: Release of SOUTH AMERICA area!! Phase - 3

  • $230 000: Release of NORTH AMERICA area !! Phase - 4

  • $270 000: Release of AFRICA area!!! Phase - 5

  • $300 000: New territories to discover (Antartic, Islands, etc.). Let's make a big surprise to the kids. Phase - 6

Game design

We've created FindYourTrip with the best technologies available on the market in order to maximize kid's gaming experience.

  • Unity 3D: One of the best engine to code a game on the market. Famous and popular games already use this technology (Assassin's Creed Identity, Clash of Clans, Endless Legend...)

  • Educational content: US standards in term of education have become world's standards. We have chosen this content from different sources to make sure your kids will learn in the best.

  • Graphic design: Using the most powerful software to design awesome graphic content, we have tried to create a familiar environment within the game. Both real and fancy animations will keep your mind into the game.

  • Videos: We have shot with Canon Mark III live scene of Bangkok locations. The kids while playing will be able to see what are the locations they are playing in reality.

We are trying with FindYourTrip to make education more fun. 



FindYourTrip is an educative game on IOS Ipad designed for kids from 6 to 10 years old. The player's goal in FindYourTrip is to free cities that have been invaded by Pumas. To do so, the player will have to help Messi the monkey by outsmarting pumas who kidnapped his friends. Not only kids will be able to improve their education, but they will discover countries all around the world through real life shot videos designed by our team from Youtube. In addition, FindYourTrip will display information about the local culture.

FindYourTrip creates the perfect environment and attraction so that your children can learn while having fun. Studies have found that when a child feels more comfortable in an environment, learning experience will be better. The best way to make kids practicing is to make them discover by being amazed of what they can find out. We have setup FindYourTrip in one of the biggest and most beautiful cities in the world, Bangkok Thailand.

Parents will be able to control their kids progress without them to notice they are being tested.

The purpose of FindYourTrip is to offer and content both parents and kids. Kids will learn through having a funny experience by discovering. In parents side, FindYourTrip will be a tool to assess their kids' progress INSTANTLY by receiving a complete report. NOTE this function will be only available on v2 of the game.

Our history

We've started FindYourTrip in 2011, at the beginning it was during our square time. We wanted to create a game through which the player would travel and learn, and of course have fun.

We tried a first beta on Samsung Smart TV, but failed in the fact the engine to code on the TV was hard to use at that time, and also because we had no resources after that. We gave up the project for almost one year, waiting for our audience to grow.

After plenty of brainstorming, the project was changed. We have decided to launch FindYourTrip on Smartphones and Tablets because there was a real demand for education game.

3 years later thanks to our improvements, Expara and an accelerator program [I4-X] gave us a chance to relaunch the project with a seed funding in Bangkok.

What about us?

Our team is young and wiling to reach the sky to make this project come true! We have worked successfully between Bangkok and Singapore for 4 years now as part of a video online marketing startup (FindYourWayInTheWorld) created by our own.

We are operating in the video online marketing field and have produced over than 200 videos for worldwide clients. According to this, we have acquiered strong skills in online marketing compaign.Passionate of videos and strongly believe that a video can speak more than words, we want share our vision with our future players.

Some others passionate teams has already joined us:

-  Pinata a game development studio of Singapore (We usually call them “the little genius”). Andy, Fa, and Raymond have supported all coding phase and testings.

-  Red and Steve are both 3d creator/video editing/graphic experts for 15 years in the industry (“The magicians”) have pushed the game to the next level!


Our Characters

MESSI, The Monkey

Messi the brave monkey is the main character of FindYourTrip. As player you will have to help him in quest to free the world from pumas. Smart, skilled and traveler, Messi comes from a faraway land, arrived in Bangkok he was amazed by the beauty of Thailand.  Unfortunately some animals have taken the city and brave as he is, Messi wants to help citizens to be freed. His plans are to travel all around the world if the player is smart enough to follow him in his amazing journey.


KITTY CAT

Kitty cat is living in Bangkok, in Lumpini Park. He loves playing with a ball of wool with his different cousins coming to visit him. Kitty cat has tremendous family in United Kingdom and grow with them, which is why his Thai friends tell him he has a perfect English. 


FOSHU

Foushù the fish, his friend fishes qualifies him as “the most sail traveler” between them. In fact he is the most willing to travel but he does not have the occasion to travel yet. He is blocked in the Chao Phraya River by the pumas… Once Pumas will be gone, Foushù would love to experience other oceans and meet other species of fishes.


TIA

Tia the turtle comes from the Caribbean seas. She is in travel in Thailand, she came here to see if the Thai sand is as white as the Caribbean sand. She usually lets herself navigate by the ocean current. Because of this latest point she can localize every city in the world with her closed eyes. In fact no one can beat her in geography field.


CHANG

Chang the elephant is Thai, he grows in Thailand and saw pumas take the country. He is living in the imperial area. As elephant, Chang has a huge memory, he can recognize another elephant 5 years later he met him. His main passion is to tell story to young animals, they seem to like it because there is more and more animals each time. Chang the elephant has so much to tell you.


THE BOZ FAMILY

The Boz family is a gang of pumas, Bozef with the Red eyes is the chief. He and his bros have invaded the city of Bangkok and plan to do the same thing for Thailand and the rest of the World. 

We do not have much information about him expect that he is smart and learn really fast

He came in Bangkok with four of his brothers:

  • Ted: Sleepy as he looks like, appearances are deceptive. Ted is the most agile of the band. His brothers calls him "quick as a thunder"

  • Tim: The right hand of Bozef. Tim manages the invasion that Bozef has planned. He has a military mindset and knows how to coach his brothers to achieve the plan.

  • Tod: The scientist of the family. He knows how to design potions and poisons.

  • Tom: Probably the most kind of the band. ? is very friendly but easy to manipulate. Sometimes he listens to his couzins without distinguishing what is right or wrong.

We are looking forward your support, making this application to become reality.
Jean Charles SALVIN,
Director and Co-Founder of FindYourTrip Pte Ltd
story_txt:
Game Trailer:
What we need:
As of now, FindYourTrip is only available as a BETA on Android Tables, and by 1st of April BETA will also be available on IPAD. Our goal is to release the game on all platforms, and to design more countries inside the game and a better storyline and educative contents for the kids. To do so, we need $80,000.Why do we need this money?We have designed a serious game with real content. We are working on the game to improve it every day with the help of our players. We need your help to "spread the word" and develop FindYourTrip on several platforms so that every students can learn, travel, ad.


Your help, Our will 

"Our will for FindYourTrip is to make every children learn while discovering new cities and having a funny moment playing on the game. In their growing process and because the world becomes globalised. It is truly important that future kids have an open mind and already know how life works in another place than theirs."
Beyond the money - Help us to write an incredible journey
Whether you donate or not, you can still help to make FindYourTrip's history. Education is a matter of everyone, our children will become the adults of tomorrow. Let's help them to become citizen of the world, and smart as they should be! :)

Ways you can help:· Share, speak about the project: video, sample mail
· Spread the word about the #FindYourTrip on Facebook and Twitter
· Ideas’ box: Some improvements or new ideas about the game? Let’s share it: contact@findyourtrip-thegame.com
· If you are a professor? Join our team and make every kids learning while discovering new cultures.
Stretch goals
lf we manage to go over our expectations, we already planed to EXTEND FindYourTrip with new countries and cities. Let's extend this amazing journey, let's make your children discover new cultures by practicing!


$80 000: Minimum goal - Code FindYourTrip as a full game on Android, Windows and IOS smartphones.BONUS: Release of SINGAPORE area with Mathematic field improved



$120 000: Release ALL ASIA area!! + TRANSLATIONS Phase - 1MULTI-LANGUAGES: Translation of the game content in 5 languages (French, Chinese, Spanish, German, and Arab) 

$125 000: Upgrade of user's experience - New characters, customisable character creation!                    Creation of the first worldwide Educational YouTube Channel using Clipster solution. The most interactive and best looking YouTube Channel.


$150 000: Release EUROPE area !! Phase - 2


$190 000: Release of SOUTH AMERICA area!! Phase - 3


$230 000: Release of NORTH AMERICA area !! Phase - 4


$270 000: Release of AFRICA area!!! Phase - 5


$300 000: New territories to discover (Antartic, Islands, etc.). Let's make a big surprise to the kids. Phase - 6



Game designWe've created FindYourTrip with the best technologies available on the market in order to maximize kid's gaming experience.



Unity 3D: One of the best engine to code a game on the market. Famous and popular games already use this technology (Assassin's Creed Identity, Clash of Clans, Endless Legend...)


Educational content: US standards in term of education have become world's standards. We have chosen this content from different sources to make sure your kids will learn in the best.


Graphic design: Using the most powerful software to design awesome graphic content, we have tried to create a familiar environment within the game. Both real and fancy animations will keep your mind into the game.


Videos: We have shot with Canon Mark III live scene of Bangkok locations. The kids while playing will be able to see what are the locations they are playing in reality.

We are trying with FindYourTrip to make education more fun.

story:
About The Thornton Elite

The Thornton Elite will be designed to ensure the future success of young athletes each year by promoting competitive sports in the state of Colorado. Through our competitive sports clubs, the Thornton Elite will provide athletic training and life skills development for young athletes, beginning during elementary school, and continuously working with them as they progress through their middle and high school years. We will pride ourselves on the ability to give our young athletes everything they need to hone their athletic skills, while also supplying various outlets for them to grow as individuals off the court or field. This includes access to the mentoring and instruction from the best coaches around. Our ultimate goal is to provide each athlete with the best available training to maximize their potential, while also giving them the opportunity to participate in their own community; each of which has the potential for athletes to take their game to a collegiate or pro level.

Mission

 

The Thornton Elite will be dedicated to helping Colorado youth athletes grow as individuals on the playing field as well as in the classroom and their daily lives. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to develop their athletic skills while also learning important life skills such as teamwork, leadership, and a good work ethic. The mission of Thornton Elite is not only to provide children and teens with an opportunity to play sports, but also to teach them the value of hard work, the importance of being involved, and the ability to succeed. The standards for coaches for this organization will help to ensure that these valuable lessons are not overlooked or forgotten. From a realistic viewpoint, one would know that few athletes who will go through the Thornton Elite will be able to compete beyond the high school level. This is just the reality of current day American sports. The Thornton Elite will strive to make a better community by giving youth athletes skills that will help them in all aspects of their lives and to be successful in any goals they look to pursue later on.

story:
Everyone that learns a skill does not want to teach it, and everyone that has a talent does not want to share it.

But we do!!!

Growing up as students in the Chicago Public School system, we were literally saved by the afterschool programs that provided us with fun things to do including learning to crochet!

For over 10 years we have shared our passion for this art form with students in many Chicago Public Schools & local Community Programs and now with the help of La Casa de la Artistas Residency, we can share with children abroad!

La Casa de la Artista is an artist residency focused on providing opportunities for artists to travel and create while providing free classes to youth.

This fundraiser will provide airfare, lodging and food for ourselves while we teach free workshops in Thailand, St. Thomas, Czech Republic and possibly Cambodia, Vietnam ,Burma & Laos!!!

As children, the boost in self-esteem that we received by being able to create something with our own hands was priceless. Help us to empower children in communities abroad by allowing us to share a craft & experience that they'll carry along with them for a lifetime!

story:
Benefits of One-to-One

  • One-to-One is providing students with personalized mobile computing devices to be used for exploring, creating, researching, and collaborating
  • One-to-One is not device specific; however, we are device specific for standardization and practical purposes
  • One-to-One addresses many of the issues faced by the school and leapfrogs other competitors in town by accessing cutting edge technology and putting it in the students’ hands

Technology in the Classroom -- Student Perspectives

  I think that the one to one idea for next year is a fantastic idea. iPads will be an incredible asset to our school as a whole.  It would make it a lot easier to keep track of homework and due dates because you can set reminders for it and you can do most of your work on the iPad. It would be extremely easy to transfer homework, tests, quizzes, etc. to the iPad.  Also, I think this would draw students to our school.  Not many small Christian schools have a program like 1 to 1.

Austen, Junior, PPCS

  I think we should have iPads in the classroom because it’s hands on learning, making what you learn memorable.

Kaitlyn, Senior, PPCS

  I think we need iPads because it allows us access to the Internet for learning on educational websites.

Mark, Senior, PPCS

  In order for Pikes Peak Christian to remain an effective learning environment that is more advanced than a public school system, we need to keep up with the pace of life and head in the direction of success. In college, using the Internet and computers are a huge part of studying and staying ahead.  When we use iPads, we teach students to effectively learn to use the web to aid them in finding information, and educate students on modern programs used in school, professions, jobs, etc. (programs such as Microsoft Office programs, iMovie, iPhoto and others).  The use of older, more outdated computers holds us back; many local public schools here use Apple or Windows 8 systems.  Outdated technology is not used in the business world. 

Effy, Senior, PPCS

  iPads allow greater freedom of learning.  The power of the internet has never been greater - accessing more information faster – allowing each student to learn by hearing, seeing or typing notes.  Apps also allow faster calculations.  iPads are the future.

Nate, Senior, PPCS

  Having iPads gives an advantage to the school and students.  It makes things quicker, like notes, studying and reading.

Shyanne, Sophomore, PPCS

I would love to have iPads for school next year.  It would help with my notes and studying and having a lighter load to take home if books or textbooks were on the iPad.

Tristina, Sophomore, PPCS

  It would attract more people to the school and more students means more funding, which means higher budgets for this.  Having iPads would also help students with studying because if they are out sick, they can Facetime their teachers and get help with what they missed.  And finally, for foreign students, they could have apps explain and help them comprehend more. 

Gabe, Freshman, PPCS

  We should have iPads because they will give us many abilities like extra help and language assistance.

Malora, Freshman, PPCS

  While many fail to understand the modern world and its technology, within any workplace – in which college degrees are required, use and understanding of technology is a steadily growing requirement.  The neglect of technology and use of it is a critical error.  Even with the neglect to do so and apply technology – students will use their own appliances to answer homework and school work. 

Mark, Junior, PPCS

  iPads may sound like a waste of energy and money for the school.  You may think students wouldn’t benefit or may just misuse the device. In reality, iPads will be one of the most used tools you could give them.  I know from experience that when you give us something and trust us to use it, we normally want to prove to you we can do it.  We all know how to use an iPad, we know how to use the applications, and if you made things like a calculator, language translator, notepad, and any other tool in one central place like an iPad, more kids would be more likely to do their work.  We wouldn’t be bringing home a bunch of books or work things; we’d just bring home the iPad.

Aspen, Junior, PPCS

  It will give us time to work at our own speed, so as fast as we like or as slow as we like, but we have to keep on a schedule. We have to learn the material, and we can ask a question at our house instead of not doing it that night when we have time.

Kenzie, 8th Grade, PPCS

  I truly believe that iPads could change schools forever.  First off, iPads are going to save us so much money on paper. We could use the money we save from not using paper on the iPads.  Second, I think that it’s going to get kids really excited about learning. Third, the iPads allow you to work at your own pace.  I love the fact that the videos I watch for math, I can fast forward or rewatch whenever I feel like it.  Lastly, I think it will help us kids understand the importance of responsibility.  Let’s be honest, having an iPad is work.  You have to be sure you take care of it.  I think this will prepare us for the real world! By the time I’m in the workforce, I’m pretty sure we’re going have touch screen everything.  Don’t you think it’s better that we learn about how to use this technology now instead of when we’re adults? 

Krista, 8th Grade, PPCS

  Having iPads in the class would be convenient because it gives us a new way to learn.  Lectures are kind of boring…it’s nice to have something new.  Our hands won’t hurt from writing notes and solving problems.  We can also experience the type of technology we will be exposed to when we are older.

Ola, 8th Grade, PPCS

  It’s a great idea to have iPads for school next year for several reasons.  It helps kids with the technology skills…when going into a technology filled world.  It gives an advantage to well-known sources for help.  You would be able to chat with teachers and students for help or transfer work to students that are absent.

Jake, Junior, PPCS

  Even though I will be graduating this year, I believe in bettering the learning system of the students by going to 1-to-1.  As the world advances, teens rely more and more on technology – what better method of learning than having individual tablets to experiment with?  I believe that having individual tablets would be extremely attractive to teens considering PPCS.  I hope to see this school grow abundantly in the future. 

Devon, Senior, PPCS

time.
Kenzie, 8th Grade, PPCS
  I truly believe that iPads could
change schools forever.  First off, iPads
are going to save us so much money on paper. We could use the money we save from not using
paper on the iPads.  Second, I think that
it’s going to get kids really excited about learning. Third, the iPads allow you to work at your own
pace.  I love the fact that the videos I
watch for math, I can fast forward or rewatch whenever I feel like it.  Lastly, I think it will help us kids
understand the importance of responsibility. 
Let’s be honest, having an iPad is work. 
You have to be sure you take care of it. 
I think this will prepare us for the real world! By the time I’m in the workforce, I’m pretty
sure we’re going have touch screen everything. 
Don’t you think it’s better that we learn about how to use this
technology now instead of when we’re adults? 

Krista, 8th Grade, PPCS
  Having
iPads in the class would be convenient because it gives us a new way to
learn.  Lectures are kind of boring…it’s
nice to have something new.  Our hands
won’t hurt from writing notes and solving problems.  We can also experience the type of technology
we will be exposed to when we are older.
Ola, 8th Grade, PPCS
  It’s a
great idea to have iPads for school next year for several reasons.  It helps kids with the technology skills…when
going into a technology filled world.  It
gives an advantage to well-known sources for help.  You would be able to chat with teachers and
students for help or transfer work to students that are absent.
Jake, Junior, PPCS
  Even though
I will be graduating this year, I believe in bettering the learning system of
the students by going to 1-to-1.  As the
world advances, teens rely more and more on technology – what better method of
learning than having individual tablets to experiment with?  I believe that having individual tablets
would be extremely attractive to teens considering PPCS.  I hope to see this school grow abundantly in
the future.  
Devon, Senior, PPCS

story:
Summary

The Bihari More Education Project (BMEP) started as an independent initiative by students of National Institute of Technology Durgapur to nurture and mentor the underprivileged kids in & around the campus. 

Beginning as a Short Film Project in 2009 by Harsh Vardhan Singh for Microsoft Imagine Cup in Education category filming the slum kids living in the vicinity of NIT campus. The movie showed the use of VOIP technology to educate the underprivileged children. But realizing the kids filmed in the movie themselves being bereft of basic education made us feel guilty of simply using them.

Soon it was decided to start teaching the kids after college hours and on weekends. Gradually and unconsciously everything got organized as a full-fledged mentoring project called BMEP and thus, Bihari More Education Project came to existence.

Any humble contribution (donations in terms of money, stationary books, electronic gadget etc) would help us in introducing the slum children & child labours to the sanctity of education in a better way.

What We Need & What You Get

  • BMEP needs around $ 2000 in the first quarter of the year for new School Admissions & renewing schooling of the existing supported kids. The Durgapur Schools involved with our BMEP Project are St.Christophers Mission School, Kendriya Vidyalaya CMERI, Zoom International School, Dreamplace Play School, SAIL Handicapped School, SAHAS Institute etc. Rest part of the year, Children activities related to Health, Sanitation, Stationary & Books, Educational Trips are organised.
  • The unique BMEP perks are T-Shirts & Personal wishes of kids !

The Impact

How awesome would it be to see happiness & hopefulness & positivism in the society. Its been a great journey for Bihari More Education Project.

in 2014, Bihari More Education Project (BMEP) had the maximum level of News articles published in various media platforms. from YourStory.com, Michigan Tech IMPACT Magazine, UNICEF's State of World Children, Axis Bank My Idea of Progress Contest Winner, Campus Diaries, Youngisthan, YesFoundation, Viacom Cineshorts etc.

Risks & Challenges

  • Understanding various social issues like poverty, illiteracy, child labour, unhygienic living conditions, social taboo etc.
  • BMEP primarily focus is on holistic & conceptual learning i.e not "what to study", but "how to study".

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Drop in your suggestions & ideas to email "bihari.more@gmail.com".
  • Spread the word about BMEP through social media & direct word.
Let's make this world a better place.

story:
Short Summary

CoGoGirl is a free educational tool for teen girls, focusing on what a she can do with her life through her college education as well as providing games to help her with math and science. We believe a girl's future should be a picture that is limitless. if she can see it, she can be it.

CoGoGirl is designed to help teen girl's envision pathways to success through their education by showing them what they can do with their lives by their college major. For example: Marine Biology Major: we show the top 200 schools curricula, videos of lectures, videos and text from people who work in the field and what it what kind of work they would be doing with this major. We don't just help them see what they can be, we build neuroscience games aimed at helping girls excel in math and science for the SAT's and ACT's, so that she can succeed on a testing front to get into the best schools for her desired major.

The Neuroscience games for girls are designed to help them excel in math and science and prepare them for time crunched SAT's and ACT's. This online educational software is the risk mitigating factor in the success of this site to help girls. Once that software is built...it can reach every girl on the planet for free. They won't need to risk their lives in schools or even walking to school..they only need internet access and education is at their fingertips.

CoGoGirl has been an two year odyssey for us in gathering the information necessary to create this platform for use. It’s massive, unprecedented and necessary. By focusing on the education we separate ourselves from the competition. It is a free site that anyone can use, girls and boys can sign up and utilize it as a tool for academic insights. We hope to further our goal by creating a foundation that gives scholarships to girls going into STEM majors. In our first stage of development, we will however, provide them with every possible scholarship available for them to apply to on a special.."Scholarships" tab on the site.

47% of girls entering college today have parents that did not attend college. They don’t have close family mentors guiding them to science, math, business, politics, leadership. 48% of college students will drop out of their major or the school by their sophomore year. The cost of this change is prohibitive and hard to carry. We need to arm our future leaders with the information necessary to guide them to their futures so they are not saddled with unnecessary debt.

CoGoGirl connects girls with mentors who provide video or text about their jobs and their studies. This site can be a devotion to quality and ideals. We can build this but we need you to help make this happen.

Only 25 percent of U.S. public high school graduates have the skills needed to succeed academically in college, which is an important gateway to economic opportunity in the United States.

Most of the country’s K-12 public school teachers lack access to the tailored feedback, high-quality instructional materials, and support they need to do their best work and continually improve. The site will provide this information where Guidance Counselors are overwhelmed or under informed.

When you are a young girl society tells you so many things on what you are and should be. Not many of them are empowering. We seek to change the conversation for girls who think they’re weird because they seek to lead, love math, science, think that they can do anything, dare to be something other than a wife, or a mother or that the two cannot co-exist. Let’s end the future woman’s limited life. Show her to bash the walls. Broaden her horizon, show them they can change it, influence it, if you show them, they will never be the same. And neither will you because you are part then of a massive movement on what is now an unprecedented time of cultural change in America. More girls are seeking higher education than boys. Let’s arm them with the best possible future.



What We Need & What You Get

CoGoGirl is not just an education tool, it's part of a global movement to help girls receive an education to help them get a job not only to provide for themselves but to have happy and successful lives and create a safer more inclusive world for women.

  • We need 25k to initialize the web build out.
  • We can offer you the free service of the neuroscience games for any girl that you wish for them to be for, including donating it to a local library or underprivileged girl of your choice or we can find one for you.
  • If we don't reach our goal the funds still go directly to salaries of individuals who are building the front end and back end architecture of the site and the games.

The Impact

America ranks 20th in the World Economic Forum's latest "gender gap index," which compares men and women in health, education, economics and politics. Women make up just a small fraction of CEOs, and just over 19% of those in Congress even though nearly 51% of Americans are female. And Census Bureau data from 2013 indicate that American women working full time made nearly 22% less than their male counterparts.

  • Education, mentorship, helping to shape girl's vision of their potential is one of the most critical movements on the planet today. We live in a world which shows our girls that outside of the US they can be murdered, abducted and sold into slavery for daring to go to school. Let America lead the world on the online software for education front. Nothing can replace a teacher but if she has internet access via phone or computer she can learn. 

  • Education for girls is one of the highest priorities of our lives. We are trying to create a resource and community for the next generation.

    We're doing it for the more than 200 schoolgirls abducted by the Islamist extremist group Boko Haram in Nigeria, for those who have become ISIS militants' sex slaves and for girls everywhere who can't go to school. We're doing it for the estimated 160 million babies aborted or killed at birth in Asia in recent decades because they were not boys. If we give girls the best opportunity at education in the US and around the world...they might just change the world.

  • We've been doing this for two years, the research, the planning, working with neuroscientists configuring how to optimize games and information for the next generation to utilize. I'm ready to build a game changer and I need your help to do so.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge that we face is raising the capital to pay software developers to build out the games. Right now I am waiting on the US Government to approve a Non Profit status. So your donation could be a write off, or not, we won't know if they will reward us with the 501 c3 status. So that's a risk for you and for us, but we remain hopeful that our message and mission is clear and valid.

  • Our team has extensive knowledge and success on the entrepreneurial management and development of software projects.
  • If we are not granted Non Profit status we will operate as an LLC, nothing is going to stop us from pursuing this dream. We will offer the games for a minimal cost for download to help pay for operations.
  • We are going to build the site with the college major information as a free tool for girls to access and hear from other women and girls so they can get a more inclusive image of their futures. The challenge: finding women who work in each major in leadership positions.

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't just need money, we need your PASSION!

  • Please help us! Help us reach educators, schools, girls, parents,media...anyone who believes in the mission of education for girls.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

To accent the relevancy of our mission:

The Bill and Melinda Gates outlined four elements that their foundation was driving for by 2030. Number Four is relevant to CoGoGirl's software games for math and science for girls by age. Here it is:

Fourth, as high-speed cell networks grow and smartphones become as cheap as today's voice-only phones, online education will flourish.

Before a child even starts primary school, she will be able to use her mom's smartphone to learn her numbers and letters. Software will be able to see when she's having trouble with the material and adjust for her pace. Of course, software will never replace teachers. But by allowing teachers to do things like upload videos of themselves and get feedback from their peers, it can connect them in new ways.

What will it take to make sure life really does improve faster for the poor? We need advances in technology and we need to deliver them to the people who need them most. We also need to close the gender gap. Countries where girls don't go to school or women can't open a business will be left behind. We can build this online platform so that girls only need internet access to learn.

"Countries where girls don't go to school or women can't open a business will be left behind."

Bill and Melinda Gates

"It is time that we all see gender as a spectrum instead of two sets of opposing ideals. We should stop defining each other by what we are not, and start defining ourselves by who we are. [...]
I want men to take up this mantle so their daughters, sisters and mothers can be free from prejudice but also so their sons have permission to be vulnerable and human, too and in doing so, be a more true and complete version of themselves."
Emma Watson at the United Nations

"There is an ironic, philosophical gap between the creative idealism of the startup industry and the investors who fund them. Our industry, with its insatiable appetite for ideas that will ‘change the world,’ is stuck in a traditional paradigm that does a regrettable disservice to the industry it claims to support."
-

Patricia Nakache
