story:
Summary

REMMI: "Remote-me" Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)

The REMMI project end goal is to enable internet users to virtually "Remote themselves" to remote sites of interest by internet connected UAVs (Unmanned Aerial Vehicles). Users will not require to own or purchase their own UAVs to do this. We propose to lease and/or sell the UAVs to the owners of sites of interest.

To this end we are designing a purpose built UAV, the REMMI-UAV. REMMI-UAVs are intended to be sited at a portfolio of remote sites of interest (“Attractions”). REMMI-UAVs will be capable of being logged into by prospective remote tourists via the internet, for a small fee of the order of a few dollars, or for free, depending on the site. The remote tourist will then be able to navigate the UAV around the remote site using keyboard and mouse, whilst turning their head to look in any direction, in the same way as a player using VR equipment would do with an avatar in an online multiplayer game.

The REMMI-UAV will behave such that it will operate to autonomously preserve the safety and privacy of other site occupants, as well as itself, whilst being under the direction of the remote user. If the user is equipped with an Oculus Rift or compatible VR headset, then the tour can be experienced in full 3D stereoscopic vision. Otherwise the tour will be in standard HD graphic mode. If the user loses control of the REMMI-UAV for any reason, the UAV will endeavor to autonomously return to base, or otherwise render itself safe to all.

A REMMI-UAV pilot training program has also been developed in an online virtual world. This trains prospective REMMI-UAV pilots in the skills needed to maneuver the REMMI-UAVs as though in the real world, in a simulated environment without physical risk. The REMMI-UAV pilots course though fun, is compulsory for all prospective REMMI-UAV pilots, for reasons of safety.

About Us

REMMI - “Remote-me”

“We”, the REMMI Project: Frederick Bott & REMMI LTD (Full liability), and without liability; Partners, Contributors, Supporters, Employees, and others as they arise (See Credits)

Frederick Bott is a Chartered Engineer (CEng). He is qualified with a BEng, in Electrical and Electronic Engineering, and an MSc in Concurrent Engineering. He has since worked continuously in senior roles in industry for over 20 years, often on a limited company consultant basis. Companies previously worked for include Thales, BAE Systems, EADS Astrium, Selex, GE Aviation, and Cobham. He is a historical patentee and published technical author, and has also published software on Model Based Design of planar magnetic components, and Satellite Orbital Simulation. He is currently working in a permanent role, in Research and Technology with Cobham Mission Equipment in Wimborne, as Systems Engineer, Model Based Design. His main R&T project in this role was the ASTRAEA project, in which he was a key member of the Autonomous Air to Air Refuelling (AAAR) Modelling and Simulation team. He also served as Cobham’s representative at the ASTRAEA JARC meetings, in direct consultation with UK CAA. He will be giving up his Cobham employment voluntarily to fully engage with this, the REMMI project, in April 2015.

What We Need

We need initially to raise around £20K, to fund the main detailed mathematical and physical modelling software tools (Currently using home & demo versions for the demos). If we are lucky enough to have surplus funds, these will go towards the carbon fibre 3D printer needed later (Around £10K, Long lead time) to manufacture the UAV chassis and custom parts. The remainder of the project including manufacture and supply of prototype and Production units is intended to be funded by stretch campaigns, and /or overfunding. All funds recieved via Indiegogo will be invested in the REMMI program.

What You Get

Please see pledges for details. All pledging is now aimed at Holiday and Tourism and other companies who may wish to benefit from having the REMMI-UAV service at their site(s)

What if the funding Goal is Not Met?

If the first target of £20,000 is not met, all received donations will be refunded and the project will be removed from crowd funding. The REMMI-UAV project may continue on a standard privately funded basis.

The Project Impact

The utility of the REMMI-UAV product and services will be the first ever of its kind, allowing users to remotely "Virtually visit" real world sites of interest via 3D VR equipment controlling remote UAVs via the internet, thus providing a real alternative to the usual requirement in many cases, to travel to remote places in person.

Risks & Challenges

There are many challenges to the project, including requirement for sites of interest, and conformance with regulations, as well as the obvious technical challenges of the REMMI-UAV, such as latency.

Why We Will Succeed (And others will fail)

The author has a track record of successfully negotiating licensing deals with world class companies, and is a veteran of many technical campaigns. He is excited about this project, and embarking on it has been one of the biggest decisions of his life. Model Based Systems Engineering is most potent in new companies, where there has been no time to get into bad habits, or to have to interface with older legacy systems or processes. Further, Model Based Design is most suited to complex, heavily legislated systems, such as the way UAVs will require to be in the near future. In fact we would argue that it is an absolute necessity for successful commercial UAV manufacturing long term. Model Based Design techniques will become necessary in the near future in order to meet safety legislation. This is due to the impracticality of attempting to  police the users of the systems; it will be necessary for authorities to instead enforce manufacturers to build systems which are designed to be provably immune to most forms of abuse. This will be practically impossible without the use of model based design techniques. The Author is a specialist in these techniques applied to UAVs due in part to his recent experience on the ASTRAEA project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell folks about the project! If you know of any real world sites that might be candidate REMMI-UAV sites of interest to visitors, let us know! We look forward to working with you.

REMMI-UAVs will be capable of being logged into by prospective remote tourists via the internet, for a small fee of the order of a few dollars, or for free, depending on the site. The remote tourist will then be able to navigate the UAV around the remote site using keyboard and mouse, whilst turning their head to look in any direction, in the same way as a player using VR equipment would do with an avatar in an online multiplayer game.The REMMI-UAV will behave such that it will operate to autonomously preserve the safety and privacy of other site occupants, as well as itself, whilst being under the direction of the remote user. If the user is equipped with an Oculus Rift or compatible VR headset, then the tour can be experienced in full 3D stereoscopic vision. Otherwise the tour will be in standard HD graphic mode. If the user loses control of the REMMI-UAV for any reason, the UAV will endeavor to autonomously return to base, or otherwise render itself safe to all.A REMMI-UAV pilot training program has also been developed in an online virtual world. This trains prospective REMMI-UAV pilots in the skills needed to maneuver the REMMI-UAVs as though in the real world, in a simulated environment without physical risk. The REMMI-UAV pilots course though fun, is compulsory for all prospective REMMI-UAV pilots, for reasons of safety.About UsREMMI - “Remote-me”“We”, the REMMI Project: Frederick Bott & REMMI LTD (Full liability), and without liability; Partners, Contributors, Supporters, Employees, and others as they arise (See Credits)Frederick Bott is a Chartered Engineer (CEng). He is qualified with a BEng, in Electrical and Electronic Engineering, and an MSc in Concurrent Engineering. He has since worked continuously in senior roles in industry for over 20 years, often on a limited company consultant basis. Companies previously worked for include Thales, BAE Systems, EADS Astrium, Selex, GE Aviation, and Cobham. He is a historical patentee and published technical author, and has also published software on Model Based Design of planar magnetic components, and Satellite Orbital Simulation. He is currently working in a permanent role, in Research and Technology with Cobham Mission Equipment in Wimborne, as Systems Engineer, Model Based Design. His main R&T project in this role was the ASTRAEA project, in which he was a key member of the Autonomous Air to Air Refuelling (AAAR) Modelling and Simulation team. He also served as Cobham’s representative at the ASTRAEA JARC meetings, in direct consultation with UK CAA. He will be giving up his Cobham employment voluntarily to fully engage with this, the REMMI project, in April 2015.What We NeedWe need initially to raise around £20K, to fund the main detailed mathematical and physical modelling software tools (Currently using home & demo versions for the demos). If we are lucky enough to have surplus funds, these will go towards the carbon fibre 3D printer needed later (Around £10K, Long lead time) to manufacture the UAV chassis and custom parts. The remainder of the project including manufacture and supply of prototype and Production units is intended to be funded by stretch campaigns, and /or overfunding. All funds recieved via Indiegogo will be invested in the REMMI program.What You GetPlease see pledges for details. All pledging is now aimed at Holiday and Tourism and other companies who may wish to benefit from having the REMMI-UAV service at their site(s)What if the funding Goal is Not Met?If the first target of £20,000 is not met, all received donations will be refunded and the project will be removed from crowd funding. The REMMI-UAV project may continue on a standard privately funded basis.The Project ImpactThe utility of the REMMI-UAV product and services will be the first ever of its kind, allowing users to remotely "Virtually visit" real world sites of interest via 3D VR equipment controlling remote UAVs via the internet, thus providing a real alternative to the usual requirement in many cases, to travel to remote places in person.Risks & ChallengesThere are many challenges to the project, including requirement for sites of interest, and conformance with regulations, as well as the obvious technical challenges of the REMMI-UAV, such as latency.Why We Will Succeed (And others will fail)The author has a track record of successfully negotiating licensing deals with world class companies, and is a veteran of many technical campaigns. He is excited about this project, and embarking on it has been one of the biggest decisions of his life. Model Based Systems Engineering is most potent in new companies, where there has been no time to get into bad habits, or to have to interface with older legacy systems or processes. Further, Model Based Design is most suited to complex, heavily legislated systems, such as the way UAVs will require to be in the near future. In fact we would argue that it is an absolute necessity for successful commercial UAV manufacturing long term. Model Based Design techniques will become necessary in the near future in order to meet safety legislation. This is due to the impracticality of attempting to  police the users of the systems; it will be necessary for authorities to instead enforce manufacturers to build systems which are designed to be provably immune to most forms of abuse. This will be practically impossible without the use of model based design techniques. The Author is a specialist in these techniques applied to UAVs due in part to his recent experience on the ASTRAEA project.Other Ways You Can HelpTell folks about the project! If you know of any real world sites that might be candidate REMMI-UAV sites of interest to visitors, let us know! We look forward to working with you.

story:
Short Summary

  • After competing throughout the 2014-2015 school year the Boerne Champion Quiz Bowl Team has qualified for the High School Quiz Bowl National Championship in Chicago, Illinois. 
  • This three day tournament is considered the most prestigious High School Quiz Bowl event of the year.
  • The Team consists of Senior's Sam Farmer, Jack Hawkins, Andrew Roberts and Junior David Sanders, with Coach Matt Haecker

History of Champion Quiz Bowl

Although a recognized school activity, our program has received no funding from the school. All our registration fees and other expenses so far this year and last have been paid for by the student participants. But the school has given us permission to raise money for this once in a lifetime opportunity. If able to attend our team would be one of 256 teams to compete from across the nation at this prestigious tournament. 

What We Need 

Our goal is to raise $3100:

  • $650 is needed for registration fees (this covers our entry fee into the National Academic Quiz Tournaments' National Championship.)
  • $650 is needed for three hotel rooms for two nights (We will be staying at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare hotel where the tournament is held at a discounted rate of $109 a night.)
  • $1800 is needed for our airfare (6 round trip tickets: This will include one ticket for each of the four team members as well as tickets for Mr. and Mrs. Haecker, our faculty sponsors.)
  • Each student participant will be contributing $150 of their own funds to cover any other expenses such as food and local transportation. 
  • Any funds raised past our goal of $3100 will help fund the Boerne Champion Quiz Bowl team in future years

Impact Of Your Donation

If we are able to reach our goal we will be able to send the first team in Boerne to the National Quiz Bowl Tournament!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can send the link to this campaign to individuals you know who would  be interested in supporting our efforts. Thanks for your help!

story:
Where are we coming from?

Over the last 30 years, the company behind the Edublox Online Tutor e-learning platform, Edublox, has helped thousands of children to read, learn and achieve through home kits (including the popular Audiblox Kit) and learning clinics internationally.

Where are we going?

The next step in our journey is to take our programs online in order reach children across the globe through an easy-to-use and entertaining platform, developed by a leading children computer interface specialist, with inputs from a team of children. Our range of products will allow children to work at their own pace in the comfort of their own home and school. We have been developing this project over the last year, and need $43000 to complete the programming.

What are we developing?

Our range is designed to awaken the genius in every child through multi-sensory online solutions for children aged 7 to 12 years. We are currently developing 2 tutoring programs:

  • Development Tutor: Designed to enhance overall cognitive development, the program is ideal to improve the concentration, processing speed, memory and reasoning ability of children who do not experience difficulties with reading, writing or mathematics (Available from February 2017).
  • Reading Tutor: Building on the foundation of Development Tutor, this program aims to address reading and spelling difficulties, including letter reversals, slow reading, poor comprehension and dyslexia (Available from February 2017). 

How can I help?

Help to make a difference in the lives of many eager youngsters by:

  • pre-ordering credits at a large discount during the software development phase for Development Tutor and Reading Tutor.
  • donating credits to disadvantaged children through the Help2Read non-profit organization.

These pre-orders and donations will help Edublox to supplement funding for development and distribution of the online platform, which aims to go live by February 2017.

Please also help us share this passion project with all of your friends and family on Facebook and through the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
- SWISH +46 725 533 377 - GLÖM EJ SKRIVA PERK OM DU SKA HA EN

Educate and Empower people by helping us raise €6000

Our main goal with the first 'Nordic Cannabis Conference' is to create a healthy debate and understanding regarding cannabis and hemp as a plant and medicine, which we hope in the long run will lead to a decriminalization/legalization in the Nordic countries.

We wish for 2017 to be a ground-breaking year for the cannabis and hemp movement in all Nordic countries, by organizing and arranging this first-time event, and hopefully, annual event. 

We want you to join us on September 23, 2017 in Malmö, Sweden and be immersed in one day of an exceptional array of speakers, exhibitors, doctors, scientists, musicians, acticivists, discussion panel and much more.

The conference will take place at the conference halls of Kockumsfritid. Close to the centralstation and just a stone throw away from Turning Torso, in Sweden's third largest city, Malmö.
 

UPDATE NCC 2017!

Panel discussion: The Road to a Legalization
Magnus Andersson (PP) leader of Swedish PirateParty. Linnéa Bjärum representing the Liberal Youth of Sweden, Veronica Stiernborg from the Left Party of Sweden and as well a representative from AKC, largest think tank in Sweden on cannabis and hemp. 

Musical guests
Pap & Emblem, EMWANTANA and Cora Onori.

Stand up comedy
Henrik Mattisson

Lecturers/Educators
Tico Andreani-Fagnani, will talk about his time in jail for cannabis smuggling and the consequences of continuing a criminalization of cannabis.

Håkan Anderberg a man who decided to bike through entire Sweden, from the very south all the way up to the North, 1600 km, in the name of cannabis. He will talk about his time on the road and linking up with cannabis activists on his way.

David Duclos from Sensi Seeds, the largest seed bank in the world. Sensi Seeds are also one of the major players in hemp production in Europe. David will guide us through the jungle of hemp and inform us further on what importance it plays.

Aleksi Mikael from Helsinki Hemp + Herb will give us a lecture on the wonderful, medicinal aspects of cannabis sativa and as well tell us about the process of making cannabis legal in Finland. 

You can find our Facebook event here  https://www.facebook.com/events/115150272474114/

Tell a friend to tell a friend!

What we need & what you'll get in return

We are raising €6,000 (≈ 57 000 SEK) to pay for all costs at the Nordic Cannabis Conference. Along with the space rental, we must cover the cost of equipment, food, hired personell, accomodation, fees, guest & admin costs etc.

Because of the subject of the event, NCC can't seek traditional funding here in the Nordic countries. Thus having to rely on private donations and sponsors, and that is where you as an individual can make a big difference. 

If we do not reach our entire goal we will do our best to find a smaller/cheaper venue for this event. 

Cost Breakdown: 

• €1500 - 1,800 Space rental + cafeteria fees

• €500 Material & Equipment t-shirts, flyers, posters, banners etc. 

• €1500 Accomodation & Travel expenses

• €2000 Guest & Admin costs

We also have perks for our contributors which include things such as signed stickers, cups, t-shirts and reserved front row tickets to the event.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate everyone's hard earned money and understand that not everyone can contribute financially. So if you like the project, feel free to spread the word on your blogs, social media, among friends or if just come to the actual event :) 

 

About Us

 

 

Guerilla Tactics Entertainment is an independent production team that first came to light in 2014. We specialize in thought-provoking, entertaining multimedia, with a focus on telling different stories in unique ways and in a variety of genres that resonates with audiences both domestically and abroad.

Sweden has always been well known to the rest of the world as a progressive, forward nation, bound to protect human rights and fight injustice on all aspects of life. Yet, Sweden harbours one of the most repressive and destructive drug policies in the Western world. With that comes a stigma and an entire society that is brainwashed into "Reefer Madness" maners and also ignorantly proud of their lack of knowledge when it comes to drugs. 

Cannabis is still considered a slippery slope to heroine addiction in Sweden and even with harsh fines and potential prison time for soft drugs, such as cannabis, Sweden still has more than 500 drug related deaths annually and a current spice (synthetic cannabis) epidemic. A direct result of the Swedish criminalization of cannabis.

Sweden, a nation of 10 million inhabitants has roughly the same amount of heroin addicts as The Netherlands (ca 18 million inhabitants ), even though The Netherlands has one of the more liberal drug laws in the world. How is that possible?

That is why we at Guerilla Tactics Entertainment has decided to arrange this first-time, and hopefully annual, event together with the largest Swedish Cannabis Movement, "Avkriminalisera Cannabis" (Decriminalize Cannabis) to raise awareness and educate the Nordic people. 

The event will be completely free to attend for everyone and we'll hope to see you September 23 in Malmö

story:
Who Am I?

My Name is Mahamadu Abdul Salam https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000113... , I’m the Founding President of Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship (CLE Ghana)https://www.facebook.com/CentreforLiberty/ , an independent, non-profit, research and educational organization devoted to the principles of free markets, individual liberty, secure private property rights, the rule of law, limited government and innovation and entrepreneurship.

I took over Africa Youth Peace Call's flagship Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camp and successfully organized Winter Session Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camp 2017 on February 23rd - 26th at Wa the capital city of Upper West region - Ghana which recorded 69 participants across Africa. The camps creates a platform for young Africans to discover the philosophy of Liberty, free markets and gain knowledge of entrepreneurship skills. In an era where youth unemployment and economic freedom has become a chronic headache in Africa as a result of weak Economic Liberty, the camp offers an opportunity for the youth to start businesses & institutions for political reforms.

Short Summary

Northern Ghana is the poorest part of the country. Although there’s rich land in
abundance, people cannot leverage their land to, for instance, borrow money for education or starting businesses, or secure it for their children or spouses if something happens, because they have no land titles to prove the ownership of the land. This creates a lack of financial mobility and often violent conflicts. Land titles can be done on the Bitcoin blockchain at a very minimal costs, and without the involvement of centralized institutions. It's an unprecedented opportunity to free millions of people from poverty. Africa Youth Peace Call started this journey in 2015 to eradicate poverty and ensure economic freedom in the increasing impoverish zone of Ghana (Northern Sector) before it was sent hiding by the socialist cronies.


Therefore our Summer Camp is focus on continuing this journey on how the Blockchain Technology can be used to issue land titles. It will take place from August 23rd - 27th, 2017. We are Liberating Northern Ghana Economically and Eradicating poverty on the Theme: Entrepreneurship, Growth & Competitiveness; The Blockchain to the Rescue’.
 

The Impact

We are working together with BITNATION, the traditional rulers, opinion leaders and the people of the North to use the Blockchain Technology to issue land titles in the north this summer and beyond. BITNATION has tested and issued Land Titles on the Bitcoin Blockchain and we shall do same in Northern Ghana,  CLE Ghana will educate the youth, so they can do these Land tittles and private property registration in Northern Ghana and Ghana as a whole to free the economy using Blockchain Technology.

Throughout the week participants will learn entrepreneurship skills, explore the social and economic benefits of a secure private property regime, coupled with land titles, corporate incorporation, smart contracts and more, and how the Blockchain Technology can deliver that on the cheap. They will be assisted to draw an Action Plan to educate their communities to facilitate their cooperation and smooth implementation of the Land Title Project.

Our Blockchain Titles Ambassadors will form a network to educate their communities about the Bitcoin Blockchain Technology, and how to use it. Two days will be set aside as Cryptocurrency/Blockchain Business Opportunities Days. This will enable participants to explore the business side of Cryptocurrency/Blockchain, and how to start their own profitable ventures with it especially emerging Altcoins such as Dash.

Speakers like Prof. Noel Berge, Tim Tayshun, Afrikanus Kofi Akosah, Susanne Tarkowski Templehof, Dr. Tom G. Palmer, Prof. Ken Schoolland, Joyce Regina Brim, Adusie Akwesi, Prof. Brian Ogstad, Ken Van Doren etc shall be on the camp. Some of them will be at the location whilst others will teach via video conference. 

Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship has great experience organizing conferences and seminars together with ATLAS Network, Students For Liberty, Africa Youth Peace Call etc. 

What We Need & What You Get

It will cost $6,334.20 USD to provide accommodation, feeding, socials, conference & Learning materials for 50 students throughout the week. Students are contributing half of the cost with half coming from your kind donations. We are therefore raising $3,167.10 USD to make the camp a reality.

200 friends of Liberty & Cryptocurrency donating $15 USD each will see us through. Don't forget, if you can't donate you can spread the word. 

We also accept;

Bitcoin Donation: 1KCXoZSSFKzoQ1saEvU86dTUdpkaem6unq

 

Dash Donation: XvdZ4czLb8z35Y5d7YxgXfEL1hYQgSUyaV

Thank you good people! Help us Abolish Poverty & Tyranny in Africa.

PERKS

$5 - $30 An appreciation message by the president and a thank you post on our page

$31 - $50 A handwritten appreciation letter from a participant and thank you post on our page

$51 - $100 A handwritten appreciation letter from a participant and thank you post on our page & video of the camp.

$101 - $150 A video of the camp, thank you post on our page and a traditional clothe from Ghana.

$151 - $200 A video of the camp, thank you post on our page, media mention and a full traditional dress from Upper East Region of Ghana.

$201 and above: A video of the camp, thank you post on our page, media mention and a full traditional dress & footwear from Upper East Region of Ghana.

 

See A Breakdown of the Budget Below;

ITEM

DESCRIPTION

PRICE PER UNIT (USD)

AMOUNT (USD)

Venue

Conference Hall for 4 days

$100.00 a Day

$100.00 by 4 = $400.00

Accommodation

Boarding for 45 participants for including teachers for 4 nights

$22 a night by 45 = $990.00 a day

$990 by 4 = $3,960.00

Feeding

Breakfast, lunch & supper for 45 participants for 5 days

$3 per meal by 3 times a day = $9 by 45 = $405.00 a day

$405 by 4 = $1,620.00

Media

Coverage of the event

$50 a day

$50 by 4 =      $200.00

Program Banner; 6 by 4

$30

Sub-total: $6,210.00

Contingency/Unforeseen expenditure

2% = $124.20

Grand Total = $6,334.20

Donate Now, Share the Message and support Liberty.

A Donation To L&E Camp - Bolga is A Donation To Safe Northern Ghana.

Thank You for your continuous support for a free society.

in

Liberty

Mahamadu Abdul Salam

Some of them will be at the location whilst others will teach via video conference. Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship has great experience organizing conferences and seminars together with ATLAS Network, Students For Liberty, Africa Youth Peace Call etc. What We Need & What You GetIt will cost $6,334.20 USD to provide accommodation, feeding, socials, conference & Learning materials for 50 students throughout the week. Students are contributing half of the cost with half coming from your kind donations. We are therefore raising $3,167.10 USD to make the camp a reality.200 friends of Liberty & Cryptocurrency donating $15 USD each will see us through. Don't forget, if you can't donate you can spread the word. We also accept;Bitcoin Donation: 1KCXoZSSFKzoQ1saEvU86dTUdpkaem6unq Dash Donation: XvdZ4czLb8z35Y5d7YxgXfEL1hYQgSUyaVThank you good people! Help us Abolish Poverty & Tyranny in Africa.PERKS$5 - $30 An appreciation message by the president and a thank you post on our page$31 - $50 A handwritten appreciation letter from a participant and thank you post on our page$51 - $100 A handwritten appreciation letter from a participant and thank you post on our page & video of the camp.$101 - $150 A video of the camp, thank you post on our page and a traditional clothe from Ghana.$151 - $200 A video of the camp, thank you post on our page, media mention and a full traditional dress from Upper East Region of Ghana.$201 and above: A video of the camp, thank you post on our page, media mention and a full traditional dress & footwear from Upper East Region of Ghana. See A Breakdown of the Budget Below;ITEMDESCRIPTIONPRICE PER UNIT (USD)AMOUNT (USD)VenueConference Hall for 4 days$100.00 a Day$100.00 by 4 = $400.00AccommodationBoarding for 45 participants for including teachers for 4 nights$22 a night by 45 = $990.00 a day$990 by 4 = $3,960.00FeedingBreakfast, lunch & supper for 45 participants for 5 days$3 per meal by 3 times a day = $9 by 45 = $405.00 a day$405 by 4 = $1,620.00MediaCoverage of the event$50 a day$50 by 4 =      $200.00Program Banner; 6 by 4$30Sub-total: $6,210.00Contingency/Unforeseen expenditure2% = $124.20Grand Total = $6,334.20Donate Now, Share the Message and support Liberty.A Donation To L&E Camp - Bolga is A Donation To Safe Northern Ghana.Thank You for your continuous support for a free society.inLibertyMahamadu Abdul Salam

story:
Hello! 

This is Egle and  Gintare. We are two creative souls who grew up  in small town Rumsiskes in the middle of Lithuania. After studies, traveling. many life lessons and experiences, we came back to our homelands.  We both have 6 years of experience working with kids. Children's Garden idea is around for a while and finally we have the chance to make this dream come true. We kindly ask you to be part of it!

 

Children's Garden is proposed to be a natural learning environment for children aged 2 years old and above located in the beautiful countryside near capital Vilnius.  At its heart is our desire for young ones to experience and explore Lithuanian traditions and heritage. We want to create a space where children can gain knowledge about Lithuanian heritage by spending time learning and playing in spaces that reflect Lithuanian traditions. We want to encourage their curiosity about the culture from which they come.

 

Children will be able to choose from a variety of activities and experiences while immersed in a traditional Lithuanian country setting. We will provide natural materials such as flax, clay, wood, and stones as well as tools and guidance under trained supervisors to help them explore their imagination and creativity, all while forming lifelong friendships in a positive learning atmosphere. Traditional artists and craftspeople will make goods and teach skills so that all children can learn at their own pace while exploring what it means to be Lithuanian.

 

Our ethos stems from an aversion to 'Helicopter Parenting', where parents who take an overprotective or excessive interest in the life of their children can leave them lifelong issues around the fear of new things, general anxiety and dependence issues later in life, as well as a lack of basic life skills. While we would of course adhere to safety standards and proper supervision and training requirements, the main focus would be on nurturing what the children choose to experience for themselves, therefore allowing them the independence to explore their individual talents and curiosities. The goal is for children to leave the garden equipped with a stronger sense of self-confidence as they mature further in life.

 

Lithuania is currently experiencing issues involving heavy emigration resulting in the threat of a loss of cultural identity. Many young people have left the country to seek better opportunities elsewhere. Even those who have stayed have typically moved to the main cities and therefore lost touch with the countryside. As the next generation is raised, who will pass on the traditions and sense of cultural heritage?

 

Children's Garden will have:

1. A day care with provision for children aged 2-6 years old

2. Holiday day camps catering for older children

3. Summer camps for those children who may have grown up in cities or abroad and have lost touch with their heritage and ancestry

 

There is so much potential to create such a space with all these learning possibilities and experiences! As those little ones can’t wait to get started with us - this is why we need your help!

Your support will:

1. allow to provide children care for those in need and those who needs to get back to the roots of their culture!

2. promote and support local artists (perks you will get are handmade)

3. allow children to try out materials from the nature promoting growing them environmental-friendly spirit

What we have so far:

1. A country house with land (16a) passed down through familial generations located in a beautiful countryside setting

2. Access to knowledge and skills through artisans and craftspeople of traditional Lithuanian heritage and activities

3. A passion for independent and group learning through direct interaction with real working tools and materials

4. A love of creating and passing on a sense of one's roots from a young age as a basis for continuing to develop through one's life

 

Our 'To-Do' list:

1. We really need to fix up the house in order to provide a suitable indoor learning space for the children. The main issues include replacing and updating the roof, heating system, windows and doors.

2. We would love to build an outdoor kitchen for our lovely summer weather and for the children to experience traditional outdoor cooking

3. We will create secure learning spaces and environments in which children can play, learn and explore; each with a unique focus such as  the pottery corner, the veggie garden, the greenhouse and hopefully one day a small animal house too.

Thank you so much for your time, donation and interest. If you believe in this dream with me - please share this page with your friends! 

With sun,

Egle and Gintare

story:
To be able to attend this event each person needs to secure funds for traveling to and from Sochi. This is where we need your support. We are so grateful for everyone’s continued support of MyStory and would like to ask you to help us again by donating whatever amount you are able to. Each act of support is warmly received and appreciated by us.

A little bit about ourselves:

In July 2014 we took part in the International Citizen Service program with Tearfund, which changed all our lives and impacted us positively. In a team of Rwandans and UK volunteers, we worked day by day to help vulnerable people to lift themselves out of poverty in 10 weeks (Team Video) .

Afterwards, Jean Luc Habimana and myself were lucky to win ICV Alumni Grant from Tearfund that helped start a project called “the Green Saves”, with the help of our two colleagues. The project helped the beneficiaries who were the occupants of refugee camp to start a new life, through training them about self-help groups (which help them to save from whatever they have, use the savings in resolving their own problems and give them the opportunity to start small businesses), nutrition and making kitchen gardens (more about the Green Saves Project is available here).

Today, Jean Luc and I with other colleagues have a social organization called MyStory that uses stories to inspire, connect and enable young people to bring their dreams to life through telling motivating stories and bringing people together and we were lucky to be selected to represent Rwanda at the 19th World Festival of Youth and Students in Sochi, Russia this October (one week to go).This is an amazing opportunity to share inspirational stories on a global youth platform and also bring those stories back to Rwanda, as well as having open discussions on global issues.

For this to happen we need a support in covering traveling costs to and from the event venue.

story:
Story of Oh Suzannah Studio

  • I have taught piano lessons for over 16 years, including piano lab classes at West Coast Baptist College in Lancaster, CA.
  • Right now I'm booked to capacity with 50 students a week at Oh Suzannah Music Studio.
  • I have a waiting list of students that I would love to teach, including kids from my network of foster families and students in the Pinwheel Tutoring program.
  • Contributors will make way for at least two sponsored classes a semester.
  • Contributors will also make it possible for me to provide instructional videos for anyone wanting to learn (more) piano for personal enjoyment, church worship, or band/orchestra opportunities.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $6,000 for a basic piano lab of 5 student keyboards with headsets, a teacher keyboard and master sound board. You can view the potential labs here:
  1. Suzuki lab 1
  2. Suzuki lab 2
  • Donors of $100 receive one month of lessons in person or online. You can also donate this to anyone of your choice.
  • Contributors of $1000 + receive a year's worth of lessons! Semesters are posted on ohsuzannah.org.

All funds raised will be put toward this piano lab and necessary curriculum and will benefit eager students waiting to learn. Any extra funds will go toward our Sponsorship Fund to help deserving students.

The Impact

  • This is a chance to not only be a patron of the arts, but also to provide a special sort of therapy, discipline, sense of confidence and identity to some of the children who need it most.
  • In the past four years, I have successfully secured sponsorship for foster children as well as students I have met through Pinwheel Tutoring. I look forward to exponentially increasing the number of these students through the lab!

You can see pictures of my students and studio here, and view the student sponsorship requirements on my teaching website here.

The Benefits are Huge!

Many people prefer what they know (private lessons) over something new! Here are the pros I will present in favor of a piano lab class:

  1. The class will be a whole hour, so students will get some of their required practice time in as well as group and personal instruction.
  2. Lower lesson cost, making it more affordable for families!
  3. More potential for duet and ensemble pieces- providing development of group playing skills.
  4. Increased accountability for practice time each week as class members report weekly.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, please share this with someone who might be able to!

Indiegogo has sharing tools you can use!

Thank you for your support and Merry Christmas!

Amy

story:
Short Summary

Mary Omble Wuya has worked in the area of gender and development for community empowerment for over ten years. She is the Founder of Centre for Empowerment and Advocacy in Nigeria, OCEAN Centre a community based NGO which works to empower women and young people in governance, leadership, water and sanitation. I have a passion for community development and I also love to teach and mentor young people. I will like  to attend the Hive Global leadership program in the U.S to strengthen my skills as a leader and to help improve on the leadership program of our centre for mentoring young people. This will significantly enhance and enrich our work in Jos, Nigeria in the area of gender, governance and leadership for sustainable development. At a time people are running away to other countries I think we should get the skills that would help provide the strong leadership skills that is required to make Nigeria work. With your support and contributions I will be able to attend this great opportunity to network, share experience and learn from other leaders around the world.

 

  • I already have partial funding from the Hive organizers for 750 dollars( this is really an achievement)
  • The remaining cost will go for a return ticket to the US from Nigeria
  • Accommodation and feeding expenses.
  • Visa fees

If I don’t reach my goals for the trip the funds raised will be channelled to support OCEAN’s leadership program for women and young people, but with your help and support we can do this!

Donate, 20$,50$ or 100$

IMPACT

Hive’s mission is to establish the world’s most impactful community of leaders. Members of Hive’s network hail from 50+ countries and are world-class entrepreneurs, creators, technologists, innovators, community builders, and influencers around the world. I would like to be part of this community but working at the local level in Jos, Nigeria to mentor and inspire our future leaders. Most importantly it will be great to hear from renowned leaders, their experience and be a part of the global network of leaders that are doing so much to shape and change our world. I have worked in community development for over ten years, raising funds, for community development projects in the area of human rights, gender, governance, leadership and water and sanitation.

 

I may not meet the deadline for registration without your help, because Hive Global Leadership is very competitive and its an honour to have been accepted, but with your  support in cash or in kind (providing a return ticket will be awesome)!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help spread the word out, tell your friends and other well-wishers to help contribute.
  • Most importantly use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word thanks I am counting on you all!
  • If you need more information contact me;omblewuya@gmail.com

story:
Das Buch

Mit Fahrtrichtung Esperanto (ISBN 978-3-9524594-4-7) erscheint nach längerer Zeit endlich wieder einmal ein Handbuch in deutscher Sprache, das dem Leser auf 140 Seiten im Format A5 aufzeigt, wie und warum man sich gerade in der heutigen Zeit für eine Idee wie Esperanto einsetzen soll. In den Teilen 1-3 spricht der Autor Klaus Friese über seine persönlichen Erfahrungen mit Esperanto und seinen Einsatz für eine Vision und gibt Tipps für das ehrenamtliche Engagement zum Beispiel an Schulen und diversen anderen Foren. Im Forum in Teil 4 erscheinen Beiträge von diversen bekannten Persönlichkeiten aus der Esperanto-Bewegung aus Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz zu den unterschiedlichsten Aspekten, wie Politik, Esperanto und Nachhaltigkeit, Widerstände gegen Esperanto usw. Es sind dies alles bekannte Persönlichkeiten aus der Esperanto-Bewegung im deutschen Sprachraum, nämlich: Robert Bogenschneider, Ralph Glomp, Jan Kozousek, Helmut Lasarcyk, Frank Merla, Werner Pfennig, Mireille Grosjean, Dietrich Michael Weidmann und Louis v. Wunsch-Rolshoven.

Infos zum Buch findest Du auch unter: http://informejo.com/fahrtrichtung-esperanto---...

 

Mit Deinem Beitrag kannst Du zur Realisierung unseres Projektes beitragen!

 

Für den Druck, das Layout, die Fertigstellung des Buches und den Versand der Freiexemplare für die Autoren und die einschlägigen Bibliotheken benötigen wir insgesamt einen Betrag von 3400 USD. Durch die zugesicherte Abnahme von 200 Exemplaren durch die Schweizerische Esperanto-Gesellschaft ist ein Grundbetrag von 2200 USD bereits gewährleistet, weshalb wir nun noch einen Restbetrag von 1200 USD aufbringen müssen, den wir versuchen über diese Kampagne auf Indiegogo zu sammeln.

Für einen Mindestbeitrag von 20 USD bekommst Du ein Exemplar des Buches.

Für einen Mindestbeitrag von 30 USD bekommst Du ein Exemplar des Buches mit einer persönlichen Widmung des Autors Klaus Friese und des Verlegers Dietrich Michael Weidmann.

Für einen Mindestbeitrag von 50 USD erhältst Du nebst dem Buch mit persönlicher Widmung noch je 1 Exemplar des Lehrbuches "Esperanto por Mondcivitanoj" und des "Weltsprachenwörterbuches Deutsch-Esperanto Esperanto-Deutsch" von Dietrich Michael Weidmann

Sollten wir das Funding-Ziel übertreffen, so werden wir die gesammelten Mittel für weitere zukünftige Esperanto-Buch- und -Zeitschriftenprojekte verwenden.

 

 

Wie kannst Du unser Buchprojekt ausserdem unterstützen?

 

Du kannst unser Projekt nebst einer Spende auch dadurch unterstützen, dass Du es bekannt machst, indem Du zum Beispiel in den sozialen Medien den Link auf unsere Kampagne verbreitest und Deinen Freunden und Bekannten davon erzählst.

 

Buchvernissage am 14. April 2017 in Zürich

Am Karfreitag, den 14. April 2017, anlässlich des 100. Todestags von Ludoviko Lazaro Zamenhof, dem Autor der Internationalen Sprache Esperanto, wird um 19h00 im Café Mandarin beim Bahnhof Stadelhofen in Zürich (reservierte Tische im hinteren Bereich des Cafés) die Buchvernissage unseres Buches stattfinden. Alle Unterstützerinnen und Unterstützer unseres Projekts sind dazu herzlich eingeladen. Weitere Infos siehe auch:

http://www.esperanto.ch/zuriko/programm-program...

 

Meilensteine

Am Freitag, den 24. März 2017, wurde das Gut zum Druck erteilt!

 Du kannst unser Projekt nebst einer Spende auch dadurch unterstützen, dass Du es bekannt machst, indem Du zum Beispiel in den sozialen Medien den Link auf unsere Kampagne verbreitest und Deinen Freunden und Bekannten davon erzählst.
 
Buchvernissage am 14. April 2017 in Zürich
Am Karfreitag, den 14. April 2017, anlässlich des 100. Todestags von Ludoviko Lazaro Zamenhof, dem Autor der Internationalen Sprache Esperanto, wird um 19h00 im Café Mandarin beim Bahnhof Stadelhofen in Zürich (reservierte Tische im hinteren Bereich des Cafés) die Buchvernissage unseres Buches stattfinden. Alle Unterstützerinnen und Unterstützer unseres Projekts sind dazu herzlich eingeladen. Weitere Infos siehe auch:
http://www.esperanto.ch/zuriko/programm-program...
 
Meilensteine
Am Freitag, den 24. März 2017, wurde das Gut zum Druck erteilt!

story:
About AMUN

AMUN is an opportunity for Albanian youth to expand their horizons. This is a meaningful experience for students in a country that up until 25 years ago, had closed borders. This campaign is dedicated to help fund the costs of holding regional conferences where students will demonstrate the skills they have been working on throughout the year.

What We Need & What You Get

AMUN is making this program as sustainable as possible through a student led local fundraising for transportation costs, and by partnering with local organizations like the Ministry of Education and NGOs. This year AMUN has partnered with the English Language Teachers Association of Albania - ELTA.

Students fund raise their way to the final conference but fundraising is not a common concept here in Albania, and can only cover a portion of the costs. Funding from this campaign will go towards transportation costs for student delegations to their regional and final conferences, as well as small conference needs such as snacks and printing costs. The venues are generously donated by local organizations and those moderating the conferences donate their time.

The first regional conference allows students to practice the unique structure and debate of MUN. Between the first and second regional conference, students reflect on their performance in the first conference and find ways to improve for the second conference. By the final conference, it becomes a true, spirited debate and collaboration for the more seasoned students to achieve resolutions and present solutions to current problems affecting the world today. In addition to the fundraising component, students also participate in:

• A community project that allows students to engage their local communities in the spirit of education and opportunity, while practicing skills like public speaking and community outreach

• A social media competition to raise awareness to other Albanian youth and get them excited about current issues. All the funds collected will go towards putting on the MUN conferences.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will allow students to experience something quite different than anything else they have encountered. Students can gain many important skills that aren't presently taught in the Albanian Education system. Albania is searching for its role in the world and these students truly are the future of Albania. Creating global citizens within the country is key to Albania’s success in a rapidly changing world.

AMUN is growing each year, and becoming more competitive as more schools and youth groups take notice. Groups that participated in previous years are extremely eager for the AMUN program to start up again, and those who were delegates and have graduated high school still reach out to find a way to continue to be a part of the program. It is a testament to the success of the program and the positive experience that students have year after year.

Risks & Challenges

Lack of funding is the biggest challenge as transporting students from their towns and villages to conference venues is the most important and costly factor in putting on conferences.

We hope that we will be able to successfully reach our goal and fund these students' costs of conference participation. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on your pages and websites! 

 

Thank you so much for your support, 

AMUN

story:
Paris Talks: The Project!

After a little more than three years of community and event management, time has come for us to embrace brand new challenges.

Introducing PARIS TALKS:

Paris Talks is a conference done in the form of short, powerful, inspiring talks (15 minutes or less), entertainment, and networking opportunities.

It’s a one-day gathering for decision-makers, artists, entrepreneurs, inventors, scientists, educators, futurists, environmentalists, economists, visionaries and any curious people out there.

This platform is a place where you’ll hear and learn about promising new findings, ideas and approaches on how to deal with some of the world’s toughest current and future challenges related to economics, finance, science, art, design, education, technology, environment and so much more.

Paris Talks will take place in March 2018 in Paris and will be done entirely in English.

After brainstorming for more than 12 months, designing the website, defining the conference’s vision, theme, and area of focus, time has arrived to get you involved.

What's the long-term impact of this campaign?

We really want this project to be a success and by backing us, you’ll have contributed enormously in creating:

  1. A platform that deals with serious issues that need to be re-examined
  2. The one and only platform that deals with issues related to the Future of our universe in Paris, France and in entirely done in English.
  3. A platform that doesn’t aim at predicting the future but rather warning and reminding us of the best and sustainable actions, to get involved into right now, to ensure a better future for the coming generations.
  4. A platform where experts and influencers in different fields will meet to network, learn and challenge each other to look at the future of our world with an unconventional eye.
  5. The Place where people from different walks of life, with the thirst for knowledge and the passion of inspiring others, can meet. 

What's the need...

Paris Talks will be an annual event, and the goal is that this conference will fund and sustain itself moving forward, but the nature of it being the first edition means we need a little help with seed money for up-front expenses such as:

  1. Securing the venue,
  2. Making deposits for keynote speakers (they’ll be announced soon)
  3. And Marketing campaign (printing, postage, advertising costs)

So, here’s the thing: Whether we meet our goal or not, any funds raised through this campaign will be an immediate and incredible jump-start for the conference.

What Will You Get?

€10 (I'm a friend) =  We'll send you a Shout Out mentioning your name and expressing our gratitude on The Paris Talks Website & Social Media.

€35 (Future Feeling) = A Huge Shout Out on Social Media & our Website We'll send you a Paris Talks' autographed Postcard and Conference T-Shirt from Paris.

€45 (The Virtual Future) = Receive a Special Link with all the conference's footages (Keynote speakers' talks, performances, testimonials), a Huge Shout out from Paris on Social Media and our website. Make history: your names will appear in the conference giant screen's closing credits and in the official program's booklet.

€60 (The Futurist!) = This package includes your Conference Ticket (50% Indiegogo Backers' Special offer), A huge shout out on Social Media & Our Website, Access to the Conference's Coffee Networking Session on the Conference Day in Paris. Make history: your names will appear in the conference giant screen's closing credits and in the official program's booklet.

€105 (To The Future) = With a few more bucks, you've got it all (and even a special invite to the cocktail Networking party)! We'll start delivering as soon as this campaign is over!

€500 (Business Backer - 240% Off Indiegogo Offer - Become a Conference Sponsor) = ● Table/booth space at the conference ● Email blasts ● Logo featured on paris-talks.com & printed materials ● At least ten dedicated Social Media Posts ● A sponsored blog post about your business ● Printouts or gifts placed in each delegate tote bag (provided by sponsor) ● Logo displayed on screens during conference breaks ● 3 conference tickets

 

...and not all donations are monetary!

If you cannot donate your hard-earned Euros at this time, we completely understand.

Here are other ways you can help:

Please please subscribe to our newsletter over at Paris Talks!

Spread the word on social media

Email us at : contact@paris-talks.com for more information on group discounts or sponsorship, speaking, volunteering or service exchange opportunities.

Paris Talks Project Timeline

Who We Are!

We're Expats Paris; The Leading Expatriates Community in Paris.

We reach out to the international community living in or visiting Paris: diplomats, foreign correspondents, students, expats employed by local, national or multinational companies, people on vacation or traveling for business… We also cater to the interests of local residents with strong ties to the international community.

Our mission is to enable our members to interact with other globally-minded individuals who share similar needs and interests.

Paris Talks is our new project and the idea is that it should be the leading platform in France entirely dedicated to disruptive Ideas about the Future of Humanity.

Paris Talks will bring innovators together from many different disciplines—Business, science, technology, art & design, environment, education, economy, among others—in a network that promotes the sharing of ideas.

Paris Talks, Fixing The Future.

story:
The Shining Red Dot - A Resource Book is inline with our SHINE ADA's mission in uplifting Business Community in Asia.

ABOUT SHINE NextWave Limited & SHINE ADA
Registered company in Singapore, with weekly/monthly business events & programs for SMEs online & offline, on Global Entrepreneurship Education, Connection and Funding(Private/government) from Singapore, going global. 

This is a very unique & exclusive resource cum inspiration book for SMEs
A must-have & must-read resource book for all SMEs that is ready for the dynamic leap in your business.  
All about internationalisation & value of Singapore as a Hub for your business growth in Asia/World!

It is written by prominent Singapore/Asian Conscious Business Leaders & Mentoring/Training & Connection Platforms for business owners, benefiting & supporting Business expansion, also about SMEs going global from Singapore. 

The book has the following elements to benefit SMEs & Business leaders
1) Inspirational stories of SMEs - Conscious Business Leaders benefiting from Business /Partnerships in Singapore, or/& grown globally

2) Learn about how to benefit from transformational /leading global business platforms in Singapore, that has supported the growth of SMEs in the last decades, instrumental in Asia & going global.

3) Resources and links to various government & non-government platforms that are benefitting SMEs globalisation processes!

OUR PROJECT TEAM
Chief Mentor - Dr AR Ramesh Nambiar
Project Head - Dr.h.c Azeeza Jalaludeen (Co-Founder SHINE ADA)

Forward by 
Dame Dr.h.c. DC Cordova
CEO of Excellerated Business Schools, & Money & You Program - USA. 
A Resource and Inspiration Read! 

Objectives of "SHINING RED DOT" Book : 
1) Inspire SMEs by Unveiling Inspirational Heartful Conscious Business Leaders in Singapore &/or Asia (About 30 of them), partnering companies &/or have HQ in Singapore, in a mission of Asian/Global upliftment.

2) Sharing the success stories & potential of Singapore as a Profitable Business Hub for Global Expansion. All the various resources & connections that has been / is available for SMEs to grow. 

3) Full of opportunities for readers(SMEs), with loads of 'lobangs'(leads) and avenues/platforms available through the chapter contributors, for business expansions from Singapore - and able to benefit using Singapore as the Hub. .

Plenty of exercises you can do, in the book, AND with connections - activities that they can engage with about 20+ contributors of the chapters in the book, business growth from Singapore, in Asia/Global, &/or benefited through connections from Singapore

TAKE YOUR COMPANY TO THE NEXT LEVEL OF GREATNESS!

We are printing 1000 copies of the FIRST edition. 
Paper back with hard covers - WHITE Look - first cover draft 

Original Price will be S$30. 
NOW pre-order offer @ USD20 per book. 
(Plus 1 Invitation to Book Launch)

All purchases come with Invitation to Book Launch on Aug30th 2017
Venue to be Confirmed. 

Get your mileage in this prestigious book, that is going to reach the world. 
LIMITED TO 5 SPONSORS ONLY
​Sponsorship (limited to one per trade)


Investment - USD1500
Sponsors receive
* 1 page advertorial in the book. 
* 100 books for them to sell OR give away to their clients. 
* 5 Invitations for Book Launch
* One Session Branding/Marketing consultation for your business. (S$300 value)

What We Need & What You Get
1. We want to take pre-order of this book, that comes with hard cover, and appreciate all the support to the chapter contributors & the work, that you can benefit from. 

2. We are Giving 5  businesses extra mileage - through the sponsorship (visibility) package as above.

3. Join us to Participate in our book launch on Feb18 2017.  2pm to 6pm.
All who do the pre-order will receive invitation for the launch.

4. Giving back to society is a must.
10% of all purchase value will be given to charity.

THE IMPACT WE ENVISION
This first of its kind venture, will surely create impact in the lives of SMEs, learning from the success stories of leveraging, global business mindset, inspired & getting connecting to all the various business platforms that has been supporting growth of the SMEs! 

Most of all, SHINE ADA, as always, inspire SMEs in Asia/Singapore, this time through the book, that will get them to take massive action for the next leap of growth, prospering their organisation & all they impact. 

Previous success with book launch.
We have launched our co-founder's book, in 2013, & got 2 of our contacts launch their books in the National Library as venue sponsor, over last 2 years.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't purchase the book, that doesn't mean you can't help others benefit from this book & platform. Think of your business friends & entrepreneurs who you know are deserving of more, and share with them this details. 

  • Help us share this with your contacts!

    LIKE US AT 
    https://www.facebook.com/SHINING-RED-DOT-Book-2...

    Also Like us at & for More information of our SHINE ADA work & testimonials of our connections & events at 
    www.facebook.com/transformationalprograms

story:
The school was the first school created on the Airport Road axis in Abuja, FCT almost 40 years ago and thus is a historic emblem of education in the nation's capital; it serves a diverse population of Abuja indigenes, the Gbagiya and Gwandara people, migrants to Abuja from across Nigeria, and communities of disabled and internally displaced peoples most recently fleeing the conflict in Northeastern Nigeria (Borno, Yobe, and Adamawa states). The community is a low-income community in need of more education and social development infrastructure.

 

In March of 2016, the OKE Love, Peace, and Light Foundation teamed up with private individuals, and the Embassy of Switzerland in Nigeria/Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation to address the lack of water and sanitation facilities in the school, collapsing ceilings, dilapidated floors, presence of a community dumpsite on the school premises, and rundown appearance of the school buildings, plus overcrowded and ill equipped classrooms. Prior to the project, there were no functional toilets or even running water facilities at the school, and students often approached the school through the multiyear dumpsite. 

 

Thus far, over the course of 2016, we have completed the clean up of the waste site, construction of toilet facilities, creation of a borehole for clean water, and started ceiling and floor work on classrooms. We raised over 10,000 dollars in a combination of grants and private support to get started and make progress; however, in order to complete the renovation, we need help to finish ceiling, floor, door and window work, electrification for lights, computers, and fans, and the final repainting of the buildings. This school serves 600 students who have been struggling in overcrowded and poorly equipped classrooms and a difficult school environment generally. The OKE Love, Peace, and Light Foundation, community of Karonmajigi, people of the FCT, and citizens of Nigeria are forever thankful and humbled by any support anyone offers to further the human development and well being of Nigeria's children.

story:
Congratulations on your acceptance to the University of Dope. Finally a school your mother would be proud of. 

University of Dope was founded on all college campuses around the world; in dorm rooms, lounge areas, basketball courts, cafeterias. Debates over who has the hottest bars, beats, videos, dances, and clothes are discussed in our university. This card game is where your peers are not only students but your professors. Figure out which one of your friends has a “PhD, Playa Haters Degree” or who is a “College Dropout”. School is in session. #UDope 

How Do You Play?

Requires a minimum of three and a maximum of six people to play. For larger groups, select teams and give a set of answer cards to each.

Distribute the answer cards to all players. Each player/team should have 4 answer cards marked A,B,C,D

Place remaining cards in a pile face down. Going clockwise, each player should take a turn hosting and reading the play cards or one person can be the “MC” of the entire game. The MC/dealer should read the cards aloud, first announcing if Pass/Fail or Pop Quiz question. After reading the question, participants have 6-10 seconds to place their answer card face down. When time is up, the MC will give directions to flip their cards revealing their answer choices.

“Pop Quiz” card, follow instructions on the card

 

Who Won? 

1.”Pass/Fail” cards are determined by: The answer selected by the majority of players. (Example: 4 Players, 3 say 'A' then 'A' wins) If there is a tie, the MC/Dealer decides which answer wins.

2. Each Pass/Fail playing card is worth 5 points. Winners of each Pop quiz challenge card stay in good standing, but no additional points. Loser receives a 5 point deduction.

3. Whomever earns “Fiddy” (50) points first wins.

 

Ways to Play 

Big Willy Style, Non Alcoholic. Keep track of points (Dedicated to Will Smith)

Thug Life, Alcoholic. Drink every time a Pass/Fail question or Pop Quiz challenge is missed. (Dedicated to 2Pac)

#UDope

What Is Included 

Includes 83 Play Cards & 24 answer cards 3 instruction cards. 110 cards. (65 Pass/Fail 18 Pop Quiz & 24 answer cards)

What We Need

Just like any school, we need your "tuition" to assist in mass production of our game for direct and wholesale purchases, awesome marketing and overhead. 

Follow our journey on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter & Pinterest

Risks And Challenges

University of Dope has already been developed in full and beta tested amongst 50 testers from different age groups and ethnicities. The only common trait was their love for music. At the close of this campaign we will be designing expansion packs and an app to coincide with our game.

Meet The Faculty

 

A.V. Perkins aka A.V. Supreme 

A.V. is a lifestyle content creator living in Bed Stuy "Do or DIY" Brooklyn, NY that may have been a 90's rapper in a previous life. Unfortunately, those musical talents did not transition into this life. Luckily, she developed other skills at Central Connecticut State University that resulted in a successful career within the film industry as a set decorator.

After experiencing the sudden death of her father, she channeled all of the handy lessons he taught her and created AvDoesWhat.com. No better way to keep his memory alive than developing an entire site dedicated to what they did best, build stuff. What began as a traditional Do-It-Yourself blog quickly grew to into a multi-media lifestyle platform including crafts, recipes, childhood anecdotes and travel. A.V. is determined to change the face of "DIY," by encouraging young millennials to realize that life is better when you Do-It-Yourself! A.V.'s  writing contributions and ambassadorships have increased her overall reach to over 10,000 people worldwide.

A.V.  is also the co-creator of University of Dope, an exciting-thought provoking card game that celebrates Hip Hop culture.

 

 

Marian Andoh aka Skinni Bee

Marian exposed herself to event planning at a very young age. She planned her very first party when she was just 8 years old. It was her own birthday celebration, of course.

She attended Georgia State University, majoring in public relations. In her early college years she became the event coordinator for various clubs and organizations on campus. Atlanta became the city where she honed her skills.  She interned at a PR company helping plan launch parties and other various events for high-end retailers and celebrities. During this time it allowed the lifelong music lover to explore another interest of hers, DJing. Assuming the stage name DJ Skinni Bee, Marian played the latest and greatest Hip Hop tunes in the hottest venues within the Atlanta area from 2006-2013.

Since 2013, she launched her own event planning company JM Event Design, based in Hartford, CT. From birthday parties to baby showers to weddings, her company’s love for creating unforgettable moments is apparent. She truly enjoys every minute and loves seeing something that was a mere vision come to fruition.

Marian is also the co-creator of University of Dope, an exciting-thought provoking card game that celebrates Hip Hop culture.

story:
Hi my name is Steven Edwards I am the parent of two mixed raced boys. Seven years ago my elder son (who is now 14)  came home from school  and asked  me a question I was not really prepared for . He said “Some of the children said they were Indian and others said they were African but they said I am neither and nobody. Daddy what am I?” and I replied “Son you are beautiful”.  I then proceeded to tell him a story entitled “Six of One Half a Dozen of the Other. “  It’s a story of a fish called JOEY whose mother was a rainbow trout and father was a Barracuda.  Without giving too much of it away, at the end of the story his reply was  “Daddy I know what I am now , I am beautiful!”

This has been a long six year journey . We've just finished illustrating and editing the book. But we need your help in getting it printed and 11 minutes of the digital version animated. In this volatile time of race talk and race relations, I want you to help me to send a message throughout the world that “LOVE CONQUERS ALL”. No matter your color, class or creed together we can make this world a better place for our children.  A place where they are free to be themselves, and do that which they were created for.

We want to partner with you to accomplish the following:

Purchase ISBN numbers to create several formats of the book 

Print, Market and Distribute the first 10 000 copies.

Create the digital version with 11 minutes of animation

Design and create a mobile app that would facilitate the  animation 

The book has been written, illustrated and edited, talent has been sourced we just need you, to  add the missing piece of the puzzle.​​

When I tried to do this, six years ago it was ten times as much. It was virtually impossible, but with the technological advancements and crowd funding opportunities made since then, the time is now.

Whether it’s five dollars or five thousand we are grateful for every cent that would be given in support of this project. More than ever the world needs this message and we would appreciate your help in spreading it. Please share the campaign on your social media pages and lets create the world that we want to live in.

story:
THE 12 AND UNDER SUPER COOL POETRY OPEN MIC!! 

King Thomas Moore is the youngest Knight Arts Foundation Award Winner in History. He's a 10 year old poet, and he is on a mission to create a space that supports youth voices.  He created and hosts The 12 and Under Super Cool Poetry Open Mic!!  Now he has to raise 15k to match his grant award.  The 12 and Under Super Cool Poetry Open Mic is an open mic and workshop series geared toward children under 12 year old!  We have partnered with The Motown Museum to kick off our poetry workshops in MAY for all children who sign up!  A series of workshops will help build up the writing and exposure to poetry to our elementary aged youth. King  created a fun, educational space for his friends and peers to be able to express themselves fully.  He's already doing the work, he just needs  funds to pay for the full program and help us market at home and across the country. 

Who are you supporting? 

Our Kids!  The money raised will help us publish an anthology of the Super Cool Poets work.  It will also help us produce an exciting  culminating event at a large cultural institution in the city.  It will help us pay for t-shirts, bags, pens, notebooks,  (cool literacy swag) etc, and also allow us to pay  our workshop facilitators and the spaces to do this important youth driven literacy work, fueled by the vision of a 10 year old budding poet and youth leader. 

This project is valuable to my son, because he has been empowered by writing and reading poetry and he wants other children his age to have this same experience together in a safe place.  King has performed his work all over the country, and is becoming more confident in the process.  We've been getting beautiful turn outs and feedback every time we produce the event.

"As a professional poet and book publisher, I have been inspired so much by the vision of my young son.  He has a big heart and I'm loving watching him grow and become a void-filler at such a young age.  I hope that you can help us reach this goal, as we want to get to work with the first set of workshops and getting SUPER COOL participants signed up for  summer classes.  The open mic is already headed to Gallery 992 in  Atlanta, GA  as a part of a major arts and literature festival.  

Supporting this effort, could just mean sharing it with someone who can make a donation, or a corporate entity that may want to help us buy gift bags or ice cream for our young poets. This is a growing process for us, and both myself and my son King are excited about serving the City of Detroit with this effort and as King said in the video, taking The 12 and Under Super Cool Poetry Open Mic Movement  to children around the world:) "  -jessica Care moore 

If you prefer to write a check to King Moore directly, please make check payable to:

 The Jess Care Moore Foundation or King Moore-Poole  (please specify super cool donation in memo)

1401 W Fort St. #442488  Detroit, MI 48244

www.supercoolpoetry.com 

 

Thank You for your support!!

story:
Women Do Tech 

Women Do Tech is a digital inclusion center for women and girls in Honduras. The main objective is to promote entrepreneurship and the empowerment of women in the technology sector through training programs and events for every woman and girl with the desire to learn.

In order to provide these opportunities, Women Do Tech collaborates with businesses and educational institutions to make tech education accessible to all women and girls in Honduras, including those in some of the most vulnerable areas of Honduras. The classes teach women and girls about robotics, programing, video games, virtual reality, mixed reality, design and web design. 

The second edition of the Women Do Tech Event will take place on 17 November. This is the festival of technological entrepreneurship where we gather great national and international experts within the industry, to expose their knowledge and ideas to more than 500 women, in a day of talks, panels and workshops. There will also be a Pitch battle, which is a competition of technology-based startups led by women.

The Women Do Tech Event seeks to encourage the creation of new companies that promote females within the tech sector. The top 2 prizes are seed capital for the winners to start their project, as well as coaching as part of an incubation process to guide their companies.

Please feel free to check out our website and social media to know more about us:

http://www.womendotech.co

https://es-la.facebook.com/WomenDTech/

The Impact

To date they have trained over 1,500 girls and women in different technological areas, improved their creativity and talent and identified opportunities to develop their ideas through a coaching program.

Over 900 people attended the event last year in San Pedro Sula, with 90% of those being women. They bring international and national speakers that act as positive role models of women in the tech industry and allow a chance for the speakers, companies and the women attendees to network and interact.

What We Need

Your generous contribution, of any size at all, will help towards the event in November as well as our Impact Program. The Impact Program provides free classes to women and girls from some of the most vulnerable areas of Honduras.

The needs that we must cover for the event day are:

  • $ 2,500 Assembly of the Event, including equipment and staff services
  • $ 240 Hosting 3 nights for International Speakers in the Plaza Juan Carlos Hotel

Ongoing Impact Program costs include:

  • $50 for each Robotics kit needed
  • $150 for each Virtual Reality kit 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help with funding the event and programs will be greatly appreciated. However, whether you are able to support financially or not, please help us get the word out by sharing our campaign. 

A huge thanks from Women Do Tech!

story:
Le yoga est un merveilleux outil de réduction du stress et de connexion avec son corps et son être intérieur.

Trop souvent, les personnes rondes pensent que le yoga n'est pas fait pour elles et les cours offerts ne sont pas toujours accessibles pour cette clientèle.

Ma mission: partager mes connaissances pour rendre le yoga plus accessible aux personnes rondes!

Je m’intéresse au yoga depuis 2011. J'ai complété ma formation de 200 h en yoga Kripalu en 2014 et j'ai également complété des formations complémentaires en yoga restaurateur, en Curvy Yoga et en Yoga Rondeurs.

J'aborde la pratique du yoga avec conscience et acceptation de soi, tel que l’on est, dans l’instant présent. Je privilégie la douceur, le respect de soi et je propose plusieurs alternatives ou modifications.

Les fonds amassés pendant cette campagne permettront de m'aider dans la création de vidéos de yoga, plus spécifiquement pour:

- L'achat de matériel audiovisuel (ordinateur, caméscope, trépied, micro, logiciel de montage, lumières, etc)
-L'achat d'accessoires de yoga (traversins, tapis, blocs, courroies, couvertures)
-L'agrandissement du studio de yoga pour en faire un studio d'enregistrement en enlevant un mur entre deux chambres. Il sera possible également d'accueillir dans cette nouvelle pièce 4 à 5 personnes pour des cours semi-privés.
-La création d'un site Web

Merci infiniment de participer à mon projet!

Sincèrement,

Mélanie
