story:
If you believe in the importance of expanding awareness of the repression of LGBTI people in 76+ countries with anti-gay laws, please support the work of Erasing 76 Crimes and its French-language companion, 76 Crimes en français.

The blogs focus on the human toll of those countries’ anti-gay laws and on the struggle to repeal them. As part of that work, we publish a list of hundreds of LGBTI people currently in prison or awaiting trial on homosexuality-related charges, a sad tally of LGBTI people murdered worldwide and an archive of positive articles about progress toward equality and fair treatment.

You can contribute directly through this site, or make a U.S. tax-deductible contribution through the St. Paul’s Foundation for International Reconciliation website. (On the foundation's site, specify “Erasing 76 Crimes Blog” in the drop-down menu on the lower half of the page under the heading “Donated For.”)

Please share this appeal with friends and colleagues who also might want to support truthful reporting about the status of LGBTI people worldwide.

The blogs’ publisher, editors and reporters all work on a volunteer basis. Only the reporters receive any money, and that is limited to reimbursement of expenses. Those include costs such as bus fare to reach locations where LGBTI defendants have been imprisoned for their sexual orientation, telecommunication costs, and sometimes the price of a soft drink for a government official who otherwise won’t agree to be interviewed.

The editors of the blog have paid those expenses from our pockets, supplemented by very modest earnings from sales of the blog’s book “From Wrongs to Gay Rights.”

Now we are offering you the opportunity to contribute to this quest for justice for LGBTI people. What will you receive in return for your donation?

  • Realization that you are helping to pay the reporting expenses incurred by each of the writers of articles on the website.
In addition, for contributions of $150 or more, you will receive:
• A signed copy of the book “From Wrongs to Gay Rights.”

Your donations will support the continued work of the blog’s reporting team and, if possible, will allow us to expand our news coverage to additional repressive countries and perhaps even replace the inadequate, aging equipment that our best volunteer reporters are using.

Thank you from everyone at Erasing 76 Crimes on behalf of the harassed, repressed, stigmatized and imprisoned LGBTI people of the world. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, you can:

  • Get the word out on social media. (The Indiegogo share tools can help you to do that.)
  • Follow the Erasing 76 Crimes blog by email (Sign up on the home page) or on Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr, and encourage others to do so too.
  • If you're a French speaker, follow 76 Crimes en français (Sign up on the home page) or on Facebook or Twitter, and encourage others to do so too.

Follow the Erasing 76 Crimes blog by email (Sign up on the home page) or on Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr, and encourage others to do so too. 

If you're a French speaker, follow 76 Crimes en français (Sign up on the home page) or on Facebook or Twitter, and encourage others to do so too.

story:
Short Summary

We're fundraising for the children living in the 'Amicii' (Ecce Homo) foster home. You can read more about the center and about the children here: http://www.ecce-homo.ro/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=54&Itemid=58&lang=en

Because on 15th September, the kids are going back to school we want to make sure they have everything they need in order to have an amazing start of the year. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need the basic school supplies:

  • Notebooks and covers
  • Biology and Geography special notebooks
  • Pens and pencils
  • Paper and colored paper 
  • Painting kits
  • Sports equipment

story:
After weeks of news stories and feeling inreasingly frustrated with the current situation of the refugees around Europe, and our governments lackluster response, Ellen decided to group together some friends and provide some aid-relief to these refugees herself.

Inspired by other people's stories, she plans to organise friends to rent vans and collect necessities (tents, sleeping bags, shoes, warm clothes, toiletries etc) and deliver them to the refugee camp in a selected Greek island. 

As a team, we have already organised two vans to travel to Bestival on Sunday 13th September, where we will be working alongside a local charity and taking part in the Salvage Operation. Here, we will collect left over tents, and sleeping bags, and anyhing else which could be of use. 

Alongside us will be a film crew, who will join us on our trip to a selected Greek island. They will be making a short documentary about our journey, in order to raise awareness about this cause. 

We need £500  MAXIMUM to cover all expenses, the other £500 raised will go towards buying food and supplying it to the distribution agencies in the camp. 

Please give what you can, 

Regards, 

Ellen, Zac and Bradley

story:
The Impact

This comprehensive online training platform will allow Libertarian Candidates and Activists to learn the ins and outs of running a successful Libertarian campaign and organization from their own home or in a small group setting. This software is designed to shorten the learning curve.

  • This is a first of it's kind Libertarian training platform.
  • We put on our first live seminar in April of 2014.
  • Be a part of this revolutionary new program by contributing to our new studio and platform.


Courses

Each Teacher has proven competence in their subject matter through their experience taking action:

  • Foundational Libertarian Leadership Level 1- C. Michael Pickens
  • Libertarian Communication- Larry Sharpe
  • How to Be a Great Candidate- Steven Nielson
  • Campaign and Project Fundraising- Jeffrey Carson
  • Libertarian Marketing- Daniel Behrman
  • Social Media Strategies- Alex Merced
  • Listening to Win- Martha De Forest

The mission of our organization is to empower Libertarian Activists & Candidates to reach their full potential.

Teachers

C. Michael Pickens, Course: Foundational Leadership
Michael has served as Northern Vice-Chair of the Libertarian Party of California, Chairman of the Libertarian Party of Washington, and has recruited and coached over 200 Libertarian Candidates and Activists across the country. His unique style of empowerment continues to motivate and inspire activists long after they attend his training. He is also the author of the book, "Libertarian Leadership."

Larry Sharpe, Course: Libertarian Communication

Larry Sharpe is the Managing Director of the Neo-Sage® Group, Inc.

He provides communication training, coaching and consulting to many industries including: finance, law, technology, media and government. He has trained and coached hundreds of executives, entrepreneurs, leaders and employees in communication from dozens of organizations all over the world.

Larry has been an interim senior executive for companies in times of crisis; filling a senior post and helping them find a replacement. He consults with law firms for jury selection and trial prep. Additionally, he consults on political campaigns regarding strategy and debate prep. Larry is also a professional speaker and has spoken at dozens of venues to a wide range of audiences throughout the US, Europe and Asia.

He has been:

  • a Guest Instructor at Columbia's Graduate School of Business
  • a Guest Instructor at Yale University School of Management
  • an Instructor for Baruch College’s Continuing & Professional Studies department
  • an Instructor for John Jay College's Veteran Career Transition Program
  • the Strategy Director of the New York City Bastiat Society
  • the Eastern Region Deputy Director of the Our America Initiative
  • And a candidate for the Libertarian Party’s Vice Presidential Nominee

He has a Bachelor’s Degree in Anthropology from the University of Maryland and lives in NYC, with his wonderful wife that he met in high school and their two daughters.

Steven Nielson, Course: How to be a Great Candidate

Steven Nielson is an Aeronautical / Astronautical Composites Quality Manager and Root Cause Facilitation Specialist. He has served as Chairman and Secretary of the Libertarian Party of Washington State, and as the Secretary of the Douglas County  (CO) Republican Party.  He has run twice as a candidate for state office, once for local office, and has advised and managed dozens of campaigns in Washington and Colorado, including drafting and coordinating a statewide initiative for Electoral College reform in Washington State. He has served as the Chairman of two government boards in his former hometown of Orting and has played pivotal roles in community organization efforts for political activism.

Nielson is a graduate of the Leadership Program of the Rockies, and holds several accreditations and certificates for Project Management, Team Facilitation and Adult Education, and Greenbelt Process Improvements. 

Nielson is a political strategist, team organizer, and problem solver. He has been credited as the first Libertarian candidate to defeat the Washington State Blanket Primary, and has been recognized for third party campaign results that defy statistical odds. His effort and demeanor have earned him the respect of his opponents, many of whom maintain connection for opinion and advice.


Jeffrey Carson, Course: Campaign and Project Fundraising

A true student of the world, having lived abroad for over 15 years and traveled to more than 50 countries, Jeff brings a unique perspective and valuable expertise to ECG. Most recently, he served as Director of Operations for Run for America, a transpartisan political consulting firm striving to recruit, train, and work to elect a new generation of servant leaders to Congress. Prior to that, he ran for Congress in Virginia’s 8th district (2014).

Jeff’s also a former U.S. Army Captain and Iraq vet with considerable private sector experience, first working in operations as a contractor for Google and then in product development and management for Asurion. He wants to engage and inspire the next generation of Americans by showing them there are everyday people fighting right now to break through party lines, disrupt the status quo, and positively transform the entrenched political landscape in Washington. He holds a BS from Florida State University and an MBA from Texas Tech University.


Daniel Behrman, DO's and DON'TS of Libertarian Campaigning

Daniel Behrman is the founder of Top Local Marketing. He ran for Texas House of Representatives in 2014 while working a full time job. He raised only $5,000 but was able to walk away with 23% of the votes. He is still very active in the party, and has inspired a few others to run for office in 2016 and beyond. He is currently working with multiple campaigns. 


Martha De Forest, Course: Listening to Win

Martha de Forest has been a libertarian since birth and is a life member of the Libertarian Party. Trained as an engineer (BSEE & BSCS), she worked in Silicon Valley, then homeschooled, published books, imported, worked as an activist, served as executive director of a non-profit, and has embraced other interesting projects as they have presented themselves. Long concerned by the lack of diversity in the Libertarian Party, Martha is now learning what Black Lives Matter and White Privilege means for libertarians, with the goal of learning how to better connect with all Americans seeking freedom and prosperity. 

 Martha is a certified hypnotherapist who works with clients around the country who want to improve their focus, self-confidence, relationships, and view of what they can achieve.


Alex Merced, Course: Social Media Strategies

Alex Merced is a long time libertarian activist and corporate trainer. Alex Merced has trained people all over Wall Street, created thousands of Libertarian and Economic YouTube videos, started the AlexMercedCast podcast, Started LibertarianWingMedia.com, and started Social Media Consulting company, Merliva LLC.

Where we are

Our Online Libertarian Leadership Academy software is complete and ready for content. Next step is to build out our studio to provide a location for our teachers and future candidates to use to create pro-Libertarian content. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign on facebook and other social media sites.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Together we can make the #RiseoftheLibertarians happen at a much faster rate!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Al Arevalo, the inventor/founder of Straptie.  The basis of design for the Straptie started with a simple observation.  With over 10,000 hours of soccer coaching experience, I noticed a continual issue with players’ footwear.  No matter what make or model laces loosened during play or were not properly tied. Efficiency,repetition, and progression are paramount in player formation...that all goes out the window when a player has improper cleats secured to their feet. For the more experienced players, loose laces not only create a physical impediment during play, but create a psychological disturbance. Posture, confidence, attention, and player formation as a whole diminishes with loose footwear. 

My simple observation was further validated when watching a professional soccer game and noticed TWO players kneel down to retie their laces during play. I started to think about a potential solution to this problem, and a few months later the Straptie was born.  

Modern sports footwear technology is trying to do away with laces, however, in high pivoting sports like soccer, lacrosse, rugby, and football the foot needs to have minimal movement inside the boot. This means the footwear should not stretch & feel like a snug glove. Rather, it needs to be secure and feel like taped up boxing gloves. 

There is nothing wrong with laces. It's the dreaded knot that needs to be eliminated and thats exactly what I did!

What We Need & What You Get

We have done diligent work in testing and choosing the best materials with the elite player in mind. In doing so, we have a great quality product and all the pieces are in place to proudly manufacture the Straptie here in the USA. To do so, however, we need quantities to catapult production.

My parents emigrated from Bolivia when I was a young child to achieve the American dream. I have a strong conviction with everything in place to begin manufacturing  here in the U.S. We can't do it without your help. For supporting this endeavor we are offering you awesome early bird pricing.                                  

Other Ways You Can Help

Gift a pair of Strapties to a loved one or friend. With our featured perk we guaranteed you will receive your Strapties in time for the holidays.

  • Share our campaign with friends on social media 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! or simply refer to www.straptie.com 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

Is this only for cleats?
No, Strapties wrap under the sole for to work with cleats but also wrap around the ankle/back part of high-top cleats and flats.  
What sports shoes use the Straptie
We have put Strapties on Soccer, Rugby, Lacrosse, and football cleats. They also work great on hightop wrestling shoes and high-tops of all sorts with tradition eyelet all the way up the shoe.
How old does my child need to be to use Strapties?
We have tested the Strapties on children and they work great. If they can tie traditional laces they can easily learn to use Strapties. The great thing is once Strapties are on you don't need to worry about them again!  
How do I know they will fit?
They are universal in size and customize to the width of your foot by customizing the cord length. 
So I have to install them?
Yes, you will receive Strapties with new laces that are low profile cords. We have how-to videos on our site to help with the process. Strapties are easy to install but kids will need an adult to help. 
I have more questions..
Ask us in the comments section and we will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

story:
This crowdfunding is for the creation of a series of card games all focused on Land Value Tax or Land Rent. The game will consist of cards with questions aimed at challenging uninitiated people's notions on economics, taxation and rent. The card game will be in the size of a standard set of playing cards, and each set will consist of 50-55 cards each with a short question and answers.

The game can either be used as a traditional game were players pick a card, read the question and choose an answer, to enlighten people to the issue, or as a tool for initiated LVT'ers to sharpen core questions and argument in discussions with non-initiated people.

Rewards for contributions to the campaign will be in the form of sets of cards for most levels. Feel free to distribute them, play with your near and dear, sell them if you want to, we want the awareness campaign to spread globally. If you want to contribute to the campaign but don't want sets of cards, please let us know after you have contributed, we can if you want send your sets to other groups or individuals if so is preferred or use them in our campaign.

We will distribute sets of cards to various public places in Berlin as well as to people in Germany interested in progressive economics. We can suggest you distribute your sets to local libraries, pubs, coffee houses, schools or groups involved in a LVT campaign.

Texts will be in English initially, but we will add translated sets when the project is going.

It's ideal for kicking of awareness campaigns and we hope as many groups internationally get involved in the project.

It could do for a perfect Christmas gift, so please get involved and get your sets of cards in time for the holiday season.

story:
My name is Agatha Maloda from Chamwino - Dodoma , Tanzania. I am a certificate holder of Marketing and a diploma holder of procurement and supply management from the College of Business Education. I am currently working with Chamwino Arts Center as a communication person and a Youth leader also working as a seasonal program leader with Rustic Pathways.

I have been working with youth from different countries for four years now, first as a youth volunteer in Bulgaria for the project Arts for social change with Chamwino Arts Center as a sending organization and Open space foundation as a hosting organization funded by Erasmus plus program of European union. I have also been working as a program leader with Rustic Pathways in Tanzania, Nepal and India. Participating in different international youth exchanges and different projects, the latest this year was a personal project named Youth opportunity recognition aimed at increasing youth's knowledge on how to recognize opportunities and use the resources around to act on the opportunities.

Working with youth from different part of the world have made me love and want to work with youth more and more. Coming with different youth project ideas aiming at making a positive impact to the community has been something so exciting to do in my life . As a result I have been thinking of different ways on how I can play part in acting on different challenges facing youth in my community. As a result I came with an idea of having a place where youth facing different challenges can come learn, practice and improve their knowledge through baking as a main activity, Making "Luseko bakery for youth " a place where youth will feel welcomed and take their life step from there.

This campaign aim at finding the Capital which is the biggest challenge for establishing this center . All funds from this campaign will be used for constructing the place, buying equipment and first three months operating expenses overcoming the risk of survival from luck of operating expenses. In Tanzania we have a say saying '' Youth is today's generation and the kids they do bring is Tomorrow's generation'' Let us help today's and tomorrow's generation then.

story:
In 2018, more than 120 girls, trans identified and gender non-binary youth will learn an instrument, form a band and rock out on stage! 

Building on the successes of past years, we are dedicated to developing and enriching programs that best serve the needs of young rockers in Toronto.

In 2018 GRCT is planning:

  • A March Break Camp in partnership with Dixon Hall Music School 
  • Two weeks of camp at the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts as well as one week camp out of our home base at the Tranzac. That’s 3 fun-filled summer weeks of music making, learning and dreaming!
  • A second year of the very electric Rock Camp for Grownups weekend. 
  • Continuing rehearsal and performance opportunities for participants, year-round.
  • The development of an early years program geared at children aged 4-7. 

WHAT IS GIRLS ROCK CAMP TORONTO?

Girls Rock Camp Toronto is a volunteer based organization that creates the conditions for girls, trans* and gender non-binary youth to learn about themselves and others through music creation. Female-identified and gender non-binary musicians offer music instruction and coach the bands during band practices. We provide a safer space for girls, trans, and gender non-binary youth aged 8-16 to learn instruments, write songs, and rock out on stage. No previous music experience is necessary!

Research shows that girls’ self-esteem peaks at age 9, and that seven in ten girls believe they are not good enough or do not measure up in some way, including their looks, performance in school and relationships with friends and family members. More than half of all girls wish they were someone else. At Girls Rock Camp Toronto we help young rockers find their voices through unique programming that combines music education and performance; empowerment and social justice workshops; positive role models, and collaboration and leadership skill building.We are members of the worldwide Girls Rock Camp Alliance and share its values:

  • We value the power of music as a means to create personal and social change;
  • We value efforts that actively expand opportunities for girls and women;
  • We value positive approaches to fighting sexism;
  • We value integrity, honesty and respect;
  • We value appropriate sharing of resources, cooperation, and collaboration;
  • We value using our collective voice to further our mission;
  • We value diversity.
  • We value contributing a woman’s voice to the male dominated music industry.

THE GOAL

Is to raise $12,000 to help us continue to bring positive music-making experiences and practical life skills to countless youth and adults in the GTA. Our mandate is to have a camp that is accessible to people of all economic backgrounds, to do this our tuition is very low and we want to keep it this way. We want to increase the number of subsidized spots and get the word out to youth who would not otherwise hear about camp! Unfortunately, tuition alone does not cover even a third of our expenses. As our demand for camp grows, so do our expenses. So we rely on donations to keep our camp running.


Expenses that YOUR donations will cover are:

Scholarships: Through this campaign you can choose to sponsor a camper or an entire band, or add to our scholarship fund - helping us offer more subsidized spots so all girls can rock out!

Artist Fees: We value the contributions of all of our volunteers! Girls Rock Camp Toronto strives to compensate musicians and artists for their time. 

Gear: Because we are committed to giving everyone the opportunity to participate in camp, we do not require campers to bring their own instruments and rely on the support of our community to keep our gear in good working condition. We have also established a year-round borrowing program to keep campers rocking all year round! 

Other music “stuff”: Campers wouldn’t be able to go electric, stay in tune or bring the noise without patch cords, tuners, drumsticks, guitar picks, instrument cases etc.

Program Supplies: What would camp be without glitter, glue, paint, silk screen materials, camper notebooks, camper t-shirts, button making supplies, a projector, flip chart paper etc!?

Lunch: Everyone gets hungry after practicing guitar kicks and windmills. 

Logistics: These things may not sound so rock’n’roll, but they are essential to keeping rock camp going: venue rental, insurance costs, accounting and legal services, website hosting and maintenance, graphic design and printing costs for posters, showcase programs and flyers.


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

To help make Girls Rock Camp Toronto really great, we especially need your money! If you want to be involved but simply do not have the finances-there are other ways you can help. Get the word out about GIRLS ROCK CAMP! By pasting links to this page (facebooking, tweeting, pinteresting, instagramming, tumblring, emailing, etc etc etc)  you are helping spread the word more than we could alone.

THE IMPACT

By helping Girls Rock Camp Toronto you are changing the future for young folks! We are inspiring girls, trans and non-binary youth to be who they are and creating the conditions for them to be themselves by rocking out! We know what it's like to grow up without strong women and non-binary role models in music. Here is a chance to support and encourage young rockers to do what they love and have mentors by their side.


THANK YOU

We’ve come so far thanks to the help of many GRCT supporters who include:

Our incredible volunteer staff of 50+ people who are our band coaches, instrument instructors, support staff, workshop facilitators and all around amazing folks. They give up weeks of their time and measureless amounts of patience, wisdom and mentorship to campers.

All the local bands who have played fundraisers in support of GRCT and lunch time bands who inspire young music-makers throughout their week-long songwriting process.

The Girls Rock Camp Alliance for their guidance and mentorship.

OUR CAMPERS AND THEIR FAMILIES!

Improve your Speaking, Listening, Pronunciation and Vocabulary skills in seconds

Most language learning apps focus on grammar, translation, reading, writing. But when it comes to real-life communication, they often fall short. Our Need2Say app focuses on the most important real-life communication skills: Speaking, Listening, Pronunciation and Vocabulary.

 

Speak Fluently and Confidently

Unlock your second language potential.

    

Many people are looking for a language learning app to take them beyond the basics, to help them express what they Need2Say effectively and confidently.

 

As Seen in

 

You don't need 30 minutes a day to speak confidently and communicate fluently 

 

How Need2Say Works

The Need2Say app focuses on speaking the language, on correct pronunciation, of useful words and sentences in specific situations,...what you Need2Say when you Need2Say it. You can also get instant feedback on how to pronounce a difficult word or sentence. 

   

 

Customize your learning experience 

The Need2Say Library includes thousands of words from different fields. From college majors and TOEFL vocabulary, to Academic English and everyday words, the Need2Say Library helps you effectively communicate when you need it. PLUS, our Library includes idioms, word reductions, often used phrases, linking words, and proper names.

Speakbots is one of our favorite features in the Need2Say app. Why? Because our Speakbots help you practice a situational conversation before you experience it. This gives you the opportunity to understand the sentences, questions, words, and expressions you can use to communicate more effectively.

 

Plus, you can practice the stress, intonation, and pitch of your communication with the help of a native speaker. You simply record yourself. Our Speakbots give you instant feedback! I know you will love our Speakbots just as much as I do.

 

Why Need2Say Works?

 

Our founder has been an English as a Second Language (ESL) instructor for the past 13 years. Over the years, he has seen how English language learners feel inadequate and how they fail to communicate effectively due to their level of English proficiency. From international students to immigrants from all walks of life, their dreams and jobs depend on their effective communication skills.

This is why the Need2Say app is so effective! It focuses on speaking the language, correct pronunciation, useful words and sentences – it gives you what you NEED2SAY when you NEED2SAY it!

Need2Say makes it easy to find the right words for the situation you are in and our growing list of video recordings help you at the moment you need it. It’s like having a language teacher with you 24/7.

"You don't have to take my word for it!"

 

 

 

What languages will Need2Say support?

Need2Say will support English and Spanish when we launch in June.

After launch, we will expand to Chinese, German, Arabic, Japanese, and French, with more languages coming soon.

 

Compatible Devices

 

Need2Say App Timeline

The future is here.

 

About Us

 

Questions and Answers 

About

What is Need2Say? 
Need2Say’s mission is to help you communicate what you need2say in your second language so that you will realize your full potential in work, school and daily living. Our vision is a world without language barriers. Where people can freely express what they need2say without the need of an interpreter or translator.

Who Created it?
Originally from Mexico, Oscar R. Garcia graduated from the University of Alabama at Birmingham with a Master’s degree in Adult ESL Education. He is an ESL Instructor at INTO UAB Center from the University of Alabama at Birmingham where he has been working since 2014. He has extensive experience as a teacher, curriculum developer and has also been involved in various recruitment efforts at UAB to attract more students from Latin America. He worked for the Applied Linguistics Program at the State University of Nayarit in Mexico, and has taught groups from diverse ages and backgrounds in Mexico and the United States. Oscar has conducted teacher training courses though the University of Cambridge TKT (Teaching Knowledge Test) certificate programs as well as training workshops and presentations in State and regional TESOL conventions in the U.S., and Mexico. Oscar is a trained CEA (The Commission on English Language Program Accreditation) reviewer. In 2018 Oscar gave a TED talk at TEDxBirmingham titled “Build Bridges, Not Walls” and is also the founder and CEO of Need2Say.

Why should we use it?
This is for the 1.5 billion English language learners and for the 50 million Spanish learners throughout the world who want to speak confidently and effectively regardless of the situation. 

How much will it cost when it launches? 
$6.99 per month 

Where can we buy it right now?
On Indiegogo InDemand.

What do we get when we order?
Access to the MVP of the app in June and in August, you will have full access of the mobile app.

Why are you crowdfunding?
We're crowdfunding to finance development of the full version of the app.

Who should I contact for press?.
Please email us at hola@need2say.com

Tech Specs

What is the uniqueness of the technology?
This is the first app designed to help you say what you NEED2SAY in your target language when you Need2Say it. It has the best combination of the newest technology and human creativity (native speakers and language teachers). 

How does it work?
It uses videos of native speakers and language teachers to train your ears, mouth movement, eyes, and build stronger recall connections between images, sounds and meaning. 

Will there be updates to it in the future?
Yes, we'll keep adding more words, add new languages, features, and we will keep growing the library and speakbots database. 

How does it integrate with other connected devices? 
It will sync to your IOS and Android device. 

About the App

Does it have an app? Which phones does it work with?
It's an iOS/Android native app using flutter structure.

Can we also access app functions on a web browser? 
No, we don’t offer a web application. 

What can we expect from the app?

We believe this is the most effective, intuitive and easy to use language app on the market that will help you improve your speaking, listening, pronunciation and vocabulary skills in seconds.

How could I access the App?
You will receive an email with a code you so can access the app.

Safety and Regulation

What are the recommended ages?
The app should be relatively easy to learn. We’re working with our lawyers to figure out recommended ages (we’ll probably land on ages 4+).

Will this benefit my kids?
Learning a language is one of the greatest gifts you can give a kid. Aside from giving them a new ability to communicate with more people, it has a ton of documented side benefits, ranging from better test scores in all core subjects, better problem solving abilities, higher salaries once they reach the job market, etc. 

Where can I use it?
You can use it anywhere and in all kinds of situations. 

How is my privacy protected?
We'll be keeping user data secure, both on their phones and in connections with our servers. We'll use challenge and response method to establish a secure connection by using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) between each device. We value your privacy. We NEVER sell your data. PERIOD.

How secure is it?
We'll be keeping user data secure, both on their phones and in connections with our servers. We’ll use PayPal API to handle payment method, so that your card information could only be read by PayPal.

Can someone watch or listen to me?
No, we don't monitor users in that way!

Are there any risks associated with use?
No.

 

Credits

To all of my English and Spanish students, who despite the challenges and daunting odds of learning a foreign language, start to learn it anyways and achieve English and Spanish proficiency with only taking the first step. 

I love you all! 

Muchas gracias!

story:
Quick Summary: 

  • I have to leave the classroom due to a cyst in my spinal cord.
  • Teaching is how I help others reach their goals and I wish to continue that.
  • I want to finish starting a business that helps people learn English for free.
  • ​There is a paid aspect that is not required for 99% of the assets to be accessible.
  • Money earned will go towards the ultimate goal of free schools for underprivileged kids in poor countries to gain the skill of English for free. 
  • I have included perks to help businesses, non-profits, politicians, etc. 

____________________________________________________________________________________

Summary

Imagine being able to change the lives of many. Imagine being able to help people not only chase dreams, but reach out from the depths of poverty and become successful and thriving human beings.  English at Will has that potential. Through our website and upcoming app, there is a difference that can be made in the lives of many. 

Helping impoverished people excel has been my wish and goal with teaching English since I got my first taste while teaching abroad. I’ve traveled to favelas in Brazil and slums in Mexico. I have seen poor in Guatemala and Korea and it has broken my heart. I have dedicated my career to assisting those wanting a better life by teaching the skill of English. 

My love of teaching English began as a teacher in South Korea in 2011. That experience drove me to return home with the goal of getting my masters degree in Teaching English as a Second Language. With my bachelors degree being in public relations and business, this was a little bit of a switch up, but it was a move that I just knew was right. 

I have loved teaching every step of the journey and I have realized how much English can change the life of a person who has learned it. I have also realized how amazing the people are who take their time to learn the language I was blessed enough to be born into. 

I have spent the past 5 years as a college instructor teaching English to students from other countries. These past 5 years have been amazing. I have made so many friends. Even though I’m supposed to be their “teacher” and not their friend, I cannot separate teaching them from loving them, so, many of these students have really become my friends. 

I’ve been given so many opportunities in these 5 years. Instead of just teaching English, I’ve been able to teach leadership, also. I’ve also been able to coordinate and develop programs that have given me insights into how the programs are run. 

I thought that helping immigrants at the university level was going to be my career for the foreseeable future, but sometimes life can throw some unexpected curveballs. When things seem to be rolling along, speed-bumps often decide to slow you down, but sometimes, the path you have been traveling on becomes completely blocked and you have to take a detour. 

That’s why it saddens me that I will have to come out of the classroom as I deal with a medical issue that is robbing me of my ability to teach in the classroom. I have been diagnosed with a cyst in my spinal cord that causes numbness in my hands and pain in my neck and shoulders. This causes the actions of teaching to be almost impossible to do day in and day out. I was told by a neurologist to consider going on disability, but that is not what I am about. I would rather chase my dreams and help others chase theirs. So, with the inability to be affective in a full time position, I’ll have to make a transition into entrepreneurship. 

What We Need & What You Get

The problem for us is that our plan for starting this business is now being rushed due to the fact that I have developed syringomyelia, a cyst in my spinal cord. With the cyst, I can’t teach the rigorous classes that are required for English courses at the University level, because it requires a lot of movement, up and down, and looking around in the classroom. This is going to cause me to have to cut out my time in the classroom. I will not be able to continue building towards this dream the way that I had planned. 

That is the reason for this fundraiser. 

I am asking for you to invest in me with the end goal of me helping many people from around the world reach their dreams. With my inability to continue my career, we have to jumpstart this new chapter in our life. 

The process will continue with the app and website getting finished as I recruit 2 teachers to create content. As the app is getting developed we will be creating the marketing materials and designing ads to help teachers and students know about the free tools available on all the platforms. We will be building up the social media accounts while the app is getting finished. The recruited teachers will be trained and I will help them create videos and lessons that will be branded for the teachers to build their brand as the app and website are fully developed. 

I have insurance from my job for the next 4 months, so I will continue to get treatment as much as I can while this is active, but the business will be my focus outside of my medical treatments. I will also need to insure that we have the means to live on and I get my medical treatments as I build out this business. 

My other plan action will be starting my own tutoring classes at a local church. Though I cannot work at a university any longer, I feel I can still help people here in Florida become better English speakers and communicators with a less rigorous schedule.

The money earned from that can help with the development and deployment of the app and marketing plan. It will also go into equipment for making videos for students. The new iPhone has a great camera and awesome capabilities and I can do that on ATT payments. I will get a good microphone to capture audio for podcasts and videos. So while I build revenue to put into the business, I’ll also be able to give a high value product to immigrants in Boca Raton. I will able to give these dream chasers a valuable service for a fraction of what other entities are charging. 

Your donations will help me fully develop the English at Will app and website. It will help us develop free materials to assist English teachers have access to quality lessons and videos. Most importantly, it will allow us to begin the process of helping people from all around the world with a FREE option for learning English. 

When English at Will gets enough paying subscribers for the premium teacher access options, we will be set on our path of developing free schools for the underprivileged children who could most benefit from learning English. 

Your donations will be a HUGE step towards helping many people emerge from a hole that they could have never dreamed was escapable. 

So, please, give what you can. Every dollar matters in this mission to build English at Will into a ray of hope for those around the world who would benefit from English and for me, who is looking for a way to continue pursuing my goal of helping others reach their dreams. 

If we make our goal, we can begin the process of helping those in need right away. This will be able to be a full time job for my wife and I as we work to change the world.

The Impact

We have designed this business to be beneficial to English learners around the world who wish to learn for free. We will also have a subscription option for those who wish to have more access to a teacher. We are also designing it to be beneficial to teachers currently in classrooms by creating lessons for them to use for free and to help their students become better communicators.

Our model is also designed to disrupt the system with how teachers are paid. There will be a great benefit for the teachers who will work with English at Will. 

Our model is built around helping as many people as we can. Our mission is to help as many people chase their dreams as possible. 

Our end goal is for English at Will to have enough paid students and successful teachers that we will be able to open free English schools around the world. 

Our end goal is to be able to provide the tool of English to those who would otherwise not be able to obtain the skill. Knowing English can change the life of an individual in a country not as blessed as the USA, and I know that from being in the classroom over the years and from my time traveling abroad, is why I am passionate about providing low-cost and free options for the less fortunate to learn English. 

The other aspect of our model is to put the power in the hands of the teachers. We are planning on letting the teachers who create the content and provide the lessons keep the majority of the money earned. Instead of small percentages of the tuitions paid by students, we hope to help teachers essentially work for themselves with high earning potential. Teachers, who are the most important person after the student, often get the scraps of what the students pay. English at Will aims at changing that. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is having our model copied and not being first, but we are actually ok with that. If it leads to our goal of many people becoming better speakers of English and reaching their goals, we will be at peace with our model being duplicated. 

How You Can Help

Please, share this campaign with as many people as you are comfortable sharing it with. Please tell businesses about the services we are offering and how we could help them. Convince a company to be a sponsor and to have their logo and link on our page for people around the world to see that the business cares about them. 

 

$willhuff2016 - cashapp

My other plan action will be starting my own tutoring classes at a local church. Though I cannot work at a university any longer, I feel I can still help people here in Florida become better English speakers and communicators with a less rigorous schedule.
The money earned from that can help with the development and deployment of the app and marketing plan. It will also go into equipment for making videos for students. The new iPhone has a great camera and awesome capabilities and I can do that on ATT payments. I will get a good microphone to capture audio for podcasts and videos. So while I build revenue to put into the business, I’ll also be able to give a high value product to immigrants in Boca Raton. I will able to give these dream chasers a valuable service for a fraction of what other entities are charging. 
Your donations will help me fully develop the English at Will app and website. It will help us develop free materials to assist English teachers have access to quality lessons and videos. Most importantly, it will allow us to begin the process of helping people from all around the world with a FREE option for learning English. 
When English at Will gets enough paying subscribers for the premium teacher access options, we will be set on our path of developing free schools for the underprivileged children who could most benefit from learning English. 
Your donations will be a HUGE step towards helping many people emerge from a hole that they could have never dreamed was escapable. 
So, please, give what you can. Every dollar matters in this mission to build English at Will into a ray of hope for those around the world who would benefit from English and for me, who is looking for a way to continue pursuing my goal of helping others reach their dreams. 
If we make our goal, we can begin the process of helping those in need right away. This will be able to be a full time job for my wife and I as we work to change the world.

The Impact
We have designed this business to be beneficial to English learners around the world who wish to learn for free. We will also have a subscription option for those who wish to have more access to a teacher. We are also designing it to be beneficial to teachers currently in classrooms by creating lessons for them to use for free and to help their students become better communicators.
Our model is also designed to disrupt the system with how teachers are paid. There will be a great benefit for the teachers who will work with English at Will. 
Our model is built around helping as many people as we can. Our mission is to help as many people chase their dreams as possible. 
Our end goal is for English at Will to have enough paid students and successful teachers that we will be able to open free English schools around the world. 
Our end goal is to be able to provide the tool of English to those who would otherwise not be able to obtain the skill. Knowing English can change the life of an individual in a country not as blessed as the USA, and I know that from being in the classroom over the years and from my time traveling abroad, is why I am passionate about providing low-cost and free options for the less fortunate to learn English. 
The other aspect of our model is to put the power in the hands of the teachers. We are planning on letting the teachers who create the content and provide the lessons keep the majority of the money earned. Instead of small percentages of the tuitions paid by students, we hope to help teachers essentially work for themselves with high earning potential. Teachers, who are the most important person after the student, often get the scraps of what the students pay. English at Will aims at changing that. 

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest risk is having our model copied and not being first, but we are actually ok with that. If it leads to our goal of many people becoming better speakers of English and reaching their goals, we will be at peace with our model being duplicated. 

How You Can Help
Please, share this campaign with as many people as you are comfortable sharing it with. Please tell businesses about the services we are offering and how we could help them. Convince a company to be a sponsor and to have their logo and link on our page for people around the world to see that the business cares about them. 
 
$willhuff2016 - cashapp

story:
Background

We are a group of high school and college students from around the nation and world from the East Coast to Texas to Virginia all the way to Switzerland. Our diverse team offers a unique perspective in the classroom and how it is run from all of our experiences. Together we have created Lecturely a learning management platform. Lecturely was thought of at the 2019 Stanford’s Silicon Valley Innovation Academy. This platform utilizes students' interests that are taken at the account creation level to then replace objects in a Madlib style curriculum creation process that the teacher uses to engage their students. Using automatic reporting based on metrics such as correct/incorrect answers, time spent on questions, and work that needs to be done/is done a teacher, student, and parent can all be in the know of their student's education. 

Team

As a team of high school and college students, we see this problem first-hand at our schools. Although we're all high school students we are qualified to build this platform. Our COO, Jason, does software development, attribution models, and was responsible for bringing RedHat Academy to his high school through their ambassador program, a first for high school education. Our Head of Marketing, Caterina, got accepted to Stanford University's class of 2024. Our CSO, Josey is a senior at Chapman University majoring in Political Science and minoring in a combination of Economics Philosophy and English. Our CTO, Taylor, has got awards in competitions for his app development and has led many hackathon development teams. And our CEO, Caleb, cofounded FloatMe, a financial wellness app for employees (https://floatme.io).

What We Need & What You Get

We need financial assistance to support the technical infrastructure for a pilot program.  Your funds will be used for Amazon Web Services to support our pilot program in August for at least 10 teachers, that will each have at least 10 students on each of their accounts, that's already 100 users on our servers. This pilot program is to provide feedback to improve our learning management platform before we go out to districts to sell to them at a per student per month basis.

As a contributor to Lecturely you will be one of the trailblazers in education reform. Not only will you get the many items that come along with your perk but also you will be changing the lives of the many students using Lecturely. We believe in the power of interest-based learning and the chance it has to change the world.

The Impact

Ever since the industrial revolution, classrooms haven't seen much change. The ability of technology has increased exponentially every year and continues to do so but schools are being left behind. Schools today have the technology to bring education into the 21st century but companies aren't developing software that puts education where it needs to be in the modern era with a rise in specialized jobs and a decrease in industrial jobs. Our team noticed this problem and decided to do something about it. We came up with Lecturely, Lecturely is a classroom management platform that tracks students' interests and bases curriculum on those interests so it's no longer just math, it's math with Minecraft or science with rockets. Our Adaptive Curriculum will keep students more engaged and encourage them to pursue their interests rather it be tomorrow's doctors or astronauts, in today's world interests, are critical to inspiring the future generation that will one-day cure cancer and the first to step on Mars.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge at the moment is not having the funds available to support our Amazon Web Services servers to supply our users. Each user we add to our service is another risk we are taking on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not only can you contribute financially to support Lecturely, but if you are a developer, researcher, student, or teacher we would love to hear feedback on our learning management platform.

story:
Give today to support Tools For Peace programs.

Since 2000, we've provided mindfulness programs, classes, and camps to over 20,000 people, with a focus on inspiring compassion and kindness in their everyday lives. 

We primarily serve low-income youth from disadvantaged backgrounds in Northern and Southern California schools and after-school programs. Each summer, we host the Tools for Peace Annual Summer Teen Camp, a transformative weeklong experience rooted in practicing mindfulness and cultivating compassion. We've also fostered partnerships in the community, such as with Children's Hospital Los Angeles, The Boys & Girls Club of Pasadena, and U.C., Riverside Emotion Regulation Lab.

Our current school programs include: Tools for Peace Clubs at Hubert Howe Bancroft Middle School, Thomas Starr King Middle School, and Washington Irving Middle School in partnership with L.A.C.E.R. Afterschool Programs in Los Angeles. We also work with Dr. Sammy Lee Medical and Health Science Magnet Elementary School, Northern Light School, and Citizen Schools. 

Your gift will greatly impact our ability to help kids and teens integrate compassion into their daily lives and create kinder communities.
 


 

Our Stop, Breathe & Think Curriculum

Tools for Peace developed Stop, Breathe & Think, a step-by-step mindfulness, meditation, and compassion-in-action curriculum that guides participants through a variety of mindfulness activities, personal reflection, and group discussion. Students begin with an introduction to mindful breathing, a basic building block of mindfulness, and build upon that skill by following a three-step process:

Becoming Aware

Participants deepen their awareness of their thoughts, emotions, and physical sensations.

Broadening Perspective

Participants learn to settle themselves down and proactively manage their actions and reactions.

Compassion-in-Action

Participants engage in service-learning projects that address a community need in their classrooms, on campus, or within the wider community.
 

Help Youth Take Compassionate Action

You can fund one or more of the following Compassion in Action field trips with our partner schools:

  • Visiting local senior centers to share meals and create crafts with residents
  • Mindful walking and exploring nature in Griffith Park, Los Angeles
  • Volunteering at animal shelters 
  • School beautification projects, such as planting and nurturing community gardens and painting murals
  • Community beautification projects, such as picking up litter in surrounding parks, beaches, and neighborhoods
  • And more...

Thanks to Literacy, Arts, Cultural, Education, Recreation (L.A.C.E.R.) Afterschool Programs for being our partner in working in LAUSD schools!
 


 

    Your donation will help provide the following: 

    • Staff for our after-school programs
    • Field trips for our students to practice compassion in action
    • Craft supplies for kids to create murals and other projects inspiring kindness at school
    • Training for our Tools For Peace staff and facilitators
    • Mindfulness teaching materials for teachers
    • Activities for our campers and after-school programs
       

    Some of the great PERKS you can receive as a big THANK YOU for your gift:

    • Relaxing Chill essential oil roll-ons
    • Stop, Breathe & Think All Ages and Kids app Premium subscription bundles. Learn about and practice mindfulness on your own or with your kids!
    • A signed copy of Mindful Games by Susan Kaiser Greenland with an additional activity card pack
    • k.d. lang anniversary package including a CD, wine holder, scarf, and canvas tote bag
    • Hand-painted cards from our Tools for Peace Annual Summer Teen Camp campers
    • An original Tools For Peace: Inspire Kindness t-shirt with this beautiful graphic:
       


     

    Tools for Peace focuses on the skill of mindfulness, which is an effective tool in combating stress and supporting student achievement.

    Scientific studies continue to document the negative impact that stress has on learning and a student’s ability to succeed, and have demonstrated that anxiety and stress negatively impact a student’s school performance.

    We teach the Stop, Breathe & Think curriculum, which was created to address these serious issues by providing students with the skills and tools necessary to manage their level of stress, mitigate the resulting consequences, and to help students become successful in school and in life.

    Teens participating in Tools for Peace in 2016 reported they are better able to:
     


     

    We’ve continued our work with the Emotion Regulation Lab at the University of California, Riverside (“UCR”), which has been studying the effects of the Stop, Breathe & Think curriculum.

    Dr. Elizabeth Davis and her team have been collecting data during our week-long Summer Teen Camp for three years, and concluded a study of a year-long Tools for Peace pilot program during the school day at Washington Irving Middle School.

    Overall, results from these collaborations with UCR show that practicing mindfulness and meditation using the Stop, Breathe & Think curriculum fosters better cognitive control (the ability to focus on the task at hand) and emotion regulation (being able to handle difficult feelings) which is relevant for many areas of students’ lives, like relationships with friends and family members, and doing well in school.
     

    “After just a week of practicing mindfulness and meditation at the Summer Teen Camp, campers’ anxiety decreased, and emotional awareness, self-kindness, self-efficacy, and compassion for themselves and others all increased, indicating the many promising benefits of even a short period of mindfulness and compassion practice. Together, these findings show that Tools for Peace programs can promote healthy and adaptive social, emotional, and academic functioning in teens.”

    —Angela Silars, Researcher
     

    But don't take it from us; take it from our participants:
     

    “In my everyday life, those little tools that I’ve learned here—the meditation, the mindfulness exercises—have helped me so much to get through stressful situations and to calm myself down.”

    —James, 10th Grade
     

    “I learned how to be happy with myself and how to see the good in people. This has been the best experience I could have because I know more about myself. The personal mandala helped me figure out stuff in my own view, and showed me that it wasn’t just [about] myself and my own needs. It opened up my emotions.”

    —Jose, 8th Grade


    “Tools for Peace was life changing and allowed me to reflect back on my own self. The meditations allowed me to reflect and forgive. I think the earlier you can learn this stuff, the better. I learned how to control myself, and in the real world, I can now trust people.”

    —Kiana, 7th Grade
     


     

    Tools for Peace inspires people of all ages to develop kindness and compassion in everyday life.

    Founded in 2000, Tools for Peace is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to strengthening and supporting emotional and social intelligence as well as academic and professional success. We envision a world where everyone is connected by kindness and compassion, and have created our programs to help make that vision a reality.
     


     

    WE BELIEVE

    • Solutions to problems begin from within ourselves.
    • In the inherent ability of all people to develop positive connection to one another.
    • Our shared capacity for kindness and compassion connects us more deeply than appearance, status, geography, or circumstances.
    • The ability to thrive is attainable by anyone, regardless of social or economic background.

    WE VALUE

    • Compassionate and responsive engagement that meets people where they are.
    • Safe and open forums where people can speak with courage, honesty, and confidence.
    • The unique contribution of every individual.
    • Authenticity and respect in all our relationships.
       




     

    #InspireKindness by sharing this campaign with family and friends on your social media accounts, through email, or (our favorite) during a conversation!
