story:
Hello and welcome, 

Our story begins with you. Do you remember what it was like being a kid? Do you remember feeling confused 'why' you had to learn certain things in school? Do you remember feeling perplexed at how to express your thoughts and ideas?

Well, we know YOU learned to read and that YOU are here tells us that you care about a child's experience of school. We do too. And we are really excited to make our program available for more children/youth every where.

We all know school can be a magical place for some and a quietly miserable place for others. Have you ever stopped to consider what causes kids to tune in or tune out? We've spent a lot of time reflecting on all these questions and more. 

Navigating the invisible paths toward powerful learning, communication and effective problem solving is why we exist!

We are introducing a new model for learning that elevates understanding, creativity and maximizes learning potential. 

Our product is available online and makes it much easier for educators to engage in new ways with their students while putting the students in the driver's seat of learning and discovery. 

What’s been missing in the education system?

Answer: calmversation™ a whole new model for learning that sets the foundation for how children learn to relate to themselves, each other and the world around them. It’s a bridge that leverages technology to facilitate compassion, creativity and a celebrates our collective humanity.

We have designed this program to help each student connect to the power of their own imagination, learning potential and capacity to solve problems. We are making the 'invisible' visible!

Our program develops the social-emotional and intellectual development of students while giving them the tools to express how they think, learn and create.

A note from our founder: 

I have a lot of empathy for both students and educators. I have been both. After 14 years as an educator and avid observer of student learning within the Vancouver school district, I had a strong desire to do something about the gaps I saw. I was determined to make a dynamic difference in education and it started with the questions that never left my heart...

  • How can we maximize the learning opportunities and minimize the stress, worries and self-doubts?
  • How can we empower children to step into their greatness sooner in life?
  • How can we work with educators to provide a framework in which students can learn how to effectively solve problems, be more creative and with compassion?
  • How can we build a stronger bridge for humanity in the rise of technology?

Taking these questions in mind, I reverse engineered a whole new model for learning.

Three years ago, I left the public education system to create calmversation™ -  I designed an interactive online curriculum that could attend to the gaps in a child's experience of school. The goal was to champion each child through an inspiring and creative lens of compassion while providing educators with the tools and resources to make their profession even more rewarding. 

 

How does calmversation™ work? 

Our school program is available online, facilitated by the classroom teacher and takes a "humans helping humans" learn, lead and inspire. This is accomplished through five key themes which are the building blocks of calmversation™. Within each theme, we offer a related concept video, discussion starters, a range of fun activities, project ideas and "Space for Thought" lounges. The program serves to help students deepen their understanding of self, others and the world around them.

Each theme builds upon the other to help students and educators unlock new possibilities.

1) Ideas and Inspiration - understanding the nature of ideas and inspiration while developing a positive relationship with their cognitive abilities. In this theme, students and educators learn the important sequence that creates calmversation™.  

2) Communication - the key to understanding others

In this theme, we create a deeper understanding about how communication occurs verbally and non-verbally through creative expressions and in the digital sphere of technology, such as social media and the Internet.

3) Emotions - the driving force behind our actions

We provide fun opportunities for students to discover the interesting world of emotions and mixed emotions so they can better navigate social situations and interactions.

4) Learning - a lifelong process

Students will be able to see learning as a transparent process from different sources. This has a positive impact on their ability to process new information. They will also be able to communicate how they learn.

5) Problem Solving - an essential life skill

Whether the problem is personal, community-based or global, calmversation™ teaches peaceful problem-solving methods that lead to win-wins. 

 

Our curriculum is designed to break through the barriers to learning while meeting the students wherever there are at. The program is meant to be delivered with the whole class and sometimes the students work in groups or pairs based on the specific activity. 

We make it easier for students to understand the point, purpose, and goals for learning while building on their natural capacity to be creative and compassionate human beings.

Through calmversation™ students become a part of the dialogue that shapes their experience of school and learning in a positive way.

 

What leaders, innovators, and educators have to say about our program:

Here's where you 'calm' in...

As a non-profit run by volunteers, we request your support to make the calmversation™ curriculum available to more students, educators and schools across the nations. This chart shows how the funds will be used. 

If you feel inspired or compelled to contribute to this campaign, you will be helping us cause more calmversation™ in schools and communities. Imagine the impact of 'mutually respectful dialogues' with students who are equipped with the tools and resources to solve problems peacefully and creatively...

Your contribution will impact the experience of hundreds, if not thousands, of students. With your support we will be able to expand our team of facilitators and trainers. Our goal is to raise 50k and these funds will be allocated to expedite our efforts locally, nationally and globally. We are here to create a stunning difference in education. You can count on us to provide updates as we reach each new milestone in this journey. We invite you to cause and create with us! 

If you are interested in joining our team or sponsoring our learning foundation please contact us directly team@calmversation.org. 


Behind the scenes

With a small team of dedicated volunteers and community supporters, we have been able to achieve the following:

 

  • Beta testing completed with 10 teachers and 450 students which means we are now ready to start implementing the program
  • Our Wishes and Wisdoms Curriculum has been launched with fantastic results.
  • A Board of Advisors has been created and our team has been working around the clock to bring in the funding needed to keep our not-for-profit alive.

We are so close to reaching our full potential and with your help, we can get across the finish line!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially we still want you to be a part of our community.

You can help by:

  • Sharing our campaign with everyone you know!
  • Talking to your local schools, parents & educators    
  • Joining us on Facebook and Instagram

In the coming days we’ll share more about our stretch goals and you’ll get to meet the team!

 

Let’s cause a calmversation together, You Sparkling Human Beings!

With love and thanks from all of us at calmversation™ learning foundation. 

 

The Team Behind the Mission

We are driven by a team of thoughtful, creative and dedicated professionals. Our team consists of dynamic advisors, interns and volunteers.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

(From Left to Right - top row)

  • Jena - Founding Director & Chief Inspiration Officer  
  • Roger - Internal Logistics, Communication & Budget Planning
  • Gary - Social Justice Program Intern + Creative Collaborations Ninja  
  • Vanessa - Accountability Officer, Project Management and Organizational Development
  • Anita - Social Media Manager

(From  Left to Right - bottom row)

  • Mirey - Marketing Advisor & Crowdfunding Coordinator
  • Jessica - Community Outreach & Academic Coordinator
  • Erika - Press, Media, Copywriting and Promotions Coordinator
  • Chanelle - Social Justice Program Intern + Research and Planning Ninja
  • Laura - Educator & Student Advocate + Lead Educator during calmversation prototype launch Spring 2016.
story_txt:
Hello and welcome, Our story begins with you. Do you remember what it was like being a kid? Do you remember feeling confused 'why' you had to learn certain things in school? Do you remember feeling perplexed at how to express your thoughts and ideas?Well, we know YOU learned to read and that YOU are here tells us that you care about a child's experience of school. We do too. And we are really excited to make our program available for more children/youth every where.We all know school can be a magical place for some and a quietly miserable place for others. Have you ever stopped to consider what causes kids to tune in or tune out? We've spent a lot of time reflecting on all these questions and more. Navigating the invisible paths toward powerful learning, communication and effective problem solving is why we exist!We are introducing a new model for learning that elevates understanding, creativity and maximizes learning potential. Our product is available online and makes it much easier for educators to engage in new ways with their students while putting the students in the driver's seat of learning and discovery. What’s been missing in the education system?Answer: calmversation™ a whole new model for learning that sets the foundation for how children learn to relate to themselves, each other and the world around them. It’s a bridge that leverages technology to facilitate compassion, creativity and a celebrates our collective humanity.We have designed this program to help each student connect to the power of their own imagination, learning potential and capacity to solve problems. We are making the 'invisible' visible!Our program develops the social-emotional and intellectual development of students while giving them the tools to express how they think, learn and create.A note from our founder: I have a lot of empathy for both students and educators. I have been both. After 14 years as an educator and avid observer of student learning within the Vancouver school district, I had a strong desire to do something about the gaps I saw. I was determined to make a dynamic difference in education and it started with the questions that never left my heart...
How can we maximize the learning opportunities and minimize the stress, worries and self-doubts?
How can we empower children to step into their greatness sooner in life?
How can we work with educators to provide a framework in which students can learn how to effectively solve problems, be more creative and with compassion?
How can we build a stronger bridge for humanity in the rise of technology?
Taking these questions in mind, I reverse engineered a whole new model for learning.Three years ago, I left the public education system to create calmversation™ -  I designed an interactive online curriculum that could attend to the gaps in a child's experience of school. The goal was to champion each child through an inspiring and creative lens of compassion while providing educators with the tools and resources to make their profession even more rewarding.  How does calmversation™ work? Our school program is available online, facilitated by the classroom teacher and takes a "humans helping humans" learn, lead and inspire. This is accomplished through five key themes which are the building blocks of calmversation™. Within each theme, we offer a related concept video, discussion starters, a range of fun activities, project ideas and "Space for Thought" lounges. The program serves to help students deepen their understanding of self, others and the world around them.Each theme builds upon the other to help students and educators unlock new possibilities.1) Ideas and Inspiration - understanding the nature of ideas and inspiration while developing a positive relationship with their cognitive abilities. In this theme, students and educators learn the important sequence that creates calmversation™.  2) Communication - the key to understanding othersIn this theme, we create a deeper understanding about how communication occurs verbally and non-verbally through creative expressions and in the digital sphere of technology, such as social media and the Internet.3) Emotions - the driving force behind our actionsWe provide fun opportunities for students to discover the interesting world of emotions and mixed emotions so they can better navigate social situations and interactions.4) Learning - a lifelong processStudents will be able to see learning as a transparent process from different sources. This has a positive impact on their ability to process new information. They will also be able to communicate how they learn.5) Problem Solving - an essential life skillWhether the problem is personal, community-based or global, calmversation™ teaches peaceful problem-solving methods that lead to win-wins.  Our curriculum is designed to break through the barriers to learning while meeting the students wherever there are at. The program is meant to be delivered with the whole class and sometimes the students work in groups or pairs based on the specific activity. We make it easier for students to understand the point, purpose, and goals for learning while building on their natural capacity to be creative and compassionate human beings.Through calmversation™ students become a part of the dialogue that shapes their experience of school and learning in a positive way. What leaders, innovators, and educators have to say about our program:Here's where you 'calm' in...As a non-profit run by volunteers, we request your support to make the calmversation™ curriculum available to more students, educators and schools across the nations. This chart shows how the funds will be used. If you feel inspired or compelled to contribute to this campaign, you will be helping us cause more calmversation™ in schools and communities. Imagine the impact of 'mutually respectful dialogues' with students who are equipped with the tools and resources to solve problems peacefully and creatively...Your contribution will impact the experience of hundreds, if not thousands, of students. With your support we will be able to expand our team of facilitators and trainers. Our goal is to raise 50k and these funds will be allocated to expedite our efforts locally, nationally and globally. We are here to create a stunning difference in education. You can count on us to provide updates as we reach each new milestone in this journey. We invite you to cause and create with us! If you are interested in joining our team or sponsoring our learning foundation please contact us directly team@calmversation.org. Behind the scenesWith a small team of dedicated volunteers and community supporters, we have been able to achieve the following: 
Beta testing completed with 10 teachers and 450 students which means we are now ready to start implementing the program
Our Wishes and Wisdoms Curriculum has been launched with fantastic results.
A Board of Advisors has been created and our team has been working around the clock to bring in the funding needed to keep our not-for-profit alive.
We are so close to reaching our full potential and with your help, we can get across the finish line! Other Ways You Can HelpIf you aren't able to contribute financially we still want you to be a part of our community.You can help by:
Sharing our campaign with everyone you know!
Talking to your local schools, parents & educators    
Joining us on Facebook and Instagram
In the coming days we’ll share more about our stretch goals and you’ll get to meet the team! Let’s cause a calmversation together, You Sparkling Human Beings!With love and thanks from all of us at calmversation™ learning foundation.  The Team Behind the MissionWe are driven by a team of thoughtful, creative and dedicated professionals. Our team consists of dynamic advisors, interns and volunteers.           (From Left to Right - top row)
Jena - Founding Director & Chief Inspiration Officer  
Roger - Internal Logistics, Communication & Budget Planning
Gary - Social Justice Program Intern + Creative Collaborations Ninja  
Vanessa - Accountability Officer, Project Management and Organizational Development
Anita - Social Media Manager
(From  Left to Right - bottom row)
Mirey - Marketing Advisor & Crowdfunding Coordinator
Jessica - Community Outreach & Academic Coordinator
Erika - Press, Media, Copywriting and Promotions Coordinator
Chanelle - Social Justice Program Intern + Research and Planning Ninja
Laura - Educator & Student Advocate + Lead Educator during calmversation prototype launch Spring 2016.

story:
Short Summary

  • Having worked in alternative communities and schools for over 2 decades both in India (Auroville, South India) and the UK, I've had the privilege of meeting some incredible people, explored brilliant ideas and seen first-hand, practical strategies that both support, empower and awaken our children's creative potential in a balanced, age-appropriate way that takes care of their emotional wellbeing too. 
  • I wish this for all children, everywhere. 
  • I believe that until we can help every child thrive, no child can truly flourish. 
  • Festival of the Child will be shared by live broadcast over 7 days in November 2019 and will be completely free to watch live, for all registered participants. The replays will also be available for free for 48 hours following the original broadcast. 

 

 

Why Is This Important For You & Your Family?

  • As parents and educators and people who care about the future, I know that you want to contribute to a world in which your children feel happy, healthy and balanced and a world in which they can truly thrive.
  • Even if you don't have children yourselves, as stewards of life on this planet, I know that you care about the next generation's wellbeing.
  • Parents have told us that they want to balance their child's wellbeing alongside their love of learning so that they are better equipped to deal with this age of information overload that we find ourselves in.
  • Our children and teenagers face unprecedented scrutiny than when we were young, as every bit of their lives is documented and posted online.
  • Do you ever worry about whether your children are losing the ability to connect authentically to themselves and each other as more and more of their world is online?
  • Festival of the Child is about providing tools and inspiration for you as parents, educators, and guardians of the next generation's future. 
  • Just like me, I know you want to be a good ancestor to your children. 
  • Over the last 2 decades, I've met some incredible teachers, experts, authors, and storytellers and life-long learners and I strongly feel that what they have to share is for everybody, not just for those with access to alternative forms of education, often only available in private school settings.
  • Contributing to this project means that more families and children can benefit from access to these ideas and resources. 
  • Whether or not you are a parent or a teacher, or just somebody who cares about humanity, if you feel passionately that the next generation deserve a chance to truly thrive, your support will make that critical difference and enable us to reach more families and children. 
  • Every single contribution makes a TREMENDOUS difference!
  • Even just £10 means we can directly reach more families.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get:

This is a passion project and a complete labour of love. We've already spent 4.5 months sourcing speakers, creating and curating content, recording interviews, creating graphics for the website, working on a campaign for social media etc. and so much more!

It's been an amazing, enriching experience connecting with some truly wonderful and extraordinary human beings. Human beings just like you with their own personal wisdom and fresh perspectives to share.

The majority of funding required is required for direct advertising costs, video editing and some technical requirements that are outside the skills' capacity of the small team launching this project.  

What We Need:

  • Direct Advertising (Facebook, Google & Print Magazines) £2,000
  • Website, Development & Hosting £1,375
  • Event branding/Logo £500
  • Film & Video Editing £1,230
  • Tech Requirements (Webinar Platform, Email Provider etc.) £472

Total: £5,577

 

Unique Perks:

  • Awesome Angel - A £10 donation gets a name mention on the Wall of Gratitude, in our digital Festival Programme and on our website (unless you tell us that you want to remain anonymous when you contribute).
  • Amazing Angel - A £50 donation gets a name mention as above and LIFETIME ACCESS to the complete set of 21 video and audio files digital product (this will retail at £197 once the summit is finished).
  • Wonderful Angel - A £150 donation gets all of the above (name on Wall of Gratitude and digital product worth £197) AND a 60 minute 1-1 Coaching Call (worth £147) with your host Priya Mahtani, to be taken within 3 months of the summit's last broadcast.
  • Guardian Angel - A £500 donation gets all of the above plus an exclusive and super special post-summit dinner invite in London with at least 3 summit speakers and our fabulous team  (12 additional guests only).
  • Angel Guide - A £1,000 donation gets your logo on our website, and a whole-page advert in our digital Festival programme (emailed to all participants and available to download on our website). You'll also receive 10 x copies of Lifetime Access to Festival of the Child 2019. 

We are reimagining education and bringing a revolution to learning. With our children subject to increased and insane levels of testing in schools and our teenagers suffering from higher levels of mental anxiety, stress and depression than ever before, it's vital that we REIMAGINE EDUCATION now. 

Now is the time for each one of us to courageously come together and see what future we can co-create. 

Your contribution means you are creating a future that empowers all our children and teenagers to be the best possible versions of themselves and to live meaningful, happy lives, as they continue to blossom and grow in the world. 

 

 

Amazing Speakers:

We are simply thrilled to have a truly stellar cast of interviews lined up to share with you. Our speakers are doctors, storytellers, psychologists, historians, researchers, cosmologists, healers, wisdom-keepers and so much more! 

We are delighted to include:

  • Christopher Clouder
  • Dr Gretchen Schmelzer
  • Dr Jude Currivan
  • Dr Michaela Glöckler
  • Dr Pam Jarvis

  • Dr Sebastian Suggate

  • Dr Shantum Seth

  • Julian Paine
  • Kim Allsup

  • Kim McCabe

  • Laura Newman

  • Lisa Romero

  • Lou Harvey-Zahra
  • Michelle Mitchell
  • Mr Gee
  • Nancy Mellon
  • Oona Alexander
  • Priya Mahtani
  • Sally Jenkinson
  • Susan Perrow
  • Tamara Donn
  • Torin Finser
  • Vince Gowmon

 

 

The Impact:

  • I've spent the last 2 decades working alongside schools in both India & the UK and have spoken with literally hundreds of parents sharing their concerns about their children and their deepest wishes and dreams for them too.
  • We are building a community from the grassroots up - we've listened to your concerns and worries about what the future holds for your children and this is a direct response to that. 
  • Your contribution directly means we can reach even more parents. We'd love to reach 100k people. 
  • You will be supporting not just the project, but the wellbeing of children everywhere. Until we can support every child to thrive, no child can truly flourish.
  • I dream of a world where we think of each other's children as we think of our own. A world where taking collective responsibility for how we raise and educate the next generation is the best way to ensure we have a sustainable future on planet earth.
  • Over the last 2 decades, I've successfully supported schools and organisations to communicate their message more clearly and reach the people who are longing to hear from them!  I've been involved with community building through a wide variety of activities, including sharing in-house print and digital magazines, organising fundraising events and fairs and generally helping to spread the word about ideas that work through parent talks, informative articles in national publications and much much more. 
  • Since 2013, I've created and managed 2 Facebook pages with a shared fan base of 20k people (including Imagine A School Where) that are reaching audiences of 60-270k people each week).
  • It's clear from these pages that parents and educators just like you are hungry for ideas and strategies that work and can support your parenting journey.
  • Engagement is high and we are at a critical threshold to raise awareness about tools and practices that help children thrive. Too many children are suffering and it doesn't need to be that way. 
  • Your support allows us to reach a tremendous amount of parents and families just like you, all longing to create a future where their children are happy and can truly thrive.
  • When speaking to over 100 parents, they all have shared the same thing, "I just want my children to be happy." We're pretty confident that's you too!
  • Your contribution helps us empower more families and help ALL our children to thrive. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges:

  • We need your support to reach beyond our current audience and reach more parents and educators who could benefit from the content we have to share. 
  • Your support means that we get to produce the content to a higher standard (video editing for example) and can directly reach more families who could benefit from the tools, ideas, and strategies offered by our panel of amazing, incredible experts! 
  • With your support, we'll reach considerably more people. As our goal is to empower as many parents and educators as we can possibly reach, your support DIRECTLY impacts our intention to directly impact children's lives with ideas, resources and ways in which their lives can be improved.  
  • I know that more families (including yours) can benefit practically and tangibly from each and every conversation that's happening here. I know that these are important conversations to be had.
  • We are reimagining education. That's a whole big movement right there. 
  • We're starting at the grassroots - which means we need your support.
  • It is our intention to not just talk about education but to build community so that these conversations continue after the summit has ended. 

Your angel support makes all this possible and helps us fulfill our objective to reach as many families as we possibly can, to help children thrive.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

There are so many ways that you can help. Even if you're not able to offer us financial support, please consider sharing our campaign on your social media platforms, by posting on your timelines, pages and sharing in groups that you are involved with. That way you are directly helping us to reach more people.  Help us to make some noise about our campaign. Ways you can help:

  • Invite your friends!
  • Follow us on social media and share our posts.
  • Use the hashtag #festivalofthechild on your posts and shares.
  • Share on social media, by posting on your timelines, news feed or in your groups. 
  • Share our campaign with your friends by email. 
  • Share our campaign with parents in your child's class.

Thank you so much for using Indiegogo's share buttons and posting EVERYWHERE online!

We are deeply grateful for your support, sharing, goodwill and positive vibes to help us reach more families and children so that we can help children EVERYWHERE thrive.

 

Video Link:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbPLA3VJCVs

story:
About Real Spanish

  • My name is Elizabeth and I’ve been involved in language education for many years. You can see some details about my professional career here. 
  • I've also been studying Spanish for some years now, and through my own experience as a language teacher and learner, I developed the idea for Real Spanish: virtual lessons based on TV and movie clips. Watch this video to see how I got the idea. 

VIDEO: How I improved my Spanish

  • For the past two years, I’ve been working with a great team of Spanish-speaking teachers, video editors, voiceover artists, and illustrators to create engaging lessons with a focus on colloquial Spanish spoken at real native-speaker speed. 
  • Our target students are people who have studied Spanish for a while, recently or in the past, but need to improve their listening comprehension and fluency in authentic conversations with native speakers.
  • We have developed lessons that consist of animated video, clips from TV and movies, PDFs and interactive online activities. We also have interactive lessons where you can improve your pronunciation. Watch this video to meet our virtual teachers and learn more about the Real Spanish approach. 

VIDEO: Meet Carmen and Juan, your virtual Spanish teachers

 

What We Need

  • We've reached the stage where we need additional financing in order to be able to continue the development of Real Spanish. 
  • We'd love to be able to produce a full year's worth of material (studying at a rate of around two hours a week). However, producing these lessons is expensive: to give you an idea, licences to use the original clips from TV and movies can cost 500-600 Euros per minute of video. 
  • We need 50,000 Euros to invest in the purchase of licences for additional TV and movie clips, and to pay for the creation of animated video lessons and other learning materials.

 

What You Get

As a backer, for a contribution of 50 Euros or more you will receive a one-year Early Bird subscription... which you can give another person if you wish. This subscription includes:

  • Immediate access to all the material now available on Real Spanish: sufficient for 12-15 weeks of study at a rate of one lesson per week.
  • Ongoing access to new lessons as they are produced. For example, right now we are now working on these projects for release this autumn:

A set of 4 video-lessons based on the highly successful and very funny movie «Ocho apellidos vascos»

A set of 4 video-lessons based on the popular TV series «Cuéntame cómo pasó»

5 more lessons of «Mejora tu pronunciación»

We will keep subscribers informed by email each time we upload new material. 

Alternatively, you can  choose to make a one-time donation of 10 Euros to support language learning and help us to keep going. 

 

Why Spanish?

Spanish is the third most-studied language in the world. Many people have studied Spanish but lack confidence using the language in real-life contexts. Does this sound like you (or someone you know)?

Real Spanish can help you to: 

  • improve your comprehension of colloquial Spanish spoken at normal native-speaker speed;
  • learn loads of new vocabulary as well as useful expressions that native speakers use a lot;
  • become familiar with various accents in Spanish; 
  • improve your command of some of the trickier points of Spanish grammar;
  • expand your historical and cultural understanding of Spain and the Spanish-speaking world.

A good command of Spanish can you  to:

  • increase your employment or business opportunities;
  • work effectively with Spanish-speaking colleagues and clients;
  • improve your cognitive skills (yes! it’s true! bilingual people have many advantages  in terms of mental agility, memory, and more!);
  • enjoy movies without subtitles;
  • follow news programs and documentaries in Spanish;
  • become more independent in Spanish-speaking contexts;
  • make new friends.

 

Why Real Spanish?

We’ve tested some prototype materials  with a focus group. The results of the survey were extremely encouraging. For example:

“High quality of all aspects of layout and presentation.”

“Very good pedagogical approach. Real movies, news, speech. Full transcripts and translation. Tests are thorough.”

“The introductory explanation was comprehensive and the main video and ancillary learning materials provided interest, both from cultural and linguistic aspect. The material encourages further learning.”

“I was impressed overall, with how engaging and well presented the learning materials are.”

“The PDFs are very helpful, it is good to have the transcript and the grammar for reference. The cultural and social content is interesting. The exercises work well.”

“Great concept, picked up a lot of expressions just in the introduction!”

“I like the concept of using real-life Spanish video material in the teaching of Spanish to foreigners very much indeed! And I liked the introductions and the whole set up of the lecciones. I found the grammar and the transcriptions very useful too, and the self-test apparatus as well. I like the accent on colloquial (as opposed to literary or formal) language - that strikes me as very useful indeed."

You can see more testimonials on our site: https://www.realspanish.eu/en/testimonials/

What are you waiting for? You can try two free preview lessons right now! Please visit us at  https://www.realspanish.eu/en

You can also keep on touch here:

https://www.facebook.com/thisisrealspanish/ 

https://www.linkedin.com/company/real-spanish/?...

https://twitter.com/RealSpanish2

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCb0Emaf96o9DgP...

https://www.instagram.com/thisisrealspanish/

 

Great for Teachers Too!

We have a group subscription for teachers to share with their students. Fantastic for one-to-one lessons, face to face or online, as well as group classes. Check out the preview lessons and our lesson plan outlines: https://www.realspanish.eu/en

We Need Your Help!

From our field test results we know we have a great product. However, we face two challenges:

  • Financing the development of additional lessons. 
  • Getting the word out: it doesn't matter how great Real Spanish is, if nobody knows about it!

We believe that with your support on Indiegogo we can overcome these challenges and continue to provide fantastic learning experiences for anyone who wants to improve their Spanish!

Even if you can't help financially, please try the free preview lessons and get the word out to other people. Please share with everyone you know who may be interested, and on all  your social networks! Help us to build an audience and get some excitement growing.  Thank you!
story_txt:
About Real Spanish

My name is Elizabeth and I’ve been involved in language education for many years. You can see some details about my professional career here. 
I've also been studying Spanish for some years now, and through my own experience as a language teacher and learner, I developed the idea for Real Spanish: virtual lessons based on TV and movie clips. Watch this video to see how I got the idea. 

VIDEO: How I improved my Spanish


For the past two years, I’ve been working with a great team of Spanish-speaking teachers, video editors, voiceover artists, and illustrators to create engaging lessons with a focus on colloquial Spanish spoken at real native-speaker speed. 
Our target students are people who have studied Spanish for a while, recently or in the past, but need to improve their listening comprehension and fluency in authentic conversations with native speakers.
We have developed lessons that consist of animated video, clips from TV and movies, PDFs and interactive online activities. We also have interactive lessons where you can improve your pronunciation. Watch this video to meet our virtual teachers and learn more about the Real Spanish approach. 

VIDEO: Meet Carmen and Juan, your virtual Spanish teachers

 

What We Need

We've reached the stage where we need additional financing in order to be able to continue the development of Real Spanish. 
We'd love to be able to produce a full year's worth of material (studying at a rate of around two hours a week). However, producing these lessons is expensive: to give you an idea, licences to use the original clips from TV and movies can cost 500-600 Euros per minute of video. 
We need 50,000 Euros to invest in the purchase of licences for additional TV and movie clips, and to pay for the creation of animated video lessons and other learning materials.

 
What You Get
As a backer, for a contribution of 50 Euros or more you will receive a one-year Early Bird subscription... which you can give another person if you wish. This subscription includes:


Immediate access to all the material now available on Real Spanish: sufficient for 12-15 weeks of study at a rate of one lesson per week.

Ongoing access to new lessons as they are produced. For example, right now we are now working on these projects for release this autumn:

A set of 4 video-lessons based on the highly successful and very funny movie «Ocho apellidos vascos»
A set of 4 video-lessons based on the popular TV series «Cuéntame cómo pasó»
5 more lessons of «Mejora tu pronunciación»
We will keep subscribers informed by email each time we upload new material. 

Alternatively, you can  choose to make a one-time donation of 10 Euros to support language learning and help us to keep going. 
 
Why Spanish?
Spanish is the third most-studied language in the world. Many people have studied Spanish but lack confidence using the language in real-life contexts. Does this sound like you (or someone you know)?
Real Spanish can help you to: 

improve your comprehension of colloquial Spanish spoken at normal native-speaker speed;
learn loads of new vocabulary as well as useful expressions that native speakers use a lot;
become familiar with various accents in Spanish; 
improve your command of some of the trickier points of Spanish grammar;
expand your historical and cultural understanding of Spain and the Spanish-speaking world.

A good command of Spanish can you  to:

increase your employment or business opportunities;
work effectively with Spanish-speaking colleagues and clients;
improve your cognitive skills (yes! it’s true! bilingual people have many advantages  in terms of mental agility, memory, and more!);
enjoy movies without subtitles;
follow news programs and documentaries in Spanish;
become more independent in Spanish-speaking contexts;
make new friends.

 
Why Real Spanish?
We’ve tested some prototype materials  with a focus group. The results of the survey were extremely encouraging. For example:
“High quality of all aspects of layout and presentation.”
“Very good pedagogical approach. Real movies, news, speech. Full transcripts and translation. Tests are thorough.”
“The introductory explanation was comprehensive and the main video and ancillary learning materials provided interest, both from cultural and linguistic aspect. The material encourages further learning.”
“I was impressed overall, with how engaging and well presented the learning materials are.”
“The PDFs are very helpful, it is good to have the transcript and the grammar for reference. The cultural and social content is interesting. The exercises work well.”
“Great concept, picked up a lot of expressions just in the introduction!”
“I like the concept of using real-life Spanish video material in the teaching of Spanish to foreigners very much indeed! And I liked the introductions and the whole set up of the lecciones. I found the grammar and the transcriptions very useful too, and the self-test apparatus as well. I like the accent on colloquial (as opposed to literary or formal) language - that strikes me as very useful indeed."
You can see more testimonials on our site: https://www.realspanish.eu/en/testimonials/
What are you waiting for? You can try two free preview lessons right now! Please visit us at  https://www.realspanish.eu/en
You can also keep on touch here:
https://www.facebook.com/thisisrealspanish/ 
https://www.linkedin.com/company/real-spanish/?...
https://twitter.com/RealSpanish2
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCb0Emaf96o9DgP...
https://www.instagram.com/thisisrealspanish/

 
Great for Teachers Too!
We have a group subscription for teachers to share with their students. Fantastic for one-to-one lessons, face to face or online, as well as group classes. Check out the preview lessons and our lesson plan outlines: https://www.realspanish.eu/en
We Need Your Help!
From our field test results we know we have a great product. However, we face two challenges:

Financing the development of additional lessons. 
Getting the word out: it doesn't matter how great Real Spanish is, if nobody knows about it!

We believe that with your support on Indiegogo we can overcome these challenges and continue to provide fantastic learning experiences for anyone who wants to improve their Spanish!
Even if you can't help financially, please try the free preview lessons and get the word out to other people. Please share with everyone you know who may be interested, and on all  your social networks! Help us to build an audience and get some excitement growing.  Thank you!

story:
UPDATE: We are thrilled to have met our funding goal already! For every additional 100 E we will give the book and workshop to another 10 schools.

AGGIORNAMENTO: Siamo felicissimi di aver già superato il nostro obiettivo! Da adesso per ogni 100 Euro in più doneremo un libro e un workshop a 10 scuole in più. 

She Did It Anyway is a compilation of stories, illustrated with comics, about 17 Italian women who were told their dreams were ‘impossible’ or ‘absurd’ and did the unimaginable anyway.

She Did It Anyway è una raccolta di storie, illustrate con fumetti, su 17 donne italiane i cui sogni erano stati definiti "impossibili" o "assurdi" e che, nonostante questo, sono riuscite comunque a farcela.

Women shape the course of history but are often omitted from the history books, leaving students to come to their own conclusions about their absence. She Did It Anyway contributes to the growing canon of books intent on righting this wrong.

Le donne hanno un impatto sulla storia ma troppo sono state lasciate fuori dai libri di storia, portando gli studenti  a conclusioni sbagliati circa la lora assenza. She Did It Anyway contribuisce al crescente canone di libri che vuole porre rimedio a questo ingiustizia. 

The idea for this book came from the many discussions we had at CLF with middle school kids who attended CLF's leadership development program: Let's Make a Difference. During the program participants are asked to name, outside of sports or entertainment, 10 famous Italian women. 95% of participants couldn't name more than one or two Italian women. When asked why it was hard to name women, some common answers included: 'women wanted to stay home', 'women weren't allowed to do a lot of things' or 'women weren't interested in achievement'.

L'idea di questo libro è nata dai numerosi incontri fatti con i ragazzi delle scuole medie che hanno partecipato al programma di sviluppo della leadership della CLF: 'Facciamo la differenza'. Durante il programma ai partecipanti veniva chiesto di nominare 10 donne italiane famose, escludendo i settori dello sport o dello spettacolo.  Il 95% dei partecipanti non poteva nominarne più di una o due. Alla domanda sul perché fosse difficile nominare donne italiane capaci di distinguersi, alcune risposte piú comuni erano: "le donne volevano restare a casa", "alle donne non era permesso fare molte cose" o "le donne non erano interessate ai risultati".

The School Initiative: Shifting Mindsets & Inspiring Action

This crowdfunding campaign supports CLF's work of encouraging students to look beyond stereotyped concepts of leadership and inspiring them to find ways to create leadership experiences for themselves.

Questa campagna di crowdfunding sostiene il lavoro di CLF per incoraggiare gli studenti a guardare oltre i concetti stereotipati di leadership e ispirarli a trovare modi per creare esperienze di leadership per se stessi.

We are shifting mindsets on three fronts. We know the workshop gets students to think differently, about leadership, cultural stereotypes and taking action as a young person. Here are what some students told us they learned after the online workshop:

Stiamo cambiando mentalità su tre fronti. Sappiamo che il seminario porta gli studenti a pensare in modo diverso, sulla leadership, sugli stereotipi culturali e sull'agire da giovani. Ecco cosa ci hanno detto di aver imparato alcuni studenti dopo il workshop online:

 

How We Can Use Your Support /Come Possiamo Utilizzare il vostro supporto

In order to bring the books and workshops for free to schools, we are asking for your support in raising 500 Euros which will be used to:

  • Print books for schools
  • Ship books to schools
  • Design supporting promotional and educational materials

Per portare gratuitamente i libri e i laboratori nelle scuole, chiediamo il vostro sostegno nella raccolta di 500 euro che verranno utilizzati per:

  • Stampare libri per le scuole
  • Spedire libri alle scuole
  • Progettazione di materiali promozionali ed educativi

 

Risks & Challenges

We believe CLF is well positioned to complete this campaign.  However, two challenges we might face include:

  • Those related to technical issues around delivering the workshop virtually. Given that we have already delivered the virtual workshop successfully using a simple laptop, we feel that technical challenges will not be a problem.
  • Schools might not be interested in offering this material to their students. While there may be some schools for which this is true, we are confident that we will be able to identify 50 schools which would welcome this material.

Riteniamo che CLF sia ben posizionata per completare questa campagna. Tuttavia, due sfide che potremmo affrontare includono:

  • Quelle relative a questioni tecniche relative alla consegna virtuale del workshop. Dato che abbiamo già consegnato con successo l'officina virtuale utilizzando un semplice laptop, riteniamo che le sfide tecniche non saranno un problema.
  • Le scuole potrebbero non essere interessate a offrire questo materiale ai propri studenti. Sebbene ci possano essere alcune scuole per le quali questo è vero, siamo fiduciosi che saremo in grado di identificare 50 scuole che accolgono questo materiale.

Spedire libri alle scuole
Progettazione di materiali promozionali ed educativi

Those related to technical issues around delivering the workshop virtually. Given that we have already delivered the virtual workshop successfully using a simple laptop, we feel that technical challenges will not be a problem.
Schools might not be interested in offering this material to their students. While there may be some schools for which this is true, we are confident that we will be able to identify 50 schools which would welcome this material.

Riteniamo che CLF sia ben posizionata per completare questa campagna. Tuttavia, due sfide che potremmo affrontare includono:

Quelle relative a questioni tecniche relative alla consegna virtuale del workshop. Dato che abbiamo già consegnato con successo l'officina virtuale utilizzando un semplice laptop, riteniamo che le sfide tecniche non saranno un problema.
Le scuole potrebbero non essere interessate a offrire questo materiale ai propri studenti. Sebbene ci possano essere alcune scuole per le quali questo è vero, siamo fiduciosi che saremo in grado di identificare 50 scuole che accolgono questo materiale.

story:
Most people don't realize it, but over 10% of adults in the US alone have some form of physical functioning difficulty. In the case of Cerebral Palsy, in the U.S. alone, 764,000 people have at least 1 symptom of Cerebral Palsy, and around 10,000 babies are born each year with Cerebral palsy.

When it comes to motor, physical and intellectual disabilities in general, the percentage of people with disabilities in the US population rose from 11.9% in 2010 to 12.6% in 2013, and it kept rising ever since. Globally, according to the WHO, about 15% of the world's population lives with some form of disability. However, despite the fact that there are literally hundreds of millions of people with physical, motor and intellectual disabilities all over the world, the truth is that, up until now, these people didn't have any specialized tool that allowed them to autonomously and efficiently use a computer or even a smartphone.

That's why we're so happy to introduce you to the Key-X Multifunctional Keyboard, a special keypad with just eleven touch-sensitive keys, which can be even activated by the blink of an eye, in case its user has a severe physical disability.

The Key-X was designed by Key2Enable to be the perfect special education resource for students with Cerebral Palsy and many other disabilities and the perfect keypad for adults with Cerebral Palsy or any motor impairment. With the Key-X, a person with any disability can efficiently and autonomously write, work, study and play with a computer, tablet or smartphone without any barriers.

Can you imagine how many thoughts become unexpressed, experiences unenjoyed, and talents unexplored just due to the fact that millions of people with Cerebral Palsy can't make a free and autonomous use of essential devices such as computers? Well, we can, which is why Key2Enable decided to develop a keyboard that is literally a key to open the doors of digital inclusion to people with Cerebral Palsy while also designing it to be just as useful to people with Down Syndrome, Autism, Tremors, Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, and many other physical, motor and intellectual disabilities.

Developed in Brazil, Key-X has been already tested by over 2,000 people with different disabilities who have enjoyed the easy typing experience that the keyboard offers with its iconographic keys that are activated in double sequences.

They have found that, with Key-X, they can even type any alphanumeric or accentuation character, along with punctuation, symbols, and any other command that is available in a conventional keyboard. This multifunctional keyboard also allows users to have precise control of the cursor on the screen, working like any common mouse, allowing people with Cerebral Palsy and other motor disabilities to work, write, study, research and even play.

Also, keeping in mind the special needs of Key-X’s users, the keypad for people with Cerebral Palsy and other motor impairments is built with large, well-spaced and touch-sensitive keys that allow the use of the panel without needing much force. However, the keyboard is robust enough to resist rough touches, and it can even be used with the feet, to further open more possibilities of usage to everyone who needs such a keyboard.

The Key-X does not require any specific software in order to be used for internet browsing, social networks, text editors and even games, and its plug-and-play USB interface requires no configuration. Indeed, this device has been developed to offer unparalleled autonomy and control over computers, smartphones, and tablets to disabled people who have thus far struggled to make an autonomous and functional use of these devices.

The Key-X also comes with accessories and aid applications that make it even more versatile and efficient as a tool for the digital inclusion of people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabled people:

In the present campaign, we are offering the X-Trig as a complimentary extra reward for the backers who buy the Key-X or donate it to one of the pre-selected organizations that this campaign wants to support through the donation of Key-X Keyboards.

The X-Trig, a robust external click switch, that allows full control of the Key-X for the users whose disabilities keep them from directly using the keyboard, is an accessory that comes with the Key-X as a reward of this campaign

Earlier in 2018, the Key-X earned the inestimable support of the Singularity University, who has taken Key2Enable into its portfolio of companies that are leveraging exponential technologies to address the world’s most intractable problems, and our experience in Brazil has been nothing but encouraging. To say that this fills our hearts with pride and motivation is an understatement.

Gleisson Fernandes, a computer scientist with Cerebral Palsy, was the original developer of a special 9-key keyboard that allowed him to easily use a computer instead of the helmet pointer that he used before. When Key2Enable founders met Gleisson, an immediate friendship and collaboration began. Key2Enable took it from there, eventually developing the Key-X, an improved 11-key version keyboard that has all the functions of a normal keyboard and mouse.

Daniel is learning how to code Java while using the Key-X just by blinking his eyes, using Key-X’s accessory a-Blin-X, which allows people to use the keyboard even if they are severely disabled.

Julia, on the other hand, was isolated due to her struggle with the limitations that Cerebral Palsy previously imposed on her, but she now goes to a regular classroom, in which the Key-X has allowed her to be considered the best mathematics student in her class.

These are just two examples of success stories but, in Brazil, there are literally hundreds of similar stories of children and adults who overcame the typical barriers to communicate, work, study and play by using the Key-X.

By being simply activated through a combination of two keys to delivering one command, and by having only 11 keys that control all the more than 200 functions that a regular keyboard has, Key-X is the perfect tool for the digital inclusion of people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabilities.

Through our Indiegogo campaign, we want to:

  • Allow people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabled people, as well as those who care for them, to know about our assistive technology and how it can improve their quality of life

  • Promote the use of Key-X in the USA and around the world, creating an empowering culture for its use

  • Pilot our Assistive Technologies in selected markets and channels across the United States in the next 6 months

  • Work on our channels with partners with contracts at schools and reaching organizations for people with motor disabilities

  • Reach a significant part of the 10 million people with motor disabilities in the United States over the course of the next 3 years

You can support the Key-X Multifunctional Keyboard by purchasing one for yourself or for a loved one, or you can purchase one of these very special multifunctional keyboards and donate it to any hospital or organization in the world that you choose — and we will make sure that a Key-X will get there.

Alternatively, since every dollar counts, you can make a contribution of any amount and we will pool all these smaller contributions together to purchase Key-X Keyboards and send them to the pre-selected and vetted organizations in our list above. So, when you make a contribution between $1 and $750, please make sure that you let us know to which one of these organizations above you want the Key-X Keyboard that you help to purchase and donate to go.

We're in the early stage of an ambitious worldwide mission to offer autonomous and efficient digital inclusion and empowerment to people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabilities all over the globe to develop their skills, unleash their talents, and explore their individualities. With your help, we can make it happen, and one of the simplest but very effective ways of supporting our campaign is to like, comment and share our project on social media.

 

For now, we already have some Key-X Multifunctional Keyboard units that are ready to be shipped. However, your contributions will allow us to fund the large-scale production and distribution of the keyboard that is going to make the lives of people with disabilities all over the world so much better.

When Key2Enable founders met Gleisson, an immediate friendship and collaboration began. Key2Enable took it from there, eventually developing the Key-X, an improved 11-key version keyboard that has all the functions of a normal keyboard and mouse.Daniel is learning how to code Java while using the Key-X just by blinking his eyes, using Key-X’s accessory a-Blin-X, which allows people to use the keyboard even if they are severely disabled.Julia, on the other hand, was isolated due to her struggle with the limitations that Cerebral Palsy previously imposed on her, but she now goes to a regular classroom, in which the Key-X has allowed her to be considered the best mathematics student in her class.These are just two examples of success stories but, in Brazil, there are literally hundreds of similar stories of children and adults who overcame the typical barriers to communicate, work, study and play by using the Key-X.By being simply activated through a combination of two keys to delivering one command, and by having only 11 keys that control all the more than 200 functions that a regular keyboard has, Key-X is the perfect tool for the digital inclusion of people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabilities.Through our Indiegogo campaign, we want to:
Allow people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabled people, as well as those who care for them, to know about our assistive technology and how it can improve their quality of life
Promote the use of Key-X in the USA and around the world, creating an empowering culture for its use
Pilot our Assistive Technologies in selected markets and channels across the United States in the next 6 months
Work on our channels with partners with contracts at schools and reaching organizations for people with motor disabilities
Reach a significant part of the 10 million people with motor disabilities in the United States over the course of the next 3 years
You can support the Key-X Multifunctional Keyboard by purchasing one for yourself or for a loved one, or you can purchase one of these very special multifunctional keyboards and donate it to any hospital or organization in the world that you choose — and we will make sure that a Key-X will get there.Alternatively, since every dollar counts, you can make a contribution of any amount and we will pool all these smaller contributions together to purchase Key-X Keyboards and send them to the pre-selected and vetted organizations in our list above. So, when you make a contribution between $1 and $750, please make sure that you let us know to which one of these organizations above you want the Key-X Keyboard that you help to purchase and donate to go.We're in the early stage of an ambitious worldwide mission to offer autonomous and efficient digital inclusion and empowerment to people with Cerebral Palsy and other disabilities all over the globe to develop their skills, unleash their talents, and explore their individualities. With your help, we can make it happen, and one of the simplest but very effective ways of supporting our campaign is to like, comment and share our project on social media. For now, we already have some Key-X Multifunctional Keyboard units that are ready to be shipped. However, your contributions will allow us to fund the large-scale production and distribution of the keyboard that is going to make the lives of people with disabilities all over the world so much better.

story:
Good Work Foundation (GWF) – a South African not-for-profit – has spent two years developing a supplementary model of education that is changing the lives of young Africans, like nine-year old Karabo in the video above.

The Open Learning Academy is a brand new, technology-driven "hub and satellite" learning model for rural Africa that allows up to ten public-sector elementary schools to outsource digital learning to independently run Digital Learning Centers or “hubs”.

The Open Learning Academy is funded in full by GWF, supported in part by its longterm partners, including award-winning Londolozi Private Game Reserve  in South Africa (close to the famous Kruger National Park) and Martha Beck's LEAP Foundation in the USA. 

The model has been shortlisted and won awards for STEM education development and gender and poverty alleviation from organisations like the Southern African Trust and PricewaterhouseCoopers, and, in 2013, was featured at TEDx Edinburgh.

The results are clear: this model has the potential to change the lives of an entire generation, and it costs just $25 per child.

*Please note that all of your kind donations will be made via LEAP Foundation, our 501 c3 sister organisation in the USA.

The result has been spectacular.

Since opening in September 2012, the original Open Learning Academy located just outside the Kruger National Park in South Africa’s Mpumalanga province, is operating as a supplementary learning center for seven rural and low-income elementary schools.

Each school sends its Grade 4 students to the Academy for digital literacy tuition, as well as English and math tuition presented on digital devices. This is the first time these rural students have had access to blended learning.

The first school to attend the Open Learning Academy has seen a staggering 20% increase in English language ability and, in 2014, their students achieved an average of 77% for mathematics, compared to 40% in 2012. 

We need your help to extend this model to 10,000 schoolchildren.

With the requisite financial support, a phase two rollout of the Open Learning Academy model will extend digital learning to Grade 5, 6 and 7 students at 10 rural and low-income schools reaching 10,000 schoolchildren by January 2016.

The model obviates the need for a media lab to be installed at every school (Too expensive).

It also overcomes the challenge of a lack of digitally-trained teachers (Not enough time).

The Open Learning Academy provides the management, the technology, the facilitators and the mandate to ensure learning is fun, addictive and impactful. 

The model costs $250,000 per year. 

That's $25,000 per school and only $25 per student per year.

How can you contribute?

  • Sponsor a set number of students for $25 per student per year
  • Sponsor a school or schools for $25,000 per school
  • Help spread our message by sharing the campaign across Social Media - #OpenLearning #LoveKarabo
  • Become a volunteer: visit us in South Africa and see first-hand how this model has the potential to make a huge impact
*Please note that all of your kind donations will be made via LEAP Foundation, our 501 c3 sister organisation in the USA. LEAP was started by Martha Beck and her partner, Karen Gerdes, after they visited our Digital Learning Centres in South Africa and were inspired by the impact of our projects.

Why are we crowdfunding?

  • The Open Learning Academy in phase one is funded in full by Good Work Foundation, supported by its longterm partners, including award-winning Londolozi Private Game Reserve and Martha Beck's LEAP Foundation in the USA
  • As Open Learning moves into phase two, the momentum is building and its potential to change third world education is huge. Now is the time to build critical mass and demonstrate how this model will change the lives of hundreds of thousands of rural people
  • Crowdfunding offers exceptional transparency. We want to build a tribe of people who support Open Learning and can follow the progress every step of the way

Here’s why we believe Open Learning is the answer to third world education.

After working for more than a decade on a number of community-focused projects in rural Africa, GWF CEO, Kate Groch, set out to create this “hub and satellite” model so that it could be replicated across rural Africa and managed by the local people that each Academy serves.

Kate's vision has been to find a way to undo the tendency for education NGOs to build computer labs and donate hardware to single schools, benefitting only a few:

"The model had to be scalable, infusing a new way of learning into communities and affecting many schools, not just one or two. It also had to ensure central management from the Open Learning Academy. We licence software, update hardware and upgrade learning material. We ensure delivery of results.
With this model, our organisation is on a mission to prove that you don’t have to create a media lab in every rural school and you don’t have to rely on government to rollout digital tuition training for every teacher.
All you need is a high-tech community hub – and with that – the reach is dramatically extended.
By the end of 2016 the model will prove that we can improve English and math results by more than 30 percent for more than 10,000 students. That's going to change the way we look at education for rural, low-income schools."

To view Kate Groch's 2013 Edinburgh TEDx Talk on the future of education, click on the video below.

More about Good Work Foundation:

  • GWF is a registered NGO and operates four Digital Learning Centers in rural South Africa
  • GWF's digital facilitators and educators are made 100% of locally employed people
  • 80% of the GWF team is made up of women
  • GWF also has a digital literacy program for adults, providing a school-leaver's "bridging year" focusing on IT and English competency as well specific career-training
  • GWF's programs are fully endorsed by the local Department of Education
  • In 2013, GWF's Hazyview Digital Learning Centre won 1st Prize at the PricewaterhouseCoopers Gender Mainstreaming Awards in the category “Gender and Poverty Alleviation”

We look forward in anticipation to your donation to this project - please scroll on the right-hand side of this page to select a way that you can get involved. All of your kind donations will be made via LEAP Foundation, our 501 c3 sister organisation in the USA.

Thank you!

story:
Thanks for checking out our fundraising campaign for Youth in Action Camp! 

About Youth in Action Camp

Youth in Action is a not-for-profit youth camp for children aged 7 to 14 of all backgrounds. The organization is run by a team of volunteer counsellors, many of whom were campers before joining the staff. Much like other summer camps, we have plenty of fun and engaging activities, a compassionate staff and a beautiful setting up at Camp Kinkora in the Laurentians! 

What sets Youth in Action apart from the rest is the commitment to provide access to the camp to children of all economic backgrounds. One of our fundamental principles is that we never turn down a camper for lack of funds. In order to accommodate this, we have a fund that provides subsidies to any camper that requires financial aid. The demand for subsidies grows every year. In 2013, we subsidized 24 campers to attend, in 2014, the number raised to almost 30. In 2015, we're expecting subsidy requests to be higher than in any year prior. Please help us to keep sending children to camp by donating to this fund right here on our indiegogo campaign page!


The Impact

Sending one camper to camp for the week costs $350. 

If we can get 35 people to donate $10, we've got it. 

That ten dollars that you would have spent on a sandwich for lunch, or two coffees this week, or a ticket to a movie, will go towards making sure that one lucky kid will get to have a life-changing experience at Youth in Action Camp next summer. 

And what's better than sending ONE lucky kid to camp??? Sending TWO, or THREE or FIVE lucky kids to camp. 

Doesn't that sound great? So donate here, and become a part of the caring community that will make those kids' dreams come true. 

To show our appreciation for every penny you donate, we have some amazing perks for all donors. See the "Perks" section to the right for more information!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help!!

  • Follow us on Twitter (@youthin_action) and tell your friends to follow us  and donate!
  • Share this page with your Facebook contacts, your colleagues, friends, and their extended families! 

Our Team

This campaign would not be possible without the help and support of the lovely Youth in Action Camp staff, led by Co-Directors Ryan Butler and Maddy Orr and the Steering Committee of 2014-2015: Emily Skahan, Chris Fleming, Andrew Leduc, Delaney Orr, Bella Goulem, Kristopher Clow, Joey Bruzzese, and Michael Kozlowski.

story:
We've been INVITED!

The South Mountain Center for the Performing Arts (SMCA) Theatre Program at South Mountain High School in Phoenix, Arizona, has been nominated for the honor of performing at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe in August of 2015.  This is an incredible opportunity, offered through the auspices of the American High School Theatre Festival (AHSTF).

SMCA is a Magnet Program for Performing Arts that has been training young people in the Phoenix Union High School District for over 30 years.  Many of our program alumni are working actors in various professional theaters throughout the United States, including the Broadway stage!  But our school is located in a low-income section of a big city and our student body is made up of 95% minorities, who have had little-to-no travel opportunities.  Many of these children will be the first in their families to graduate from high school, and the first to go to college.

AHSTF has been producing high school performances at the Fringe Festival in Edinburgh, Scotland, for 25 years.

The Edinburgh Festival Fringe is the largest arts festival in the world!  For one month each summer the capital of Scotland becomes the world mecca of theatrical endeavors.  Over 1,000,000 people converge on the city to experience theatre in all its forms.

You can help these students from South Phoenix travel to Europe to interact with theatre artists from all over the world.  They will perform for a global community and form bonds of friendship with actors from a wide range of cultures and life experiences.

*Special thanks to Mesa Encore Theatre for being our partner and sponsoring our fundraising! 

What We Need & What You Get

It will cost over $56,000 to get six students and two chaperones to Edinburgh in the heart of the Festival Fringe.  The trip will include 14 days of travel in England and Scotland, visits to castles and the highlands, and of course, the opportunity to perform in a professional venue at an International Festival!

The AHSTF has put together a travel package that includes: 

  • Round-trip airfare 
  • Two nights’ accommodations in London
  • 10 nights’ accommodations in Edinburgh
  • Daily buffet breakfast 
  • Motorcoach service 
  • Half-day guided tour of London including a London theatre ticket
  • Rental of venue, including basic lighting, sound, and stage components
  • Ticket and venue program printing
  • Attendance at a Ceilidh (evening of Scottish dancing)
  • Full-day guided excursion to Stirling Castle and the Trossachs
  • Night security

The participating students and chaperones are each paying about 30% of the fees from their personal funds.  An additional 20% will come from school club fund-raising activities (we're running a snack store every day after school, plus catalog sales, and ticket sales to our Musical).  We have some general and Magnet school funding as well, but we still need to raise another $20,000.  That's where we need you!

If you help us out, you will get the satisfaction of knowing you have helped some underpriviledged children get an unparalleled international experience.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Large contribution or small, or even none at all, please help us to find more folks who can help us get to Scotland!

  • Spread the word and help make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to send the information to your social media groups!

Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Help Us Build Future Entrepreneurs

As an entrepreneur, humanitarian, mentor and business coach, I am humbly seeking your assistance .It was always my childhood dream to be an entrepreneur. Over the years my journey towards achieving this goal was difficult, I was in need of training, guidance and support. Wishing there was a program tailored to suit my needs, providing me with building blocks for success, a program that facilitates mentoring, training and networking. You maybe or know of someone about to walk that path, I want to prevent this. Help me create a program that will turn feasible ideas into successful business ventures!

My goal here is to Create an Environment that Generates Creativity and Promotes Entrepreneurship so I am sincerely asking for your help.

This campaign was created with the intention to improve future entrepreneurs, aiming for individuals with creative ideas, college graduates and failing entrepreneurs seeking  direction. I enjoy helping people create long-term businesses. 

This program will focus on:

  • Mentoring and Coaching
  • Training
  • Business assistance services
  • Marketing
  • Social intervention
  • Networking


What We Need

Our research shows that $23,000.00 US will get the programme running  we have invested 26% and seeking the other 74%.  With this investment we will be able to carry out: 

  • Training: for the year 2015  series of seminars and workshops for unemployed  young adults; mentor-ship will be provided for new and existing entrepreneurs. 
  • Commercial space:  we would like a workshop space.
  •  Equipment:  computers, printer, desk and chairs
  • Marketing: Executing our marketing strategies

                                                Estimated Budget Contributions

                    

If my targeted amount is not met, the program period  will reduce. I would not  be able to assist a large group but will help who I can afford to reach out to . We can’t do it without you; yes you

The Caribbean  has a consistent stream of unsung entrepreneurial heroes even with limited skills and very little training. Imagine what we could do with your assistance. Help us fulfil our dream to make a significant impact on ensuring a solid future for entrepreneurs.                                                

               We will contribute greatly to the productive sector 

           


Our small business sector is demanding as well as competitive therefore it is essential that new entrepreneurs harness the requisite skills and direction to be able to compete and succeed. I intend to create an environment that encourages and supports training, creativity and co-operation.

 I've embarked on this exciting adventure because I'm passionate about: 

  • Small business development,and Creativity
  •  Social enterprise 
  •  Education and Training

Help create a programme that will train entrepreneurs to be better business men and women, boost creativity and ingenuity, build productive sectors and create employment. 

           

Other Ways You Can Assist

If you aren't able to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us out.

Share this campaign with everyone you know on facebook!twitter! and Instagram!

Send us an email of other ways you can assist (assistant1.plus@gmail.com)
