 Social enterprise 
 Education and Training

Help create a programme that will train entrepreneurs to be better business men and women, boost creativity and ingenuity, build productive sectors and create employment. 

           
Other Ways You Can Assist
 
If you aren't able to contribute,
that doesn't mean you can't help us out.
Share this campaign with everyone
you know on facebook!twitter! and Instagram!Send us an email of other ways you can assist (assistant1.plus@gmail.com)

story:
I am Bob Betterton, President of Accelerating Catholic Church Reform, Inc. (ACCR), which publishes the free, on-line quarterly magazine, OMG! A Journal of Religion & Culture.

My campaign team consists of our Editor/Publisher Mary Anne Winfield; Managing Editor M.D. Ridge; Webmaster Megan Carson; and the four students from the Communications and Film Course at LeMoyne College, Ashley Colon, Keara Sammon, Ronnie Bertrand and Nicole Shutowich who produced our video.

In October 2013 the leadership of ACCR realized there was a need for a vehicle to clearly communicate authoritative information on many issues to the Church, hierarchy and laity in order to advance the notion that to survive the Church must completely change the way it does business.

We decided the best vehicle was a high quality, thoughtful, all-inclusive and free, on-line quarterly magazine, which soon became OMG! A Journal of Religion & Culture.

I asked my friend, internationally known journalist and author Robert Blair Kaiser to help us make this concept a reality as its Editor/Publisher. He quickly accepted, with two conditions I readily embraced:

·  He would publish OMG! for a year, to a year and a half, by convincing some of his writer friends to donate articles previously published elsewhere, at no cost to us.

·  When he had enough quarterly issues to demonstrate the quality level he wanted, he would personally approach three or four of his “wealthy friends” for funding “which would allow us to pay our writers a living wage, putting us in a rather elite group”.

The first issue of OMG! was published on April 1, 2014 and the ninth on April 1, 2016. OMG! has a three-person creative staff: An Editor/Publisher; a Managing Editor; and a Webmaster. There have been four to six articles in each of the of the nine issues.

Our twenty-seven different writers are a very diverse group which includes leaders of reform organizations like Janet Hauter and Rene Reid; critics of the Institutional Church Peter Borre, George Bouchey, Betty Clermont, Tom Doyle (twice), Bob Kaiser (six times) and David Timbs (three times); Catholic Theologians Hans Küng (twice) and Shaji George Kochuthara (twice); Educators Paul Lakeland, William J. O’Malley SJ (three times); George V. Coyne SJ, Director of the Vatican Observatory and Christine Roussel, Catholic essayist (five times).

Our total out-of-pocket cost for those nine issues was under $200 in fees for our website.

There is obviously an enormous irony in this, given Bob Kaiser’s goal “to pay our writers a living wage”, but he felt that we had to first demonstrate our credibility.

This first part of his plan served us well. Unfortunately, by the time he had enough issues to make his point to potential sponsors, Bob’s cancer had returned and he was not able to deliver on the promised funding.

Before Bob Kaiser died, a little over a year ago, he, Managing Editor Mary Anne Winfield and I discussed the problem and I convinced them that we should try “crowdfunding” through IndieGoGo. In deference to Bob, Mary Anne and I tabled that project until early this year.

There is no doubt that OMG! has been a success. However, we are finding it more and more difficult to obtain high quality, donated articles.

In order to continue we must raise sufficient money to allow us to pay our writers and our creative staff the “living wage” Bob Kaiser promised, or quietly close down.

We pledge that 100% of the money we raise will be paid to our writers and creative staff.

We did a survey on fees paid to writers for articles we consider to be in the same genre as OMG!. Those magazines were US Catholic, America and Commonweal. We found the minimum payment for an unsolicited article at these publications to be $150.

This budget is based on a minimum payment by OMG! of $250.

The annual budget is as follows:

  Creative Staff  $19,000.00

  Writers  $16,000.00 

  Total  $35,000.00

If we reach our goal, OMG! will be funded for one year, but we hope to raise funding for two.

We have a “Perks List” which reaches out to the very people who will benefit the most from the success of the plan, writers. So far there are two.

Other perks may be forthcoming.

Please help us with this important project.

story:
Find yourself in Nature


The Impact

Children should know what a dandelion is, they should be able to tell the difference between a Chickadee and a Blue jay. As they move through this experience their confidence will grow and they will learn to feel more connected to themselves, their families, and their communities. Having a meaningful connection to nature correlates strongly with a more fulfilling and successful life style. When families practice Outdoor skills together it brings them closer and connects them through mutual experience and working together to overcome challenges. We create a wonderful bonding opportunity for your family
In general practicing Wilderness skills will help build confidence in your daily life, A sense of strength from knowing that you can overcome challenges, and form a deeper sense of connection to the world around you. Your contribution can help ensure a healthy future for our next generation.


What we are asking:

 In order to create the ultimate outdoor experience we need our own place.With your generous donation, we will purchase a piece of forest land near the twin cities, in order to build the getaway that people so need in their lives. Having this project crowd funded will allow us to keep our prices down, and offer access to a greater portion of the population. I am an EMT in St. Paul, and my dad is a disabled vet. Jeff also works full time. We cannot do this without your help. We do not have the money to make this happen.

We plan to purchase 60 acres of forest land between Mora and Hinckley, Mn. on which we will build,  plant walks, primitive camp, and immersion training locations. All Funding from this campaign will serve as a down payment on this land. We believe that this type of experience is essential to all people. Please help us bring this project to life.

There are hundreds of thousands of people in the twin cities area that need to be connected to nature, with your contribution we can be that!


The Story:

My name is Blake Southard. I am the program director, and one of the instructors with Future Necessities Wilderness skills training and Primitive technology. We  have a tremendous passion the human connection to nature. We are working to bring this passion with to the masses through a series of workshops and programs to bring people into nature and guide them through an experience that will truly change their lives. to show them how be comfortable in the wilderness, and to have the confidence to go forth and explore.

In the modern world that we all share, there is a sense of disconnection; Disconnection from nature, and from community. We are offering a chance to get away, to unplug for a weekend, or a week, and reconnect with people, and with the earth. When you sign up for a Future Necessities workshop, you can expect the utmost attention to your well-being as well as the highest quality outdoor education. We will take individuals or families, bring them into a wilderness setting, and for the duration of the class we will guide them through the learning process to ensure that all participants feel fulfilled and confident. 

Our students will gain a strong sense of being part of a community and learning to reconnect with the world on a whole new level of awareness. After participating in our program, you will never see the woods the same way again!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help spread the word, and get our campaign seen by everyone, the more people who see the work that we are doing the more likely we are to accomplish our goal.
  • please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

In Africa, high school and college education is not free and many students must sacrifice their education for work.  In Ghana, eSyllabus for Africa runs competitions to find brilliant but needy students and then sponsors their full education.  This includes full boarding at premier schools where they can rub shoulders with their wealthier compatriots and reach their full potential.  All scholarship recipients are required to maintain a high academic standard and also to perform some community service.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to fund our 15 students from this years Mathletes competition, eSyllabus for Africa needs to raise $30,000 for our scholarship reserves.  The cost of three years with boarding is approximately $2,000 per student.  This rate is highly subsidized by the government and these are public schools and the real cost to the institution is much higher.  This means that your contribution is highly leveraged for the maximum impact.  

Every donor of over $500 will be paired with a student.  That student will send you letters and pictures highlighting the impact of your donation and the experiences of the student in the eSyllabus for Africa scholarship programs.

The Impact

By educating a needy but brilliant student, you are making a big impact on their lives and on the nation of Ghana.

  • These students would otherwise have to attend low quality rural schools and have to work in farming or hawking to make their school fees.
  • An educated student with strong English is far more likely to get a job.
  • Our community service requirements send these students back to their villages during breaks to help in local schools and to help spread our free digital library programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • eSyllabus for Africa regularly sends containers to Africa and old laptops and school supplies are always needed.  Set up a donation drive today.
  •  Set up a sister school program today with your local school and an African school.  It's a great way to teach your kids to value how lucky they are.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I've always dreamth of going aboard to help. Mostly, I imagined going into school and helping children. But I've found an even better opportunity! I've always said I want to travel to Asia, and recently I've developed a love for elephants...

This money will fund my travel to Asia to not only help teach children English in school, environmental, and leadership skills. But to help to support rescued elephants, restore and maintain the local jungle damaged by local practices!

Whilst on this project I will help with tree planting and ground maintenance, teaching English to Mahouts and at local schools, tend to elephants – preparing food, bathing and cleaning, help to build elephant shelters! Sounds amazing doesn't it!? 

Manpower is needed for the labour intensive jobs of reforestation, camp maintenance and improving the school facilities helps benefit the project and local community, essential for the improvement of the lives of the elephants.

I will document my journey via film & photography. I hope that by doing this, I can show that your donations not only helped me to achieve a dream, but inspire you to give back and contribute!

story:
The Psychedelic Society of Ireland aims to encourage wider public understanding of the benefits and responsible use of psychedelic substances. 

The Psychedelic Society of Ireland is a branch of the organization that has been set up in the UK (http://www.psychedelicsociety.org.uk/). We aim to promote the amazing work done by the founders and support the large number of people in Ireland who are interested in such a community.

We are committed to being as inclusive as possible, welcoming people of all ages, genders, ethnicities and sexual orientations and taking positive steps to encourage a diverse range of voices at our events.

Whilst the Society seeks to maintain a strong online presence, we aim to hold regular face-to-face events in Ireland to complement our online activity. 

This cannot be done without your help!

By supporting this campaign you can help us set up events nationwide such as seminars with world renowned professors and psychotherapists, shamans, artists, activists and many more. Further funding will allow us the opportunity to get involved with other festivals and events throughout Ireland in order to promote and educate a larger audience. You can also help support workshops, psilocybin identification outings, book clubs and gatherings. 

What We Need 

We are asking for  €1250 to aid the first year of events for the Psychedelic Society of Ireland. This money will go towards:

  • Rent of a suitable venues in cities across Ireland
  • Travel costs for guest speakers including Irish shamans and experts on the safe use of psychedelics.
  • Flights and other travel costs for UK based guest speakers including professors specializing in the medicinal used of psilocybin, LSD and MDMA, who are currently undertaking testing in the UK.
  • PA hire for the events.
  • Printing for promotion and advertisements.

What You Get

Everyone who supports this campaign with even the smallest donation will get a huge THANK YOU from everyone in the Psychedelic Society. You will be personally thanked on the event programmes. Your support will not only benefit us, but it will benefit a large community of people in Ireland who are hungry for information and experience.
  • If you donate €20+ you will receive an official Psychedelic Society poster.
  • If you donate €50+ you will become an official member of the Psychedelic Society and will gain priority tickets for every event we hold (keeping in mind many events will be intimate with a limited amount of tickets available) This will ensure you can attend every event you so kindly helped support. 
If you cannot financially support us, you can help us in other ways. Please make some noise about this campaign! Post it on your social medias, tell your friends and family, and please keep in contact with us on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/psysocire
Most importantly, be open about your interest in psychedelics. We aim to break the taboo in Ireland, and you can help us do this.

We have the contacts, we have the professionals, we have the market, all we need is your financial support to bring the Psychedelic Society to Ireland.

story:
Phase One

Gregory and team, Anthony, Rick and Gemma, have already helped thousands of students with this program since 2010. Based on the feedback you can see below, we are already creating a positive and lasting impact. 


Our goal is to give young people the tools they need to approach each stage of their education and career selection with focus, direction and purpose. Check out the videos below where we expand on the concept.

 The challenge now is to spend less time generating funds and dedicating all of our resources to delivery and expansion.


Funding Breakdown and Goals


  • The program, delivery and work book is $59 per Student in groups of 40-45.
  • There are approximately 1350 Grade 8 students which sets our mark at $80,000.
  • That's 30 full day sessions to be delivered through May and June

What is Flipping the Iceberg?

Icebergs, like people, are beautiful, unique and amazing. We know that on average only 10% of their mass is visible above the water.

That's a lot like our own potential isn't it? Most of the time it feels like 90% of what we are capable of is dormant under the water. Why do we feel like that? What can we do about it? The programs concept is to FLIP THAT ICEBERG! Tap into that 90%.

We're trying out Prezi in our Indiegogo Campaign to show you how much fun we're having and what the Students and Teachers have to say about the program, since we started Flipping the Iceberg in 2010.

Our program is about teaching young people to understand who they are and continue to be aware of themselves, as they grow into each transition in their education and life path.


Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenge we face is - With the current curriculum and all the youth programs already available, what could they possibly gain from another program?

A fair question... recently Gregory went with his son on a tour of a University in Ontario. He heard from the Finance Representative that the cost of attending was between $17,000- $21,000 per year. Later on, the Administration Representative asked the prospective students: "How many of you know what your major will be?" Approximately 5% raised their hands. She went on to inform the group that over 70% of their students change their major, or continue to attend classes with an 'undeclared major' after their first year, so don't worry "you'll figure it out." Now would any parent be comfortable with this guidance? We designed Flipping the Iceberg to address issues like these. When you know yourself you can design your future.

Another challenge is, normally it can take weeks to fund a campaign of 1-4 schools in a small area. We have a system, it's slow but it works. The challenge is it consumes a lot of the resources which we know would be better utilized focusing on the students, training more trainers and further developing the online components.

This is why we are here on Indiegogo - to use a stronger, faster funding model so we can extend the program's reach and have a lasting positive impact on more students than ever before.

A third challenge is that there are very few programs that are trying to teach the themes that run through Flipping the Iceberg, and so far we've found none which are focused on young people.

We're not trying to re-write the curriculum or offer a brief moment of hyped up motivation.  Originally the program was designed for  entrepreneurs and adults that were considering (or forced into) new education or another career.  We offer a systematic approach to self knowledge, which we believe is the true foundation for a life and career plan which leads to fulfillment and lasting success.

Here's Anthony's experience with Flipping the Iceberg:

There are Other ways to Contribute:


We know that $59 is a small investment for an experience that will give youth access to tools they can use to reach their potential, understand who they are and enter their post secondary path with direction and purpose. If you agree with that, but are unable to claim a reward - please share our campaign everywhere you can and you will absolutely make a significant contribution.

This is only Phase One, our plans are far reaching and have been in the works long before we considered crowd funding.

Our long term goals which will be spread out over the next campaigns will include:

  • Provincial Program Coverage (Ontario, Canada)
  • National and Remote Location out-reach (We're a big country!)
  • Online resources, E-Courses, Webinars, Apps
  • Conferences and Camp weeks
Top talent be aware, when Phase One is successful - we will be aggressively expanding our team, seeking social media and funding experts. Along with online content managers, App & E-Course developers. We will want to hear from you, IF we go over 100% (you know what to do...)

   What is Flipping the Iceberg?Icebergs, like people, are beautiful, unique and amazing. We know that on average only 10% of their mass is visible above the water.That's a lot like our own potential isn't it? Most of the time it feels like 90% of what we are capable of is dormant under the water. Why do we feel like that? What can we do about it? The programs concept is to FLIP THAT ICEBERG! Tap into that 90%.We're trying out Prezi in our Indiegogo Campaign to show you how much fun we're having and what the Students and Teachers have to say about the program, since we started Flipping the Iceberg in 2010.Our program is about teaching young people to understand who they are and continue to be aware of themselves, as they grow into each transition in their education and life path.
 Risks & ChallengesOne of the biggest challenge we face is - With the current curriculum and all the youth programs already available, what could they possibly gain 
from another program?A fair question... recently Gregory went with his son on a tour of a University in Ontario. He heard from the Finance Representative that the cost of attending was between $17,000- $21,000 per year. Later on, the Administration Representative asked the prospective students: "How many of you know what your major will be?" Approximately 5% raised their hands. She went on to inform the group that over 70% of their students change their major, or continue to attend classes with an 'undeclared major' after their first year, so don't worry "you'll figure it out." Now would any parent be comfortable with this guidance? We designed Flipping the Iceberg to address issues like these. When you know yourself you can design your future.Another challenge is, normally it can take weeks to fund a campaign of 1-4 schools in a small 
area. We have a system, it's slow but it works. The challenge is it consumes a lot of the 
resources which we know would be better utilized focusing on the students, training
 more trainers and further developing the online components. This is why we are here on Indiegogo - to use a stronger, faster funding model so we can extend the program's reach and have a lasting positive impact on more students than ever before. A third challenge is that there are very few programs that are trying to teach the themes that run through Flipping the Iceberg, and so far we've found none which are focused on young people.We're not trying to re-write the curriculum or offer a brief moment of hyped up motivation.  Originally the program was designed for  entrepreneurs and adults that were considering (or forced into) new education or another career.  We offer a systematic approach to self knowledge, which we believe is the true foundation for a life and career plan which leads to fulfillment and lasting success.Here's Anthony's experience with Flipping the Iceberg:
  There are Other ways to Contribute:
We know that $59 is a small investment for an experience that will give youth access to tools they can use to reach their potential, understand who they are and enter their post secondary path with direction and purpose. If you agree with that, but are unable to claim a reward - please share our campaign everywhere you can and you will absolutely make a significant contribution.This is only Phase One, our plans are far reaching and have been in the works long before we considered crowd funding.Our long term goals which will be spread out over the next campaigns will include:
Provincial Program Coverage (Ontario, Canada)

National and Remote Location out-reach (We're a big country!) 

Online resources, E-Courses, Webinars, Apps 

Conferences and Camp weeks

Top talent be aware, when Phase One is successful - we will be aggressively expanding our team, seeking social media and funding experts. Along with online content managers, App & E-Course developers. We will want to hear from you, IF we go over 100% (you know what to do...)

story:
The Tina Initiative

The highest rate of female AND male murders in Canada, at a heinous, serial level, are among its Aboriginal People. 

Most publicized is Missing & Murdered Native Women. Over 1,200 Women are missing from known, plus many deemed unknown, causes. (Please note scripts in blue indicates LINKs for more information.)

Known causes include those who have lost their lives at the hands of Robert Picton, a serial killer in Port Coquitlam, B.C., many missing on the Highway of Tears, a 500 mile section of Hwy 16 between Prince George and Prince Rupert, B.C., to the many naive Youth who so sadly fall prey to evil men when they leave the sanctuary of their homes to either visit or move to large cities.

Despite continued pleas from its Aboriginal People, the Government of Canada has steadfastly refused to call a National Inquiry into this horrific situation. 

Regardless of when the Canadian Government finally decides to call a full National Inquiry, one Canadian has stepped in to help with an information programme to help educate Canada's vulnerable youth, of all races, colours and creeds, hoping that through this initiative, they will be better trained to choose and make the right decisions when faced with potential dangerous situations.

Niagara, Ontario portrait artist, Michael Rilstone, has painted Tina Fontaine, one of the vulnerable Native youth who visited a large city and was killed. She was found murdered, wrapped in plastic, and tossed into Winnipeg, Manitoba's Red River on August 17, 2014. She was only 15 years old!

Winnipeg's Police Sgt. John O’Donovan stated on television, "This is a child that's been murdered. I think society would be horrified if someone put a litter of kittens or pups in the river in this condition. This is a child. She has been in this city for barely a month, exploited, murdered and put in the river in this condition."

Rilstone, himself a parent, felt like he had been kicked in the stomach when watching Tina's body being pulled from the river and decided to do something to help stop this carnage. He states, "We are all of the human race, in this together. We must all keep talking, educating, and providing information to stop the travesty."

Crafting an educational plan for schools Canada-wide, he will furnish schools with two teaching aids. 

First, Rilstone spent several months on Tina's portrait. Legally blind, he paints one drop at a time, acrylic on canvas, using a toothpick for a brush. He paints looking through a powerful magnifying light, necessary to see where he is applying each drop. Tina's portrait is approximately 25,000 individual drops of paint.

Rilstone says, "I do not understand the Creator, God and spirituality, but I did feel Tina was guiding my hand while painting and helping to formulate this project to educate her peers into the evils that lurk to hurt our Youth."

He creates his portraits in a unique, monochromatic style, generally using shades of grays, plus black and white. When he thought he had finished, Rilstone felt Tina's hand once more and added some blue, which gave high contrast and impact to his finished portrait: a blue teary eye and two blue tear drops on her cheek.

The final portrait is called Trillions of Tears and to Rilstone it represents not only the tears for Canada's Missing & Murdered Native Women and Men, but also the colonialism and genocide that Aboriginal People have suffered on Turtle Island since 1492.

Rilstone plans to supply artist-signed, fine art prints of Trillions of Tears to as many schools in Canada as possible. It will be a constant reminder to our Youth of the evils that lurk in waiting, ready to exploit, hurt and often murder them.

The educational information campaign will also include The Tina Fontaine Story which will recount what a beautiful girl Tina was and her sad demise in Winnipeg. 

The Tina Fontaine Story will be co-written by Tina's Family and Rilstone, in consultation with experts specializing in teaching, plus a member of Canada's penal system. The highest percentage of inmates in Canadian prisons are Aboriginal. Hopefully, The Tina Initiative can also assist our Native Youth to make better decisions before they break the law.  

This IndieGoGo fundraising drive will assist Rilstone with the launch of The Tina Initiative. 

Once operational, Rilstone will be donating a major portion of all proceeds made on the sale of Tina's portrait Trillions of Tears to help keep supplying schools Nationwide with this educational campaign.

Friends of The Tina Initiative

As noted, this funding is the seed money to help launch The Tina Initiative.

We're hoping for many contributors. This is an opportunity open to every Canadian to help make a difference. Even the cost of a double-double will boost this initiative tremendously. (But note, the worth of 10, 20, 50, or more double-doubles will also be graciously received!)

Every donor will be recognized officially and equally as a Friend of The Tina Initiative and will be officially recognized on every copy of the artist-signed, fine art print of Tina's Trillions of Tears portrait.

The web site following this progress and listing the Friends to be typeset on the print is found at Friends of The Tina Initiative. 

Soon after your kind donation is received, your name will be added to the official list on that web site. PLEASE ensure it appears and the spelling of your name, group or firm is correct! 

Yes, you will be recognized for your donation in schools coast-coast-coast as one who recognized action must be taken to help our Youth. Feel the pride in what you will have done!

NOTE: If you have made a donation and your name is missing from our published list on that web site LINKed above, please contact us immediately at TrillionsOfTears@outlook.com.

Our Goal

We are confident The Tina Initiative will save lives!

If you donate, will you be saving a life?

Statistically, it is impossible to know when a life is saved when our youth take an information campaign to heart, using it to make better choices and avoiding dangerous circumstances, but look what one expert says about our initiative!

This powerful message came from one KNOWS: one who works with troubled Native Women in Canada's prison system. Commenting on The Tina Initiative, she wrote, "Bravo! I do programming at our institution to raise awareness on the missing and murdered with the women for themselves and to pass on to their children as well. Sadly, our Native Sisters are over represented in jail to the tune of about 30% here in the south and up to 100% in the north versus 2% of the general population. I would be pleased to assist in any way I can and would love to post Tina's picture in our institution and give the women an opportunity to read her story. Success depends on your perspective. If one woman's life is saved through your work I call it an unparalleled and valuable success. I suspect however, that your initiative may serve to generate more collective action and save many."

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking your valuable time to learn about, and hopefully support, The Tina Initiative. If you have reached this point, you must be a caring person, wanting our world to be a far better place for all.

We hope to inscribe your name as a Friend of The Tina Initiative on every Trillions of Tears print.

And please share our programme with as many friends as possible! 

We CAN save lives and we WILL!

Above all, keep talking about Missing & Murdered Women and Men in Canada. Nothing gets accomplished when the talking stops. Or as Martin Luther King Jr. said, "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter."

Thank you,

The Tina Initiative

story:
Mom, do you have a music lover at home? A kid who sings at every chance?

Do you feel frustration with your kid not being physically coordinated enough or socially / emotionally ready to succeed at formal music lessons quite yet?

Do you dream he'll be more than just a toe-tapper, but become someone who deeply understands how to teach himself music with fantastic joy and confidence?

I can help you bring this music transformation home for your child! 

My name is Ekanem Ebinne

As a musical mentor for young children over the past 9 years, my dream has been to help all young children realize their true musical birthright, no matter what neighborhood they live in: The ability to understand music whether live or imagined; to read music AND play “by ear;” and to improvise, compose, and notate music with joy and confidence.


Join this campaign to help us buy video production and hire live musicians for 12 educational music videos perfectly designed to enhance your child's musical gift.


The Impact

  • Do you know any previously hopeful musicians who stopped playing because someone crushed the joy out of it for them?
  • Know any kids who gave up lessons because someone put too much pressure or overly formal expectations on them? 
  • Or maybe you know someone who can't keep a beat or stop singing 'pitchy,' and who struggles to play new songs or improvise. 
  • Or maybe you've seen the performers on TV music competitions with no clue as to their own lack of skill...?

Mother in Tune prevents those problems and nurtures joyful lifelong musicianship when children are most malleable: before age 9.


Enjoy Anywhere, Anytime

Since these videos are online, children who can't travel to an in-person music studio or meet a live music teacher will now have one in their home. And it will bring them the same success as the alumni children of my brick and mortar programs.

Debra Evans of Houston TX said,“Our 4 year old son just finished a course. He had a fantastic time and we couldn't be happier with the teacher and the methodology. I learned a bit myself in those 5 days and I know I'll be able to connect with our son musically in a more meaningful way. I wish every child could spend some time with Ekanem!”

The father of a 5-year-old graduate said he used his drumming skills from class to improvise in perfect timing with a professional band – to the amazement of the other musicians.

A mother, after hearing her 6 year old daughter sing flawless 2-part harmony with her school choir after a year with me, said it was the best show they’d ever had there.

A mom of a 5-year-old said her son often happily picked up his instrument to practice without being asked!

A 6 year old graduate, after learning to sing a handful of songs, could then play them on her instrument both in the original key and then spontaneously transpose them to other keys and harmonic modes, then improvise and play bass lines for them and play them in duets with other instruments



Online Prototype Alumni Gave Rave Reviews!

  • "I signed up for the course because my 4 year old daughter loves to sing, and I wanted to give her the chance to do something awesome with that. When we got on camera with the teacher, my daughter smiled a lot, but was nervous to join in. I was glad we were 'virtual' instead of the traditional in-person music class format. Because if nervous, she can hide off screen and feel more comfortable, whereas in person she could not. Having this video course online also eliminates travel. It is very pleasant. My advice is DO take thisexperience! The teacher, Ekanem, is lovely! She made us feel confident, capable, delighted, and warm." -Lucinda Croft, Topeka, KS:

  • "Our goal was to prepare our son for an audition with Houston Boy Choir - in a way that he would continue to enjoy singing. He loved the lessons. We was always so calm, happy and proud afterward. He told us that the teacher really made him feel special. He passed the audition to Houston Boy Choir and we had positive feedback from the audition. We can thoroughly recommend Ekanem Ebinne as a highly professional and dedicated music teacher for anyone wanting to do this course." -Patrick & Malena Friend, Houston TX


You Get A Musical Transformation

  • Your gift enables an amazingly beautiful service that transforms children’s creativity and our world’s musical future.

  • It is interactive, fun to use, and as good for kids’ deep music understanding as it is for family bonding.  Kids enjoy clicking on the screen, watching the videos in their house, moving around as much and as silly as they like, taking breaks when they want, and asking their parents questions about it as they learn to use audio and video recording technologies to make and post their musical creations.

  • Our vision is to reinvent how young children learn music in homeschool by cultivating "audiation," the mental musical instrument that plays all the others!

  • So instead of passively consuming music with vague understanding and stunted ability, kids can compose music like maestros; play and sing both known and new music confidently with great timing and tuning; develop individual style;  and coordinate with other players. 

  •  Our sequential rhythm and melody attunement has already created confident young vocalists and instrument players, as you saw in the testimonials above.

  • Families will enjoy my specially designed 3-step approach

    1. Inspiration from me to mother,

    2. Invitation from mother to child, and

    3. Imitation by the child as he internalizes his new-found rhythmic and tonal abilities.

Where Is This All Coming From?

    Last summer I and my choreographer team-mate Jamie Williams made an Indiegogo campaign to fund the video re-packaging of my bricks-and-mortar studio "Mother in Tune."  You can see more about Jamie's years of irresistible dance design at the university and professional levels in her gallery photo above.

    We planned to make Mother in Tune into online video lessons specifically designed for musical kids with their mothers.  Like mothers who use Charlotte Mason, Waldorf, or Montessori and want help providing music, but haven't yet found great early childhood music curricula on the market.

    But just after we raised enough to create a prototype, I was fortunate to survive a car-on-bicycle crash (as the cyclist) and paused the campaign while recovering.

    Now, six months later, I'm able to devote my time and energy and the funds previously raised into making this a reality!

    So please, pick a perk and join me - for the sake of your children and our musical future.

Mother in Tune Launch 2

    This new campaign will build on the old one with a larger team, including two fabulous instrumentalists your kids will LOVE and a more reasonably priced video editing contractor.

    So that more than the hundreds of children I have met and led to success in person for 9 years at local schools and my studio, potentially millions of children will fully enjoy their musical potential!


Innovations & Interests

    Our approach is exciting, innovative, and unique! It creates for parents the delight of getting real musical interplay from a child, moving freely in the flow of music together, and seeing real skills develop . 

    • I will be available by email to answer questions by any family that participates in the course
    • I will provide both video and print materials to address differing styles of applying the information with their children
    • I will use my team of experienced musicians, music educators, and movement educators to address questions from mothers 


Campaign

    We need professional video production. That's $3K to pay for video editors, live instrumentalists, and audio mixers to record and fully produce 12 video lessons.

      • Camera-person shoots 12 videos in 3 days

      • Editor finishes post-production and makes digital delivery in 5 days

      • If we overshoot the goal, funds go to produce a second season of videos

      • If we don't reach the entire goal, funds go to bare-bones production costs for a minimally viable course. That means we skip: Set Design & Construction, Hair & Makeup, Graphic Design, 3D Animation, and Custom Music

Please, pick a perk from the side panel. And THANKS for your love!

You Can Help With More Than Just Cash!
  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Retweet or FB  share with your friends!

Editor finishes post-production and makes digital delivery in 5 days
If we overshoot the goal, funds go to produce a second season of videos
If we don't reach the entire 
goal, funds go to bare-bones production costs for a minimally 
viable course. That means we skip: Set Design & Construction, 
Hair & Makeup, Graphic Design, 3D Animation, and Custom Music


Please, pick a perk from the side panel. And THANKS for your love!You Can Help With More Than Just Cash!
Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Retweet or FB  share with your friends!

story:
In 2015, I’ve got lots of goals for 2015 and want to make a quantum leap.

I have always given away the Natal Birth Chart Free to everyone. My sidekick Vinod  my beloved webmaster and I, have for years calculated each Birth Chart individually, while other websites do it online in real-time.  We are outgrowing calculating each chart individually and with so many more new visitors vising my website it's time to invest in my own proprietary online software to calculate the natal births charts in real time.  This requires special programming and a licensing agreement for the Ephemeris the hold grail on planets and their placements.  

I love Astrology and the way it makes people feel.  Some people love it some hate it and that’s ok.  What astrology does for people is it gives people insight and I think that’s what everyone, especially young people need today.   It's even better when it's entertaining and captivating too.  It gives those who have lost their way or are going through a rough patch hope and way back to their chosen path.  Through radio, social media, and You Tube I want to enlighten people about astrology, make it fun, predicative and a positive experience for everyone, and it all starts with the Natal Birth Chart. 

Currently you can hear me on iheartradio, I’ve written for magazines, been on TV, but I have always making astrology predictions and helping people’s lives through astrology.  

What We Need & What You Get

When I first started out in this business more than 20 yrs ago nobody knew what their Sun sign was.  Today I talk to lots of people and basically everyone knows their rising sign and their Moon sign and they are hungry for more. People can't get enough Astrology.

It becomes a lifelong hobby that you can pick up and put down whenever you want. There is an excitement about Astrology these days, especially in this love crazed world we live. People don't like to take risks and astrology is one of the tools they use.  Young people facing the future turn to astrology for help and why not it's celestial wisdom! It all starts with the Natal Birth Chart!

It becomes a life long hobby that you can pick up and put down whenever you want. There's an excitement about Astrology these days especially in this love crazed world we live.  People don't like to take risks and astrology is one of the tools they use.  Young people facing the future turn to astrology for help and why not it's celestial wisdom! It all starts with the Natal Birth Chart!

· $10 

Thank you

 I appreciate you get a Free Natal Birth Chart I will write notes on your chart all about you! 

 $50 

You are Fabulous!

You can claim a free Year Ahead transit Report

$100 

Honestly you are Super

A Where in the World should you live Report

$500

A personal consultation with me like none other!  


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges in eveerything but I love overcoming challenges.  I have risen to the top of my field and for good reason, hard work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Add my campaign link to your Facebook page and tweet about it! 
  • or use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story: I was blessed with the opportunity to be 1 of the 24 students chosen to travel to Italy this summer and intern in a field of our choice. I will be interning in the high fashion industry. As a business and journalism student Arizona State University, this is an opportunity I can not pass up. Being a full time student, working two jobs, nannying 7 year old twins and bartending, I do not have the means to afford such an endeavor. The fee to go is $9,000 and that goes straight to Arizona State University. I will need another $5,000 while there. I will be providing pictures and blogs throughout my journey through Italy and would love to keep in contact with anyone who is willing to donate. I am very ready to be a successful business woman and achieve all of my wildest dreams, but I need your help in beginning my journey. Thank you very much for your kindness.

story:
If you prefer to contribute outside the Indiegogo system, visit peace.pictures. 

We're up to changing the world through the power of children's television. 

With your support, we will create an 11-minute pilot episode for Avery's World,  our worldwide pre-school series.  The pilot will feature full 3-D animation, more complex (and expensive) than the simple motion graphics used in this Indiegogo presentation video.

Avery's World has been designed with two goals in mind:
    
1. To teach empathy, acceptance, diversity, teamwork, and peace to young children. Simply put, children create peace by learning about different cultures, by sharing personal stories, and by making friends.  Avery's World  will help children develop the self-confidence and the skills they need to communicate and connect with others different from themselves.

2. To help children feel "at home" in an ever-shrinking, multi-cultural world. Children who have been exposed to different cultures through travel or personal experience do better in school and are more successful in life.  Avery's World will give every child the mind- and spirit-expanding experience of other cultures.

After we make the pilot, we'll use it to raise the funds to make and distribute a full season of episodes.


The main characters in Avery's World are a multi-national group of friends, hailing from Asia, Europe, Africa, the Middle East and the Americas.  They role model a healthy family:  Avery (a dove) and Rosalia (a bird of paradise) are the guiding parents;  Ragnar (a seagull) and Lakpa (a kitten) play the children, vying for attention and getting into trouble.  Ricotta and Jubnah (mice) are the clever big sister and brother, and Mma (a viper) is the wise grandmother. 

Avery's World is a happy show about travel and culture.  Each 11-minute episode will:

  • teach teamwork as the characters solve a common problem;
  • open a window into foreign lands through a "new cultural folk tale" presented by storytellers and puppeteers from around the world;
  • inspire viewers to explore the multi-cultural treasures that surround them wherever they live.

The latest child development research guides us in teaching children to think and act in ways that value human differences and build pro-social skills.  This research shows that children with higher empathic understanding have higher grade-point averages, higher reading comprehension skills, and are more successful in social relationships.  Read more in the show "pitch book."

The money that we raise will be used to produce an 11-minute television-quality pilot episode for the show.  That means using professional writers, composers, musicians, voice talent, artists, and technology.  Once the pilot is made, we will use it to raise the approximately $4 million necessary to film, distribute, and promote one season of 26 eleven-minute episodes (kids tv is made in short segments and combined to fit the needs of local broadcasters.)  We will also release the pilot via YouTube, apps like Ameba and Kidobi, and social media so that the entire world can "increase the peace" with Avery and his friends.

OUR BREAKDOWN OF COSTS:

10% - pre-production.  Writing, design, and storyboarding to hone the concept and ensure an entertaining, developmentally-appropriate show. 
15% - music and music production.   Music is a vital part of the program and we won't skimp here.  Our pilot will have at least one fully-produced song.
10% - voice talent, sound effects, and sound production.  Casting, voice talent and studio time contribute to a polished presentation.
30% - animation and puppetry.   Backgrounds and key art will be drawn, supervised, and animated.  Puppets will be built and filmed.
10% - post-production. Editing, mixing, copying.
15% - financial and legal fees. Depending on the amount we raise, Indiegogo's commission runs up to 9% and PayPal's commission runs up to 5%.
10% - perks manufacturing and fulfillment.

IF WE EXCEED OUR GOAL:

We will upgrade music and visuals, beef up our social media presence, and then begin writing and storyboarding other episodes.  If we reach $125,000, we'll create a special, full-color, Avery's World collectible poster for all of our funders.  Beyond that, our talented team will come up with some new extra-special goods (like offerinG our characters to charities that serve children who have been affected by war)

If we don't make our goal, we will make as much of a pilot as we can, anywhere between three and eleven minutes. Our purpose is to introduce the characters and provide a taste of the music and mission of Avery's World. 

TIMELINE:

July 1 - Launch Indiegogo campaign.
August 15 - Begin pre-production.
October 1 - Begin audio production. Send out perks for supporters of $75 and under.
October 15 - Begin animation.
February 14 - Release pilot. Send out links to everyone and perks for supporters of $100 and above.


We have created a selection of beautiful, fun, and inspiring merchandise that shows you are part of our team.



The dove as a worldwide symbol of peace dates all the way back to the biblical story of Noah.  He's known by many different names (la colombe and el pajaro de la paz, for example) in many different cultures.  Bill created the character of Ambassador Bird twenty years ago to support kids in their natural enthusiasm for peace.  For the past ten years (see the gallery for pictures and videos), Avery and Bill have appeared at parades and peace rallies, sold and/or given away tens of thousands of stickers, and let children and adults use Avery to create their own messages of peace. 


Our award-winning team of creative artists, peace activists, and "kid biz" professionals know how to engage viewers with punchlines, not punches, and create stories that engage, educate, and entertain.

Bill Weber (Chief Creative Officer) is an artist, writer and producer with over 25 years of experience as an advocate for, and producer of, quality media for families. He designed the characters, wrote the pitch, and created the format for Avery's World.  
     Bill created and published New York's pioneering local parenting magazine, Parents & Kids Directory.  As the founder and president of the American Academy of Children's Entertainment, he collaborated with such kids' stars as Shari Lewis, John Burstein (Slim Goodbody), Bob McGrath, and Joanie Bartels, and partnered with Parenting Magazine, Opryland USA, and The Nashville Network on promotional events.  Visit his LinkedIn profile for the whole shebang.

Stephen Cohn (Musical Director) is internationally recognized for his music for feature films, television, and the concert stage.  He is the proud recipient of an Emmy and a Parents Choice Gold Award. 
     His scores have been part of many award-winning productions featuring such stars as Lily Tomlin, Joanne Woodward, Kathleen Quinlan, Colleen Dewhurst, William Shatner, and Wallace Shawn.  Visit his website for more.

Marci Levine (Consulting Producer) has shepherded both independent (Focus Features, Participant Media) and studio (Disney, Pixar, Dreamworks) animated films from concept through completion. 

Suzanne Birrell (Creative Director) is a multi-talented director, writer, songwriter, actor and arts executive.  As an educator, she has taught indigenous peoples throughout the United States.

Chuck Jones (Media Consultant), who shares a name with his famous animator cousin, is an accomplished marketing executive, photographer, and cinematographer in his own right.

David Bernstein (Licensing Consultant) is president of the Grand Design Communications agency, representing comic and graphic novels internationally.

ADVISORY BOARD
Ruth Broyde Sharone is a filmmaker, author, interfaith activist, internationally-recognized peacemaker, and co-chair of the Southern California Parliament of the World's Religions.  Her recent memoir, Minefields & Miracles, was endorsed by more than 30 religious leaders including H.H. the Dalai Lama.

Rev. Katherine Kinnamon is a minister of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ), an interfaith peace activist, and an author/contributor to several books on prayer and women's issues.

Sande Simpson is a Zen Buddhist priest & teacher, ordained in the Vietnamese lineage of H.T. Thich Thien An.
 

...for joining our team and our campaign for great children's television -- and peace!  We are grateful for any amount you can give, and for sharing our mission with your friends.  With your support, we can deliver this gift to the children of the world.

  • Mahatma Gandhi said, "If we are to teach real peace in this world, we shall have to begin with the children."
  • Coleman McCarthy (director of the Center for Teaching Peace in Washington, DC) said, "Unless we teach our children peace, somebody else will teach them violence." 

Thank you!

Bill, Stephen, Marci, Suzanne, Chuck, David

and the entire Avery's World team


                                            PLEASE LIKE OUR FACEBOOK PAGE

If you prefer to contribute outside the Indiegogo system,
please visit peace.pictures.

TM & (c) 2015 Bill Weber Studios

story:
Many young women living in urban slums are without their right to choose their own destinies. Often they are unable to join the workforce as they are forced to stay home with their young (pre school age) children or end up employed as domestic workers. Despite their important role, women are among the most exploited in the world.

By improving access to affordable and quality early childhood care and education, we can ensure young mothers have a safe and convenient place to keep their children during the working day while empowering other young women to join the workforce in more meaningful and dignified ways. 

The Social Impacts

The term yogya translates from Sanskrit to ‘worthy.’

Yogya is an innovative early childhood solution that empowers young women from urban slums to become next generation leaders in delivering early childhood care and education.

Yogya's aim is to provide employment, education and entrepreneurship opportunities for young women from urban slums, between the ages of 18-25, with the goal of inspiring future mothers, educators and social entrepreneurs.

We are designed to make the path to leadership easier for young women by offering an integrated training program and safe space for women to deliver early childhood care and education to children from urban slums, between the ages of 1-4, that focuses on the underlying characteristics of trust, autonomy and initiative. 

Our Integrated Training Program 

  1. SMS Interactive Training - basic training is offered at a freemium leveraging SMS technology and coupled with distributed visual guidebooks  
  2. Observation Training - intermediate training is offered through a peer to peer training model 
  3. In-Field Training - advanced training and basic compensation is offered through an experiential training model 
  4. Levelled Training - ongoing training through SMS technology is required monthly to maintain full compensation over a two year training period


Our Goal This Year: Minimum Viable Product 

Our Goal 5 Years: Product Scale 

The Impact of $25,000

Our Innovation Process 

Our Implementation Plan -July/August 2015

Who We Are 

We are a team of aspiring social entrepreneurs from the Masters of Design in Strategic Foresight and Innovation program at OCAD University in Toronto. 

This past March, we competed in the Regional Finals of the Hult Prize Challenge in San Francisco, one of the largest student competition and start up platforms for social good - and we're fortunate to have made top 6. This experience only fuelled our passion for moving forward... 

We're now fighting for a chance to make the wildcard round of the 2015 Hult Prize Global Finals for a chance to secure USD1 million in seed capital to launch our sustainable social venture. 

               

Other Ways You Can Help

As students ourselves, we understand that some of you might find it difficult to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! There's always a way to show your support:                        

              

OR
  • If you work in the field of women's empowerment or early childhood education  drop us a line at info@iamyogya.com, we'd love to start a conversation!  

Our Supporters

             

Hot Off The Press 

Hult Prize Website: http://www.hultprize.org/en/compete/2015-prize/2015-finalists/

OCAD U Website: http://www2.ocadu.ca/news/8221/ocad-u’s-strategic-foresight-and-innovation-students-reach-regional-finals-for-million-dollar-hult

Hult Prize Twitter: https://twitter.com/hultprize/status/576924692767862784

OCAD U Website:  http://www2.ocadu.ca/news/8407/two-ocad-u-teams-reach-final-five-in-the-hult-prize-regional-finals

CSCI Newsletter: http://goo.gl/MLvAuO  

“Early education is critical not only for a child's overall development, but also her emotional health, her learning and communication skills, her dignity and self-esteem - in brief, for her immediate as well as long-term well-being. But every day, tens of millions of children all over the world are denied the basic right to reach their full potential. To get the best start in life, a child needs love and attention, nutrition and health-care, just as urgently as he needs education and protection. Nothing in the world is more important — and #everychildisworthy.”

OR

If you work in the field of women's empowerment or early childhood education  drop us a line at info@iamyogya.com, we'd love to start a conversation!  






Our Supporters







             


Hot Off The Press 
Hult Prize Website: http://www.hultprize.org/en/compete/2015-prize/2015-finalists/
OCAD U Website: http://www2.ocadu.ca/news/8221/ocad-u’s-strategic-foresight-and-innovation-students-reach-regional-finals-for-million-dollar-hult
Hult Prize Twitter: https://twitter.com/hultprize/status/576924692767862784
OCAD U Website:  http://www2.ocadu.ca/news/8407/two-ocad-u-teams-reach-final-five-in-the-hult-prize-regional-finals
CSCI Newsletter: http://goo.gl/MLvAuO  




“Early education is critical not only for a child's overall development, but also her emotional health, her learning and communication skills, her dignity and self-esteem - in brief, for her immediate as well as long-term well-being. But every day, tens of millions of children all over the world are denied the basic right to reach their full potential. To get the best start in life, a child needs love and attention, nutrition and health-care, just as urgently as he needs education and protection. Nothing in the world is more important — and #everychildisworthy.”

story:
The Yellow Movement Valentine's Day fundraiser first took place in 2013 with 500 flowers donation and the movement was able to raise 4000 ($200) Ethiopian Birr by selling the flowers at Addis Ababa University Main Campus. The following year, we added one more location and took our fundraiser to the streets of 4kilo. That year, we were able to raise 42,000 ($2,000) Ethiopian Birr. In February of 2015, we expanded even more; by delivering large bouquets to businesses and persons who made larger donations. That year we were able to raise 107,000 ($5,000) Ethiopian Birr and were able to launch 'The Yellow Movement Scholarship Fund'. Finally, in 2016, with support the Global Shapers Addis and U.S. Embassy, we expanded to over six location and with dozens more deliveries we we’re able to raise 168,000 Birr ($8,000).

The scholarship fund is different from the simple fundraiser we have been doing in the fact that it pre-selects students and provides a continuous support throughout the year. It provides 200 Ethiopian Birr per month to each student for 10 months amounting to 2000 ETB per student. The plan for this scholarship fund is to make it sustainable. We plan to establish a shop where profits directly go to the scholarship fund. We also plan to link it with a mentorship program so that students are able to get more than financial support.

story:
East Akron Community House Has Been There for The Community.  EACH has been in existence for over 100 years and since the early 1950's EACH has provided refuge, advocacy and support to the African-American community of East Akron.  Every day at EACH we made music, received help with school, challenged discrimination and exclusion in housing, jobs and public life.  EACH made it possible for many of us to succeed.  Now it is our time TO REACH OUT TO HELP EACH OUT!


$55,500 will Help EACH to be the Community's ACTION House Again

The address of East Akron Community House is 550 S. Arlington St.  We are asking you to give $550, $55.00, $5.50:
$550 will pay the heat bill for one month
$55 will help make EACH a clean and accessible environment for services by EACH and tenant organizations
$5.50 will help keep a receptionist at the desk providing advocacy and information to the community 

Why Give To EACH Today?

East Akron Community House has new leadership.  We know that over the last few years the previous leadership has let the community down, been fiscally irresponsible to the point of letting the building fall into foreclosure, and most importantly, not believed in East Akron and its commitment to EACH. The new EACH Association leadership is seeking to return EACH to serving YOU first, but we need your help.  

  • Keep our doors open: $20,000 will pay utilities, maintenance and snow removal through the spring and provide for critical repairs to the building
  • Save our building from the mistakes of the past: $15,500 will provide for legal fees to help stop foreclosure efforts 
  • Make for a successful 2015: $20,000 will help  jumpstart the youth and health programming the community needs and want.

Risks & Challenges

We want to be honest with you.  We might lose the building but the organization will keep going and serving the East Akron Community.  But we want to assure you that every penny raised by this campaign will go to benefit the East Akron community.  Our building is important to us but EACH IS MORE than a building, 

EACH is

  • Community
  • Advocacy
  • Accountability

Can't Give? Here's How You Can Help:

  • Spread the word to friends and neighbors about this campaign
  • Write City Council and ask them to Reach Out to Help EACH Out!
  • Send us a story or photo about how EACH helped you or your family.

story:
Short Summary

We are a brand new NGO aimed at increasing awareness around issues of technology addiction and promoting the responsible use of technology.

We love technology and appreciate all the amazing advantages that it brings us, but we also recognise some of the ways it can be harmful. So many of us are addicted to our phones, tablets, computers and gaming consoles that we believe, as a society, our relationship to technology has become unhealthy. 

And we want to do something about it.

Some of the issues we're working on include:

  • Developing programmes for those affected by cyberbullying
  • Helping build awareness and legislation around texting and driving and other issues of road safety linked to technology
  • Creating a network of support for those with gaming addictions
  • Building awareness around our every day use of technology, how it affects us and our relationships, and how we can make it healthier 
  • Developing school programmes to teach kids and teens about how to use technology in a healthy way
  • Corporate consulting programmes for businesses to help increase job satisfaction, productivity and maintain healthy work-life balance

Why We Need Your Help 

Here's the deal: we are currently a (very new) non-profit organisation. In the UK, a non-profit needs to have £5,000 in donations before it can register as a charity. Once we make the leap from non-profit organisation to an official bonafide charity, we are eligible to apply for lots of grants and funding that as a non-profit we can't apply for. 

All the funds we raise will simultaneously help us become a charity and will also help us develop awareness projects and educational programmes. So it's almost like you're making a donation towards two great causes. 

We can't express enough the magnitude of what reaching this goal would entail, how much it would help develop these programmes in the early stages, and how grateful we would be for the support. 

The Impact

Still not sure? Here are some of the reasons we think this is important: 

  • Addiction. 60% of teens and 37% of adults admit they are 'highly addicted' to their phones. 
  • 69% of kids have been affected by cyberbullying. (Bullying, in any form, can lead to greater instances of isolation, depression, decreased self-esteem, self-harm and suicide.)
  • Texting and driving makes us 23 times more likely to crash. (Hands-free devices aren't much better.)
  • Internet Gaming Disorder is being considered for inclusion in the DSM, which means gaming addiction may soon be classified as a mental disorder.
  • Prevalence. One study showed that 16-24 years olds consumed over 14 hours and 7 minutes of media per day and that adults consumed over 12 hours per day. Most of us reach for technology immediately when we wake up, have it with us throughout the day, and sleep next to it at night (if not literally with us in bed). 

We spend our lives surrounded by technology, and while it certainly makes things easier, we rarely pause to think about the drawbacks and the long-term effects of our consumption, which we don't yet fully understand. Until we understand the full implications of our technology use, we believe it is extra important to be aware of how much we use our devices and in what ways, so we can enjoy a healthy and moderated relationship to technology. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Our goal is to see people step back, be present, and appreciate all the amazing things that aren't on a phone or device. The simplest way you can help us is by doing just that: take a break from your phone, tablet and/or computer. (Some ideas: don't sleep next to it/use it as your alarm. Never use it while you're driving. Turn off notifications and only check your devices when you choose to. Turn it off on vacation. Remove social media apps--or other apps that distract you--from your phone. Ignore it while you're with your friends and family.)
  • Got another idea? Tell us about how you'll take a #techbreak on Twitter
  • Think this is a cool idea or important message? Spread the word: share our site or some of the things we're working on with your friends and family.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below! Easy

story:
My name is Emily and I am a student at George Fox University studying elementary education and Spanish. I believe reading is the foundation for all things, and it is essential for all areas of life; however, not all students have the same opportunities due to many circumstances: poverty, disabilities, language barriers, etc. The SMART (Start Making a Reader Today) program helps to support these children to create more confident and fluent readers. I strongly support the SMART reading program because I believe every child should have the opportunity to read; however, the program needs more books in the Newberg School District to accommodate the growing number of students in the area. In order for this tremendously impactful program to continue serving thousands of kids, more books are needed. 

Every child should be able to read & with your help, they can.

      

DID YOU KNOW, one third of North American children who enter kindergarten are not school-ready, and lack some of the skills needed for a successful learning experience. 

AND, those who are read to at least 3 times per week are almost twice as likely to score in the top 25% in reading than children read to less than 3 times per week. 

AND, 44% of American fourth grade students cannot read fluently, even when they read grade-level stories aloud under supportive testing conditions. 

AND, a student who cannot read on grade level by third grade is 4 times less likely to graduate by age 19 than a child who does read proficiently in third grade. Add poverty to the mix, and a student is 13 times less likely to graduate on time than his or her proficient, wealthier peer.

The SMART's proven program has been aimed at addressing these issues and preparing Oregon's children for educational success.

SMART is a non-profit organization preparing thousands of children across Oregon with vital one-on-one reading support and books for those who need them most. Volunteers help students become confident and successful readers, but without enough books to read, the students are unable to grow in their literacy abilities.


Thank you so much for your support, every dollar makes a difference!

story:
Mind Molders is a new upstart company founded by mathematics educator Hussain "Mathman H" Abdullah, whose mission is to provide tailored data driven instruction to each and every child who we come into contact with. Unfortunately, the reality of this type of one-on-one service is expensive and not accessible to all families. We offer virtual tutoring from Kindergarten through High School. 

Our virtual tutoring service is made up of two systems, one for childhood mathematics (K-6) and another for secondary algebra (5-12). Both programs are Common Core aligned and use data that allows an administrator insight into the gaps in understanding as well as strengths for each individual student. We offer weekly assignments based on data we collect from the student's access to either program.

Our goal with this campaign is to provide this service to every family regardless of their socio-economic status. 


The young lady in the photo above is one of our Grade 6 users who was able to benefit from a license that was provided to her free of charge. During her initial use of the virtual tutoring she was able to gain an average over 90 in math. This is a feat she had never previously achieved in her whole school career. Her story inspired us to try and replicate this success as many times as possible. 

You can read more about her success here --> Grade 6 Student of the Month

Virtual tutoring is $20 a month. To some that amount might seem like nothing to pay to ensure your child receives a quality education. To others that might be the last $20 in the grocery budget. 

*A special thank you to Mike from www.onlinegiftsfromtheheart.com who pledged 20% of the proceeds through February using the PROMOCODE: math to our campaign. Everyone feel free to shop til' you drop (it's for a great cause).

Hot off the presses. Caps that you can select if you donate $50 as our gift to you. More photos and perks coming soon.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY - Zero Tolerance in Greece

Hi and thanks for looking at our initiative. Please watch the video as it will give you a really good sense of what we are looking to accomplish through Zero Tolerance.

My name is Gaz Kishere and I have been working in community development for more than 25 years. The last 6 of these have been working in Counter Child Trafficking across Europe.

Through working with Cross Border Initiatives (www.crossborderinitiatives.org) and the International organisation Love146 (www.love146.org), I have largely been developing out of the box approaches and tools to protect children.

It all began for me with a 5,000 mile roadtrip following Europes Trafficking routes in the chilly winter of 2009.

It became clear to me on that trip, in each country visited, that it is the lack of self-esteem and basic awareness, that Trafficking exists, which is making recruitment by Traffickers the largest and most lucrative of all organized crimes in Europe. 

Through research and first hand experience, i know of communities where 90% of the girls approached will apply to adverts for obviously bogus jobs. There are communities where boys grow up aspiring to become pimps and traffickers as their number 1 job choice.

Change is possible, it has to be, children and young people in Europe and beyond are counting on it, are counting on us !

I am a strong believer that through creativity and innovation we can find new ways to impact this 'modern day' slavery.

We need to do what we can to protect children from joining the 1.2 Million new children being trafficked each year.


ZERO TOLERANCE

Im going to tell you about a youth culture magazine called Zero Tolerance which gives us privileged access to an audience of young people where we can:

·  Invest in young peoples self-esteem addressing vulnerabilities that will stop them becoming future victims of exploitation at home and abroad.

·  Sustain a campaign, breaking the taboos of silence for those experiencing abuse in institutions and family.

·  Help them become activists who stand against the exploitation happening in their own country.

·  Challenge cultural worldviews so that exploitation becomes unacceptable.

In my experience prevention is the most strategic response to Human Trafficking, both in terms of protecting vulnerable young people and confronting demand.

However, it seems the hardest to fund and it is individuals like you that make a critical difference to helping to birth fresh ideas.

Through creating multiple editions of Zero Tolerance and growing an online community of support, we believe we can take a generation of young people on a sustained journey of personal development and assure the freedom that all children deserve.

Zero Tolerance Edition 1 is ready to go to the printer and be distributed now!

We wanted to show you what we can actually accomplish, not just share our aspirations.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We are looking to raise funding for the following:

3 new editions of the magazine in year 1 @ $18,000                                                      (3 x 5,000 copies of each magazine)

Essential part time personnel to include designer and editor in year 1 @ $12,000

We have some great incentives to say thank you for your support, these can be found in the side column.

These include ZT Trucker Caps individually Graffiti’d by UK artist Trevor Loveys.

There are some unique recycled denim ZT DJ bags made by local Abolitionists.

One of the donations gets you a ZT designed color A4 ‘I WANT TO CHANGE THE WORLD’ poster of the Margaret Meade quote ‘Never doubt that a small group of committed individuals can change the world, in fact it is the only thing that ever has’.

Finally, you can also get a 20 minute personal or group skype call with Gaz Kishere to chat about his experiences of Human Trafficking, strategy development and stories about work on the ground in Europe and beyond.

All funds given will go directly towards putting these magazines in the hands of vulnerable young people and future change makers.

PLEASE SHARE THIS WITH YOUR FRIENDS – SPREAD THE WORD

story:
The N’DIGO Foundation is a 501(c)(3) private charity dedicated to rewarding excellence in education by awarding merit-based college SCHOLARSHIPS to Chicagoland graduating high school seniors. 

Since 1995, the N’DIGO Foundation began presenting merit-based college scholarships to students in partnership with numerous COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, corporations, foundations, community organizations and generous individuals. The N’DIGO Foundation has awarded nearly 300 scholarships since its inception.

Hermene Hartman is one of the most significant and influential Black women in American publishing. She serves as President and CEO of the Chicago-based Hartman Publishing Group, Inc. Her weekly column, "Publisher’s Page," provides social commentary on hot topics of the day. Her radio program, VIEWS OF THE HEART, appears on IHEART RADIO. She is a blogger for Huffington Post and ChicagoNow. 

N'DIGO, was founded in 1989,  realizing that the  life style of the Black middle class was missing from mainstream media. The very first profile of President Barack Obama appeared on NDIGO pages confirming   that we are the  authentic voice of the urbane.      N’DIGO is a weekly lifestyle publication with a  progressive and avant guarde  audience.  N'DIGO tells the story of those not told, untold, mistold and need to be retold. 

Ms. Hartman is founder and president of N'DIGO Foundation, a 501c3 (private charity)  began in 1995. It sponsors an annual Black Tie Gala, for the sole purpose of raising funds for educational pursuits.   It is rated as one of Chicago's best social events with key stakeholders and decision makers in the Chicagoland marketplace.  

From 2004 – 2007 Ms. Hartman served as president of the Alliance of Business Leaders and entrepreneurs (ABLE), a business group, dedicated to entrepreneurial pursuits, with 70 members and  collective revenues of nearly one billion dollars. She is the only woman to have served as President of the organization and the only President to have served two terms. 

Ms. Hartman received an M.B.A. from the University of Illinois, a M.A. degree in sociology an MPH with Honors from Roosevelt University and a B.A. from Roosevelt University. She has received more than 200 awards for outstanding achievement in media, business, community services, education, and communication. 

Prior to a  media career, Hartman was  a College Professor in the Social Sciences and Vice Chancellor of External Affairs at City COLLEGE Chicago.

See N'DIGO.com
