story:
Help us make a difference

The Flow Arts Commune of AfrikaBurn is a collection of like minded volunteers, who get together each year to undertake a tremendous project that aims to discourage superficial connection over real compassion.

Our goal is to foster awareness of and responsibility for the people around you.

We need your help to build our camp, fund workshops, facilitate massive group activities (like the Dance of a Thousand Flames) and buy teaching materials for group sessions.


What are the Flow Arts?

The Flow Arts refer to any artistic expression that encourages learning, growth and balance.

'Flow' is the uninterrupted movement of bodies, thoughts and feelings from one position to the next, or from one person to the next. From the flow of light, to the flow of dance. From the flow of music to the flow of air during yoga practice.

We aim to deconstruct the obstacles that inhibit the free flow of compassion between individuals by welcoming each and every person to join in a game or class or workshop or musical jam.

By working WITH others and sharing ourselves and our abilities we hope to create a new era of brotherhood and ONENESS among ourselves and ALL the people around us.


What we need & what you get

The Flow Arts Commune is a non-profit initiative, and all funds go towards building our camp, funding workshops, buying materials and promoting our message.

To say thank you for contributing to our cause, each donation will enter your name into a lucky draw for some incredible prizes. The winners will be announced at our final Flow Show Fundraiser event at the end of April. Exact date still to be confirmed.


Each person who contributes $3 or more will have their name added to a prize draw (Cape Town area only):

  • 1st Prize - A 1hr massage by the extremely talented Isolde Bennett, who is a professional Thai Massage Therapist and Body Work Practitioner
  • 2nd Prize - A 1hr Introduction to electronic music production by DJ Regardt van Zyl
  • 3rd Prize - A 1hr private class in a toy/prop of your choosing

Each person who contributes $6 or more will have their name added to a grand prize draw (Cape Town area only):

  • Grand Prize - A professional, three person fire dancing show for your next event. This an amazing prize with some of the countries' top performers!


Thank you for your support!


Follow our story and keep up to date with our different fire dancing events:

Our Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/FlowArtsCommuneAfrikaB...

More info on AfrikaBurn - http://afrikaburn.com/

story:
Short Summary

Our campaign is to raise funds to cover the shipping and handling for a 20-foot container, containing approximately 40,000 new children’s books in English being donated by International Book Bank.  We want to improve the level of English of not only our own students but also the students in other schools throughout Barrancabermeja.  We will accomplish this by introducing them to the wonderful world of reading.  Your donation will affect the lives of thousands of children for years to come by nurturing their natural thirst for knowledge with one of the most important things they need…something to read.  Reading not only can enrich the mind of a child and take them to faraway places it can also put them on the path to escape their world of low-level jobs or poverty.

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $22,000 dollars.  The money will be used to pay for the shipping and handling of a 20-foot shipping container from International Book Bank (http://www.internationalbookbank.org/).  Any additional funds raised will be used to buy more books.  If we do not reach our goal with INDIEGOGO, we will use whatever money we do raise to pay for the shipping of pallet loads of books, which will cost approximately $3,000 per pallet.

The Impact

Learning to speak English opens doors for the children of Barrancabermeja that a standard education in Barrancabermeja never will.  It also prepares them for a future in a world with a global economy.  Raising the funds in order to receive this donation of new books for our community’s children could provide as many as 25 schools in our community with almost 1,600 unique books in English!  CAN YOU IMAGINE the impact your donation will make when we raise the $22,000 dollars we need!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, get the word out.  Tell everyone in your social network about our project.  Link, post, share…anything you can think of.  The more people that know about our project the sooner we can get books in English into the hands of the children in our community.  If you are unable to help at this time, please think about donating your time to one of your local charities or donating books to the organization of your choice.  Darien Book Aid and International Book Bank are two groups that we have had the pleasure of dealing with.

We, the teachers, and administrators of Colegio Bilingüe Chester Palmer as well as the community of Barrancabermeja thank you for your time and support.

story:
Despite the multitude of media and information sources that have arisen in the decades since the beginning of the AIDS crisis, teens are still getting much of our sexual information from the same source we've always relied on: each other. Prevent & Prevail: An Open Engagement of Ideas about Sex, Empowerment, Identity, STD and HIV prevention aims to make the information from that source safer, more comprehensive and more accurate, empowering teens to overcome the obstacles to getting the sexual education we need. 

There is a communication crisis in the field of youth sexual education. Budget cuts, restrictive laws, and the critical condition of many U.S. schools are combining with the age-old problems of parental reluctance and community silence to produce a rate of HIV infection in teens and young adults that is the highest in any demographic group in the country. Teens of color and teens in other underserved populations,  queer and low-income teens, stand an even greater risk because the limited sexual education is available in school. These teens, are the ones, our program is committed to educate, the youth between 13-23.  

Racism, poverty, homophobia, and inadequate access to health care play an important role in increased HIV infections in the black community; youth need to learn to live a life of safety in order to live their aspirations. 



The youth who organized this program first began researching HIV infection and prevention on World AIDS Day in 2012. The more we learned about the position of youth in the struggle against HIV, the more we decided we wanted to make a change. If our parents, teachers and other mentors were failing to educate us, we would educate ourselves – and friends. We designed a program for peers that focused on our curiosity, questions, and feelings of invincibility. We wanted a program to address sexual feelings and relationships. We know when questions are not answered  we are more likely to turn to risky experimentation. 

Each Prevent & Prevail session is an open, facilitated discussion where participants can ask questions. Youth facilitators have 10+ hours of training and are supported by adult trainers and chaperones. Each run is a five weeks and made up of five sessions. Each session is two hours. Our topics include: relationships and intimacy, sex and pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, bullying, drug use, rape and abuse, STIs and STDs, laws, and information about stopping HIV in our community. 

We are dedicated to take Prevent and Prevail to community centers which are traditionally underserved by other youth organizations. 

To date, we have educated 140 youth between the age of 12-17 years. 

By contributing to Sexual Health Education, DYI, you will help us to;

  •   Expose youth from lower income areas information on STD and HIV infection.
  •   Introduce youth to the possibilities of youth development of programs
  •   Give the youth access ways to overcome obstacle to receive sexual education
  •   Foster critical thinking

This is how the funds are budgeted:

  • Participants: Each session has a maximum of 10 youth. Each is paid $10/session and there are five sessions.
  • Facilitators: Each session has two facilitators. Each facilitator is paid $20/session. 
  • Chaperons: Each session has one chaperon. Each chaperon is paid $30/session.
  • Training for facilitators and chaperons is the base pay.
  • Each session has a maximum of 10 participants.
  • Cookies and supplies
  • Transportation for participants and facilitators


These organizations partnered with Dedicated to Make a Change to create Prevent and Prevail; a true youth developed program. The Jim Toy Community Center in Ann Arbor, HIV AIDS Resource Center (HARC), S3 Safe Sex Store in Ann Arbor, and  Washtenaw County Health Department.

Visit http://dedicatedtomakeachange.com/ to learn more about our programs.

story:
THE STAR BOUTIQUE'S BACK TO SCHOOL SUPPLIES FUNDRAISER

Hello Star Boutique Supporters! As we gear up to kick off our Back to School Boutique session, we want to ensure that our participants not only have new confidence and new clothes this coming school year; but new supplies as well!

To support with making sure that EVERY participant leaves with a bag full of necessitates, we are raising funds to purchase the following items:

- School Supplies: Book bags, pens, pencils, calculators, notebooks, folders, paper, journals, highlighters etc.

-Hygienic Products: Soaps, deodorant, lotions, body spray, powder, feminine napkins, toilet paper, cosmetics/beauty products etc.

-Refreshment/Snacks

As little as $5 will go a LONG way! Donate today! 

Thank you in advance for your donation.

Best,

The Star Boutique Team

story:
What is StaxTeam ?

For Individuals

 It is an intelligent job search platform and Professional Social Network for individuals. It is a Career Portal for job seekers to search and match their skills to the right opportunities. It is a platform which provides you Virtual Workspace to work from anywhere in the world.

For Businesses

 It is a Complete Enterprise Cloud Solution with advanced analytical and predictive capabilities to find and manage the best talents. A solution which will bring all your enterprise needs under one roof. It is a revolutionary solution which will improve your productivity and reduce your costs.

Final Result

A professional social network integrated with enterprise solution to improve the quality of work environments and professional engagements. A next generation intelligent platform which suggests you the best decisions for your future and not just sharing.

Help US to Help YOU !

  • The requested funding will be used to form a passionate and skilled team to develop, maintain and support the solution.
  • All the people who assist in our fundraising campaign will receive our premium features in the system for a fixed period.
  • How much ever we raise even if we don't reach our goal will go towards the development of the system, because we are passionate and truly believe that our solution will help a lot of people in securing a job and utilize their talents to the maximum. 
  • We need your help to make our dream a reality, so that we can assist others to fulfil their dreams.

The Impact

We believe our system will have huge impact in the world, this will make companies rethink their policies on hiring a new skilled person.

Imagine an ecosystem where people don't have to worry about commute time to and from the office, able to join their dream company even if it is in another continent and being able to be part of the best companies in the world and work with them without compromising any quality of work.

For example, A mother of a toddler or a person with disability will be able to work from the comfort of their home and still be able to provide quality work on time. 

This is what we are trying to achieve, a platform for interaction, job search, hiring and get recognized and paid as same as any other person in the industry.

The Hiccups

As similar to every software development project there exists common risks and challenges with StaxTeam too. We have experienced them before and we will overcome them.
There are few challenges which are unique to StaxTeam, they are as follows and we are confident to resolve them:
  • Breaking the stigma of physical work space: Even though in few industries physical presence is not required, managers and team leads prefer to have physical presence of a person. The change requires convincing and the trend in current technologies like BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) etc.. is pointing towards the change. 
  • Team Work Experience: Maintaining a good team is essential to any organization, we strive to make our collaboration module in the system to be as perfect as providing the physical presence. We believe we can provide a good experience for people who join the company and people who provide the work.
  • Technological Challenges: By far the most challenging part is providing the virtual workspace solution which can be tied to the corporate network. Even though this is the final phase of the project, it is very important to StaxTeam, we are working on the solution to this problem and are in touch with experts from the various fields. We are confident that with more experts working on the issue we can resolve it and the campaign will assist us in doing so. 

Eddy's Story !

Eddy is a productive ninja from the StaxTeam world. He tries to help the human kind to make their world a better place!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We want to help the ones in need, but we are the ones in need now. So please support the campaign, spread the word and use Indiegogo share tools to make this campaign a success.
